Abstract: This paper proposes a hierarchical cooperative control scheme to ensure stable operation of islanded dc microgrid (MG) clusters in high renewable energy sources (RES) penetration scenarios. This scheme can be divided into two levels. In the primary level, a cooperative method based on the local bus voltage information is presented, by which the distribution generators (DGs) and the energy storage system (ESS) in each MG can be coordinated together to regulate the local bus voltage within a certain range. In the secondary level, an adaptive droop method for each MG is introduced to control the power flow of the tie-line among the multiple MGs. Moreover, the reference for the operation of the ESS is automatically adjusted to accommodate the changes of DGs' droop characteristics, which are caused by the adaptive droop control. The effectiveness of the hierarchical cooperative control scheme for MG clusters is verified by MATLAB/Simulink simulations. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: dc microgrid clusters; hierarchical cooperative control; power flow control; tie-line; voltage regulate

Title: Research on Operation and Control of Distributed Wind and Storage Power Supply

Abstract: This paper designs a small-scale wind power and energy storage DC microgrid system operating in autonomous condition, in view of the shortage of power energy and the abundant of wind energy at remote areas. The bipolar-type distribution system can reduce the bus voltage to ground and meet the requirements of various converters and loads. The voltage balancer contributes to balance bus voltage between positive and negative. The wind turbine and hybrid energy storage system (HESS) operate in optimal model with different conditions. The system operation is divided into five patterns, and the wind turbine, HESS and loads are coordinated controlled, which can ensure the stability of the DC bus voltage and the reliability of the power supply. The simulation results validate that this system operation is reliable and the control strategy is effective. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: A Nonlinear Least Squares Method of Energy Storage Systems for Wind Power Fluctuations Smoothing
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Power Electronics and Application Conference and Exposition, PEAC 2018

Abstract: Wind farms must comply with requirements of grid-connected standards, the power fluctuations limit is one of the most challenging requirements. A promising solution to mitigate the impact of wind power fluctuations is to employ battery energy storage systems (BESSs) at the grid connection point of the wind farm. This paper proposes a nonlinear least squares method to smooth wind power fluctuations by using BESSs. The proposed method can minimize the sum of output power squared errors and reduce the size of the BESSs required to smooth the wind power fluctuations. Simulation results show that the proposed control method returns better results in smoothing the wind power fluctuations compared to linear least squares and moving average method. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Dynamic Parameter Identification of Mathematical Model of Lithium-Ion Battery Based on Least Square Method
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Power Electronics and Application Conference and Exposition, PEAC 2018

Abstract: Battery as energy storage equipment plays an important role in social life and industrial production. Lithium-ion batteries have already been widely used in different power demand occasions because of excellent performance. The battery management system (BMS) is the critical part of lithium-ion battery applications. Accurately estimating battery status is the core function of BMS, which relies on the battery model and parameters of model identification. In order to obtain the dynamical parameters precisely online, this paper modifies Shepherd mathematical battery model and decouples connectivity of model parameters to facilitate iterative calculation. Then use least squares method to track the state change of lithium-ion battery in real time through dynamic parameters estimation. The validity is demonstrated by simulation and experiment. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Research on the Typical Working Condition of Energy Storage Batteries for a Wave Energy Converter
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Power Electronics and Application Conference and Exposition, PEAC 2018

Abstract: The power profile of the energy storage batteries in a wave energy converter is variegated and time-consuming, so it is very difficult to be implemented in the laboratory for aging study. This paper reports a simplification method, the main idea is to divide the power sequence into several segments, each of which is replaced by a representative power, while the cumulative probability of the simplified power profile remains the same distribution as the original. NSGA-II algorithm is utilized to obtain the optimal solution of the segmentation parameters. The schedule of an accelerated aging test is finally obtained. It is simpler and easier to be implemented on the battery tester in laboratory. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Song J., Liu S., Wan R.
Title: A 400kHz Current-Fed Bi-directional DC-DC Converter with Coupling Inductor
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Power Electronics and Application Conference and Exposition, PEAC 2018
Affiliations: China State Shipbuilding Corporation System Engineering Research Institute, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Song, J., China State Shipbuilding Corporation System Engineering Research Institute, Beijing, China; Liu, S., China State Shipbuilding Corporation System Engineering Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wan, R., China State Shipbuilding Corporation System Engineering Research Institute, Beijing, China
Abstract: Energy storage devices are usually used to improve the power quality and reliability of the power supply system. A 400kHz current-fed bi-directional DC-DC converter adopting coupling inductor is investigated. The converter can achieve ZVS at full range of loads with high efficiency and the ripple current of inductor at low voltage side is small. The operation principle and control strategy are summarized. The working and coupling mode of the inductor at battery side is analyzed in detail. The problems encountered in the process of increasing switching frequency of the converter are analyzed and the corresponding solutions are given. A prototype of 1kW/400kHz bi-directional DC-DC converter is developed, and the theoretical analysis is validated by the experimental results. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: bi-directional DC-DC converter; coupling inductor; high frequency

Authors: Mbuwir B.V., Kaffash M., Deconinck G.
Title: Battery Scheduling in a Residential Multi-Carrier Energy System Using Reinforcement Learning
Source title: 2018 IEEE International Conference on Communications, Control, and Computing Technologies for Smart Grids, SmartGridComm 2018
Affiliations: ELECTA-ESAT, KU Leuven, Belgium
Authors with affiliations: Mbuwir, B.V., ELECTA-ESAT, KU Leuven, Belgium; Kaffash, M., ELECTA-ESAT, KU Leuven, Belgium; Deconinck, G., ELECTA-ESAT, KU Leuven, Belgium
Abstract: Motivated by the recent developments in machine learning and artificial intelligence, this work contributes to the application of reinforcement learning in Multi-Carrier Energy Systems (MCESs) to provide flexibility at the residential level. The work addresses the problem of providing flexibility through the operation of a storage device, and flexibility of supply by considering several infrastructures to meet the residential thermal and electrical demand in a MCES with a photovoltaic (PV) installation. The problem of providing flexibility using a battery is formulated as a sequential decision making problem under uncertainty where, at every time step, the uncertainty is due to the lack of knowledge about future electricity demand and weather dependent PV production. This paper proposes to address this problem using fitted Q-iteration, a batch Reinforcement Learning (RL) algorithm. The proposed method is tested using data from a typical Belgian residential household. Simulation results show that, an optimal interaction of the different energy carriers in the system can be obtained using RL and without providing a detailed model of the MCES. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: fitted Q-iteration; flexibility; reinforcement learning.
Index Keywords: Decision making; Electric batteries; Electric power transmission networks; Housing; Iterative methods; Machine learning; Smart power grids; Virtual storage; Batch reinforcement learning; Detailed modeling; Electrical demand; Electricity demands; fitted Q-iteration; flexibility; Optimal interactions; Sequential decision making; Reinforcement learning

Authors: Arimborgo R., Espinoza E., Power G., Quispe G., Merino J.C.A.
Title: Solar Heating for Alpaca's Sheds in Peruvian Andean Region
Source title: 2018 Congreso Internacional de Innovacion y Tendencias en Ingenieria, CONIITI 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Facultad de Ingeniería, MINATEC Campus, Universidad Peruana de Ciencias Aplicadas (UPC), Lima, Peru
Authors with affiliations: Arimborgo, R., Facultad de Ingeniería, MINATEC Campus, Universidad Peruana de Ciencias Aplicadas (UPC), Lima, Peru; Espinoza, E., Facultad de Ingeniería, MINATEC Campus, Universidad Peruana de Ciencias Aplicadas (UPC), Lima, Peru; Power, G., Facultad de Ingeniería, MINATEC Campus, Universidad Peruana de Ciencias Aplicadas (UPC), Lima, Peru; Quispe, G., Facultad de Ingeniería, MINATEC Campus, Universidad Peruana de Ciencias Aplicadas (UPC), Lima, Peru; Merino, J.C.A., Facultad de Ingeniería, MINATEC Campus, Universidad Peruana de Ciencias Aplicadas (UPC), Lima, Peru
Abstract: Because of frost in high Peruvian andean areas die alpacas (having reported more of 160 000 deaths in 2015), which can be avoided with suitable sheds. Faced with this reality, it was constructed of a prototype with solar air heating, which has been tested and calculated for use in these sheds with favorable results. During the investigation the heat transfer required by the shed was analyzed, for keep the alpacas in a closed environment at 10°C. It is worth mentioning that there are alpaca communities that supports temperatures of up to -20°C in the Altiplano area. The research was conducted in the district of San Juan de Tarucani in Arequipa and in the district of Ocuviri in Puno. The proposed model permits to keep the alpacas more protected in a warm environment using renewable energy with a system of heat storage for the low temperatures at the nights. As a result of the research, with the development of the proposed solar collector, it is possible to increase the temperature internal of the shed in an ideal range of 5°C. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: alpaca's sheds; heating systems; renewable energy; solar collectors
Index Keywords: Heat storage; Solar collectors; alpaca's sheds; Andean Region; Closed environment; Heating system; Low temperatures; Renewable energies; Solar air heating; Solar heating

Authors: Yu Y., Tao S., Dubrova E.
Title: Comparison of CRC and KECCAK Based Message Authentication for Resource-Constrained Devices
Source title: 2018 16th IEEE International New Circuits and Systems Conference, NEWCAS 2018
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Sweden
Authors with affiliations: Yu, Y., School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Sweden; Tao, S., School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Sweden; Dubrova, E., School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Sweden
Abstract: With the growth of Internet-of-Things (IoT), billions of low-end devices become connected to provide new services appealing to users. The value of the information to which these devices have access via network is increasing, too, making them an attractive target for cyberattacks. Low-end IoT devices typically have very limited computing, storage and energy resources. Therefore, it is not always possible to use conventional cryptographic algorithms for their protection. In this paper, we investigate whether a cryptographically secure Cyclic Redundancy Check (CRC)-based Message Authentication Code (CMAC) and a KECCAK-based Message Authentication Code (KMAC) satisfy limitations of resource-constrained IoT devices. We implement the 128-bits CMAC and the 128-bits KMAC in 65nm CMOS and compare their performance. To our best knowledge, no hardware implementations of CMAC and KMAC have been presented so far. Our evaluation shows that, for 1.2V operating voltage and clock frequencies above 1 MHz, the CMAC128 is at least 32 times more area-efficient and at least 21 times more power-efficient than the KMAC128. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Authentication; Cryptography; Energy resources; Cryptographic algorithms; Cyclic redundancy check; Hardware implementations; Internet of Things (IOT); Message authentication; Message authentication codes; Operating voltage; Resourceconstrained devices; Internet of things

Authors: Li F., Qin W., Han X., Wang P., Wang Y., Wang Q., Zhang S.
Title: Hierarchical Control Strategy of Hybrid Slack Terminals in DC Micro-grid
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: Shanxi Key Lab of Power System Operation and Control, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, F., Shanxi Key Lab of Power System Operation and Control, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Qin, W., Shanxi Key Lab of Power System Operation and Control, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Han, X., Shanxi Key Lab of Power System Operation and Control, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Wang, P., Shanxi Key Lab of Power System Operation and Control, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Wang, Y., Shanxi Key Lab of Power System Operation and Control, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Wang, Q., Shanxi Key Lab of Power System Operation and Control, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Zhang, S., Shanxi Key Lab of Power System Operation and Control, Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China
Abstract: In order to regulate the voltage fluctuation in DC micro-grid through different types of slack terminals, a hierarchical control strategy for hybrid slack terminals is proposed. Firstly, based on the idea of the best cycle depth of charging/discharging, the dual lithium batteries(A and B) are applied as the basic energy storage units. Super-capacitor (SC) is adopted to operate as a buffer device taking advantage of its high ramp rate performances. And the superior main DC bus is taken as the backup support with its high power. Then, the output power of the dual lithium batteries is controlled according to the super-capacitor voltage signal. In dynamic balance, the super-capacitor voltage can characterize the magnitude of the low frequency components of the DC bus voltage. Thus, there are four different hierarchies on the basis of the super-capacitor voltage signal. Four corresponding operation modes are designed to make every slack terminal obtain energy allocation efficiently. Finally, the effectiveness of the proposed control strategy is verified by the experimental results. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DC micro-grid; Dual lithium batteries; Hierarchical control; Slack terminals; Super-capacitor voltage

Authors: Xia Y., Liu J., Yu M., Wei W., Peng Y., Zhu J., Yu X.
Title: Generation-Storage Coordination Control in DC Microgrids
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; State Grid Beijing Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100075, China
Authors with affiliations: Xia, Y., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Liu, J., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Yu, M., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Wei, W., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Peng, Y., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Zhu, J., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100075, China; Yu, X., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100075, China
Abstract: In dc microgrids, the renewable energy sources (RESs) and storages are the critical components to maintain the normal operation. Therefore, the coordination control between the generations and storages is very important. In this paper, a decentralized control method is proposed to realize the generation-storage coordination based on the dc bus signaling. The proposed control method can regulate the output power of RESs in time to maintain the power flow under some extreme conditions. Furthermore, through the modified droop control, multiple storages can balance their state-of-charges (SOCs) to prevent the overuse of a certain storage. Then, the reliability of the system can be significantly enhanced. The simulation results confirm the effectiveness of the proposed control method. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Chattopadhyay D., Bankuti M., Bazilian M.D., De Sisternes F., Oguah S., Sanchez M.J.M.
Title: Capacity Planning Model with CSP and Battery
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Authors with affiliations: Chattopadhyay, D.; Bankuti, M.; Bazilian, M.D.; De Sisternes, F.; Oguah, S.; Sanchez, M.J.M.
Abstract: Thermal storage in Concentrating Solar Power plants (CSP) and battery storage are still relatively expensive options to support renewable energy generation, but may offer significant flexibility benefits. This paper discusses a new formulation for embedding all three typical sub-components of a CSP plant (namely, solar field, storage, and power block in a solar tower configuration) in a long-term expansion planning model so that these are co-optimized. The proposed formulation can be accommodated in standard linear/mixed-integer linear programming (LP/MIP) models. A set of two illustrative case studies is used to demonstrate how selection of CSP capacity may be optimized using the proposed formulation, and how it may be influenced by factors such as: its ability to provide spinning reserve, presence of competing options such as a combination of PV and battery storage, and policy targets on renewables. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Karambelkar S., Mackay L., Chakraborty S., Ramirez-Elizondo L., Bauer P.
Title: Distributed Optimal Power Flow for DC Distribution Grids
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: Delft University of Technology, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Karambelkar, S., Delft University of Technology, Netherlands; Mackay, L., Delft University of Technology, Netherlands; Chakraborty, S., Delft University of Technology, Netherlands; Ramirez-Elizondo, L., Delft University of Technology, Netherlands; Bauer, P., Delft University of Technology, Netherlands
Abstract: DC distribution grids are an option for future smart grids in order to directly connect distributed energy resources like photovoltaics, storage, electric vehicles and loads that already use dc internally. Due to the increased installed power capacity, voltage deviations and line congestion are likely to occur. Exact optimal power flow with locational marginal prices (LMP) is a way of tackling this problem.In this paper a fully distributed solution for the exact optimal power flow problem in dc distribution grids is presented. It uses the consensus and innovations approach and includes line losses as well as line current limits and over- and under-voltage bounds. Zero marginal cost and linear cost functions for generators and loads are possible in addition to quadratic cost functions. A simulation example shows initial results on a 4-node test network. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Vdovina E., Lie T.T.
Title: Optimal Sizing of PV, Battery Storage for Vava'u Island Distribution Network
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: Dept. Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Auckland University of Technology, Auckland, New Zealand
Authors with affiliations: Vdovina, E., Dept. Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Auckland University of Technology, Auckland, New Zealand; Lie, T.T., Dept. Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Auckland University of Technology, Auckland, New Zealand
Abstract: This paper presents the development of an algorithm to determine the optimal sizing of a photovoltaic (PV) power plant with an Energy Storage System (ESS). The design is developed for the largest island of Vava'u in Tonga to make the total replacement of the existing diesel system. The proposed methods are briefly discussed and the basic equipment, such as PV panels, PV inverter, battery storage and Power Conversion System (PCS), are selected and estimated based on the current market. The paper also focuses on the voltage profile improvement of Vava'u island power distribution network by integrating a shunt capacitor with the optimal size and location. Power flow analysis in the MATLAB platform is used for this purpose. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Liu Z., Miao S., Fan Z., Chao K., Kang Y.
Title: Coordinated Power Allocation and Robust DC Voltage Control of UPQC with Energy Storage Unit during Source Voltage Sag
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, Z., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China; Miao, S., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China; Fan, Z., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China; Chao, K., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China; Kang, Y., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China
Abstract: The unified power quality conditioner (UPQC) combines the function of series and shunt active filters to enhance the electric power quality. Reasonable power allocation and robust DC voltage response are essential requirements of UPQC during compensating the source voltage sag. Motivated by this objective, this paper presents a control scheme for UPQC based on an improved UPQC-Q power allocation strategy and sliding mode control of DC side voltage. The prominent features of the proposed scheme are: 1) The active power needed for compensating the voltage sag is eliminated and the feeder current is reduced during the source voltage sag; 2) The VA loading of the series and shunt converters are controlled to be maintained within the rated capacity range; 3) The sliding mode control of DC voltage can effectively suppress the external disturbance and improve the robustness of UPQC during source voltage sag. Theoretical analysis and simulations in PSCAD/EMTDC are presented to validate the effectiveness of the proposed control scheme. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Coordinated power allocation; Energy storage unit; Robust control; Unified power quality conditioner
Index Keywords: Energy storage; Quality control; Robust control; Sliding mode control; Analysis and simulation; Coordinated power; Electric power quality; Energy storage unit; External disturbances; Power allocation strategies; Shunt active filters; Unified power quality conditioners; Power quality

Authors: Chen G., Liu D., Cheng H., Zhang Y.
Title: Self-Recovery Capability of Power System and Its Application in Active Power Optimal Scheduling
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, G., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Liu, D., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Cheng, H., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Zhang, Y., Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China
Abstract: Conventional optimal active power dispatch is usually suitable to deterministic operation condition. However, with large-scale wind farms integrated into the power system, much more spinning reserve capacity is required due to the intermittence and randomness of wind power. In this paper we aim to propose a reasonable scheduling strategy of energy storage stations (ESS) and thermal generators to deal with uncertainty during actual operation. Firstly, we define self-recovery capability of power system to evaluate system's robustness under two major scenes based on two linear programming models respectively. Then we propose an active power optimal scheduling model based on self-recovery capability to enhance recovery ability of the power system with large-scale wind farms. A numerical example and its results demonstrate that the proposed self-recovery capability and the optimal scheduling model is able to enhance the robustness of power system by sparing itself with abundant regulating ability, which can quickly response to reduce wind power curtailment and balance power shortage. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy storage station; Large-scale wind farm; Optimal scheduling; Power shortage; Self-recovery capability; Wind power curtailment.

Title: A Bi-level Programming Model for Distribution Network Expansion Planning with Distributed Generations and Energy Storage Systems
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: National Key Laboratory of Power Systems in Shenzhen, Graduate School at Shenzhen, Tsinghua University, Shenzhen, 518055, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, H., National Key Laboratory of Power Systems in Shenzhen, Graduate School at Shenzhen, Tsinghua University, Shenzhen, 518055, China; Shi, L., National Key Laboratory of Power Systems in Shenzhen, Graduate School at Shenzhen, Tsinghua University, Shenzhen, 518055, China; Ni, Y., National Key Laboratory of Power Systems in Shenzhen, Graduate School at Shenzhen, Tsinghua University, Shenzhen, 518055, China
Abstract: A novel optimization model for distribution network expansion considering the construction of distributed generation (DG) and energy storage system (ESS) simultaneously is proposed in this paper. This proposed model consists of the upper-level sub-problem involving the long-term investment decisions and the lower-level sub-problem involving the short-term operation strategies. Several typical day scenarios are designed to deal with the uncertainties of load demand and DGs including wind generation together with photovoltaic unit. A bilevel programming method combing the improved genetic algorithm (IGA) with the mixed integer linear programming (MILP) is applied in the solution of the proposed optimization model. Finally, case studies are carried out on the 16-bus system as benchmark to achieve a variety of planning scheme options. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Xie R., Chen Y., Li F., Wang Z., Mei S.
Title: Operationally Constrained Optimal Dispatch of Multiple Pulsed Loads in an Isolated Microgrid
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Xie, R., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Chen, Y., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Li, F., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Wang, Z., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Mei, S., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Abstract: Some isolated microgrids supply electricity for multiple pulsed loads, which consume tremendous energy in a short period. Usually, it is hard for an isolated microgrid to maintain stable when serving many pulsed loads directly and randomly. This paper proposes a novel energy supply strategy under some operational constraints in a single-bus microgrid from load perspective. Firstly, the charging circuit with supercapacitors before pulsed loads is presented. Then, an optimization model is introduced, which maximizes the power supply utility in a specified period by adjusting the charging process of energy storage system. Furthermore, three kinds of operational constraints are considered: the upper and lower bounds of times for pulsed loads supply, the non-constant upper bound of total charging power, and the completeness of charging process. Particle swarm optimization algorithm is used to find an optimal strategy. A case with 8 pulsed loads shows the efficacy of the proposed model and algorithm. © 2018 IEEE.

Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Electric power systems; Energy storage systems; Micro grid; Model and algorithms; Operational constraints; Optimization modeling; Particle swarm optimization algorithm; Pulsed load; Upper and lower bounds; Particle swarm optimization (PSO)

Authors: Cheng Y., Zhang N., Kang C.
Title: Bi-Level Expansion Planning of Multiple Energy Systems under Carbon Emission Constraints
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Laboratory of Low Carbon Energy, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Cheng, Y., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Zhang, N., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Kang, C., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China, Laboratory of Low Carbon Energy, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Abstract: Coordinating multiple energy systems (MES) is able to exploit synergies of different energy sectors including the generation, transmission, conversion, storage and consumption. The goal of low-carbon development changes the way how the MES should be designed in both district level and multi-regional level. A bi-level integrated expansion planning model of MES to consider district carbon emission constraints is proposed in this paper. The upper-level model investigates the optimal planning of the multi-regional MES. Meanwhile, the lower-level model studies the least-cost planning of multiple energy infrastructures in the district MES under the carbon emission constraints based on the energy hub (EH) approach. The carbon emission flow (CEF) theory is adopted to account the responsible carbon emission of each EH. The case study based on an illustrative multi-regional MES verifies the effectiveness of the proposed model. The effects of carbon emission cap on the planning results are further studied. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Barrett E., Thayer B., Pal S., Studarus K.
Title: Sensitivity of Emissions Estimation to Generation Dispatch Ordering in GridPIQ
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Authors with affiliations: Barrett, E.; Thayer, B.; Pal, S.; Studarus, K.
Abstract: The variable operating cost of electric generators and operational constraints determine the generator dispatch order, i.e. the order in which generator units are operated (or "dispatched") to meet electrical demand. Due to decreases in the cost of natural gas and increases in the penetration of non-dispatchable generation, some of the traditional paradigms regarding dispatch order are changing. Although it is a fair assumption that emissions consequences will be changed by the order in which power plants are dispatched, there has been little research to find out the extent of this change. In this paper, the Grid Project Impact Quantification tool (GridPIQ) has been used to investigate the sensitivity of emissions estimates to the dispatch order of the generating units based on their operational characteristics and fuel types. By making different underlying assumptions about generation dispatch across different regions in the United States and then calculating the impacts of the same grid projects, this analysis provides insight into how dispatch ordering drives regional CO 2 , SO 2 and NO x emissions. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy storage; Environmental factors and smart grids.; Generator dispatch stack; Power systems

Authors: Wang S., Wang H.
Title: Affine Method for Multi-objective Optimizing Configuration of Battery Energy Storage System
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: Key Laboratory of Smart Grid of Ministry of Education, Tianjin University, Tianjin, 300072, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, S., Key Laboratory of Smart Grid of Ministry of Education, Tianjin University, Tianjin, 300072, China; Wang, H., Key Laboratory of Smart Grid of Ministry of Education, Tianjin University, Tianjin, 300072, China
Abstract: In this paper, an affine method considering both randomness of the wind power and the load for multi-objective optimizing configuration of battery energy storage system (BESS) is proposed. According to the method, affine arithmetic is used to solve the uncertain power flow and the network loss, the voltage improvement rate (VIR) and the BESS cost are chosen as the objective functions. New metrics are provided to distinguish the dominance relation between two affine numbers and an improved particle swarm optimizing algorithm is also proposed to get the final Pareto optimal solution set. The IEEE 14-bus transmission system is studied to demonstrate the effectiveness and the efficiency of the method. Case results suggest that the Pareto optimal solution set achieved by the method can effectively solve the problem of the results, which lack diversity and comprehensiveness, in the existing methods. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Chen Q., Xia M., Chen M., Hu H.
Title: Distributed Energy management for Integrated Energy System Considering Multiple independent Operators
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting

Abstract: In this paper, an improved energy hub (EH) model integrating electric and heat energy storage and solar thermal collector is proposed for integrated energy system (IES). The IES is regarded as a multi-operator system in which all the EHs belong to different operators. Based on the multi-operator structure, an energy management model considering electric and heat energy storage operation cost is presented as a distributed framework. The results of two contrastive simulation cases have verified the performance in energy bill and transmission loss reducing and energy storage life prolonging. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Wang X., Bie Z., Liu F.
Title: Optimal Expansion Planning of Multi-energy Generations and Natural Gas Storages in Integrated Energy System
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Smart Grid Key Laboratory of Shaanxi Province, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, 710049, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, X., State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Smart Grid Key Laboratory of Shaanxi Province, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, 710049, China; Bie, Z., State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Smart Grid Key Laboratory of Shaanxi Province, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, 710049, China; Liu, F., State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Smart Grid Key Laboratory of Shaanxi Province, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, 710049, China
Abstract: Regional electrical distribution network, natural gas network and heat network are interconnected closely with the combined heat and power (CHP) and electrical boiler (EB) to form the integrated energy system (IES). The distributed natural gas storages belonging to system are supposed to smooth the gas demand curve and decrease operation cost. In this paper, an optimal expansion planning model for multi-energy generations and natural gas storages in IES is proposed. Since the multiple energy flow (MEF) constraints are highly nonlinear and nonconvex, some piecewise linear approximations are adopted to manage the nonlinearity of MEF constraints to reformulate the mixed integer linear programming (MILP) model. The planning model would optimally determine appropriate investment candidates for CHPs, EBs and natural gas storages. A modified integrated energy system case is evaluated by simulating operation of typical day in winter and summer to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed planning method. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Yang Q., Ding T., Ma W., Zhang H., Jia Z., Tian W., Cao Y.
Title: Decentralized Joint Power-Gas-Heat Economic Dispatch for Global Energy Internet in Northeast Asia
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China; State Grid Yangquan Power Supply Company, Yangquan, 045000, China; China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, 210003, China

Abstract: These years have witnessed the increasing popularity of global energy internet, which plays a significant role of the energy revolution. There are various forms of energy utilized in the global energy internet, such as electrical power, natural gas, and heat, and the integrated dispatch of them is of great importance. This paper proposes a model of joint power-gas-heat economic dispatch for global energy internet, which applies Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers (ADMM) to realize decentralization. Heat storage devices and gas contracts are considered in the model, which corresponds to combined heat and power (CHP) and gas-fired units. Renewable energy sources including wind power and photovoltaic power are also taken into account to make the formulation more realistic. Case studies of energy internet in Northeast Asia are performed to verify the effectiveness of decentralized method and for further analysis. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Decentralized economic dispatch; Global energy internet; Multi-energy system; Renewable energy sources

Authors: Karthikeyan N., Pokhrel B.R., Pillai J.R., Bak-Jensen B.
Title: Utilization of Battery Storage for Flexible Power Management in Active Distribution Networks
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: Department of Energy Technology, Aalborg University, Denmark
Authors with affiliations: Karthikeyan, N., Department of Energy Technology, Aalborg University, Denmark; Pokhrel, B.R., Department of Energy Technology, Aalborg University, Denmark; Pillai, J.R., Department of Energy Technology, Aalborg University, Denmark; Bak-Jensen, B., Department of Energy Technology, Aalborg University, Denmark
Abstract: Integration of energy storage in power distribution systems is expected to be high in the future to manage the power variations from decentralized renewable energy resources and meet the load demand reliably. In this paper, utilization of battery storage by the distribution system operator for peak shaving, reduction of network power loss and network congestion management is addressed for a low-voltage active distribution network. An optimal control method for battery storage based on model predictive control is proposed to minimize the peak PV power injection to the grid also considering the network power loss reduction and battery degradation. The proposed method solves a linear optimal power flow formulation to calculate the battery active and reactive power set points at each time step. The proposed method is useful in accommodating maximum PV power without violating the network voltage and current limits. Simulation studies are conducted using Matlab on a Danish low-voltage distribution network. The simulation results show that the proposed control method is effective for reducing the peak PV power in-feed with minimum network power loss and battery degradation. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Hu X., Xu G., Cheng H., Wang L., Liu Y., Cai Y.
Title: Joint Planning of BESS and DR for industrial consumers participating in peak-shaving
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Guangzhou Power Supply, Guangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Hu, X., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Xu, G., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Cheng, H., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Wang, L., Guangzhou Power Supply, Guangzhou, China; Liu, Y., Guangzhou Power Supply, Guangzhou, China; Cai, Y., Guangzhou Power Supply, Guangzhou, China
Abstract: The peak-load shaving in industrial parks (IPs) presents more complicated than that in residential or commercial districts because of the irregular distribution of peak-valley and two-part tariff (TPT). In this paper, a joint planning method of battery energy storage systems (BESS) and demand response (DR) designed for exploring the feasibility of industrial consumers participating in the peak-load shaving in IPs distribution system is proposed. This bi-level optimization method considering both planning and operation provides a systemic solution which determines the optimal installed capacity of BESS, layout of BESS and joint economic dispatching of BESS and DR, concurrently. The solving process is implemented under the TPT electricity market circumstance, and the annual time-series curve and duration load curve are utilized instead of a typical scenario to deal with the irregular distribution of peak-valley and improve the accuracy of solution. An 11-buses IP distribution system located in Guangdong Province in the south of China is utilized as the study case to verify the validity of proposed method. Finally, the feasibility of industrial consumers participating in the peak-shaving via joint investment of BESS and DR is discussed. © 2018 IEEE.

Index Keywords: Investments; Battery energy storage systems; Demand response; Industrial parks; Peak load; Two-part tariff; Battery storage

Authors: Vo T., Nguyen P.
Title: Amsterdam ArenA Stadium: Real-time Smart Battery Energy Storage System Coordination for Voltage Support
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Technology Eindhoven (TU/e), Eindhoven, 5600MB, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Vo, T., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Technology Eindhoven (TU/e), Eindhoven, 5600MB, Netherlands; Nguyen, P., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Technology Eindhoven (TU/e), Eindhoven, 5600MB, Netherlands
Abstract: In the recent years, the share of electricity production from solar photovoltaic (PV) and consumption of electric vehicles (EVs) have increased to significant levels in several power systems across Europe and the Netherlands. In order to improve the energy supply security, large-scale battery energy storage systems (BESS) are considered as vital means to provide backup resources and to effectively exploit solar generation. A smart coordination of these BESS is hence required to ensure the power quality while the lifetime of BESS is extended. This paper addresses the voltage issue of a Dutch DSO (Alliander N.V.) medium voltage network around the Amsterdam Arena stadium and studies the potential solutions that could apply to the BESS to be installed in the year 2018 at Arena. Detailed models of system and controllers are verified by real-time power system emulator Opal-RT and DIgSILENT/Power Factor while the effectiveness of potential solutions is assessed using actual operation network topology and historical customer electric loads and solar irradiance. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Sinha R., Jensen B.B., Radhakrishnan Pillai J.
Title: Impact Assessment of Electric Boilers in Low Voltage Distribution Network
Source title: IEEE Power and Energy Society General Meeting
Affiliations: Dept. of Energy Technology, Aalborg University, Denmark
Authors with affiliations: Sinha, R., Dept. of Energy Technology, Aalborg University, Denmark; Jensen, B.B., Dept. of Energy Technology, Aalborg University, Denmark; Radhakrishnan Pillai, J., Dept. of Energy Technology, Aalborg University, Denmark
Abstract: Flexibility from the electricity supply, with high share of intermittent energy sources such as wind and solar, has been offered by combined heat and power (CHP) generation in Denmark for decades. There could be periods where the fuel prices are higher than the electricity prices (even -ve), during high wind production and is idle for electric boilers (EBs) operation. In the future, using EBs, excess electricity from wind turbines can be effectively utilized for heat production, and still meet the thermal demand by decreasing CHP production. Thus, there is need for demand side flexibility that is expected to increase through power-to-heat technologies using electric boilers.This paper aims to assess the potential of EBs, modelled with simple stratified layers in the storage system, and as smaller units of distributed flexible loads in their individual houses in Denmark. The models of EB in LV-residential grids were simulated to assess the use of EBs to analyze their capacity as well as flexibility as active loads, under various electricity and thermal load profiles of the individual houses during winter. Subjected to high heat and electricity demand in weak grids, flexibility of EBs units with local control incorporated based on grid voltages, restricts the operation of EBs but ensures operation of the distribution system within limits still trying to keep the thermal comfort in the houses. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: New system for nitrites and nitrates detection from natural water sources
Source title: 2018 IEEE Biomedical Circuits and Systems Conference, BioCAS 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: IMT-Bucharest, Bucharest, Romania; ICF 'Ilie Murgulescu', Bucharest, Romania; NANOM MEMS, Rasnov, Romania

Abstract: The research paper will present a new energy autonomous system based on micro electrochemical sensors and ultra-thin solar cells, for concentration measurement of different ionic species in natural water sources. It focuses on the following directions: a) new microsensors for detection of nitrites and nitrates in natural water sources and b) low cost autonomous energy system integration and fabrication. The microsensors for nitrates/nitrites and heavy metals will be of electrochemical type, miniaturized, fully integrated, fabricated by micro - nano technology and connected to the electronic module that is providing detection, data acquisition and interpretation and data display. The chronoamperometry and voltammetry characterisation will be presented and the results in nitrites and nitrates detection will be provided. The energy harvester is including a UTSC, a dedicated storage and a power stabilizing device. SnO 2 , TiO 2 , ZnO, Pt-Au alloy, FTO materials have been optimised for sensors and solar cells. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Hierarchical Optimal Operation for Integrated Energy System Based on Energy Hub

Affiliations: College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, 210098, China; Department of Engineering Mechanics, NARI Group Corporation/State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, 211000, China; Economic Research Institute, State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang, 110015, China; Hou, Y., Economic Research Institute, State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang, 110015, China; Sun, Y., College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, 210098, China
Abstract: The integrated energy system(IES) has the characteristic of energy integrated/multi-energy coupling which involves heat, electricity, natural gas, and other various energy forms, which can realize maximize the synergistic effects and complementary benefits among various energy and the comprehensive utilization. In this paper, the day-ahead hierarchical optimal operation for IES coupling natural gas system, electricity transmission system and district heating system based on energy hub(EH) is studied. Firstly, the model architecture of EH with diversified storage devices, renewable energy and different energy conversion equipment is proposed and the steady state mathematical model of different energy networks in IES is developed, respectively. Secondly, the day-ahead operating cost of EH is minimized by optimizing strategy to maximize the benefits of all kinds of energy demand users, where different types of energy power input into EH can be obtained. Then, the day-ahead optimal operation mode for IES considering minimization of operating fuel cost index is proposed via energy management system giving various energy power data which are uploaded from EH. The numerical case verifies the validity of the day-ahead hierarchical optimal operation and steady state calculation analysis for IES. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Guo Y., Ma W., Meng J., Wang Y.
Title: A Virtual Inertia Control Strategy for Dual Active Bridge DC-DC Converter
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Storage and Microgrid of Hebei Province, Key Laboratory of Distributed Energy, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, China; Global Energy Interconnection Research Institute, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Transmission Technology, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Guo, Y., Storage and Microgrid of Hebei Province, Key Laboratory of Distributed Energy, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, China; Ma, W., Global Energy Interconnection Research Institute, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Transmission Technology, Beijing, China; Meng, J., Storage and Microgrid of Hebei Province, Key Laboratory of Distributed Energy, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, China; Wang, Y., Storage and Microgrid of Hebei Province, Key Laboratory of Distributed Energy, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, China
Abstract: Dual active bridge (DAB) DC-DC converter replaces the Buck/Boost circuit for its advantages such as electrical isolation, buck and boost in voltage with high ratio and high-power applications, which has been widely used in energy storage systems. In view of the DC bus voltage vulnerable to power fluctuation in DC micro-grids, a virtual inertial control method for DAB DC-DC converter is proposed in this paper. Analogized with the virtual synchronous generator to be introduced to increase the inertia of the AC microgrid, the virtual inertia control is proposed on the basis of the original dual phase shift control of the converter. When the power in a DC microgrid fluctuates, the energy storage system will provide inertia power support to strengthen the DC microgrid inertia and suppress the DC bus voltage fluctuation. In the proposed inertia control, the first-order inertia link is used to substitute the differential link to avoid high-frequency interference to the input signal. Finally, the DC microgrid model is built by Matlab/Simulink and the time domain simulation is carried out. It has been verified that the control strategy put forward can suppress abrupt change of the DC bus voltage during power fluctuation effectively, but slow down its recovery process. Appropriate control parameters can make the proposed control strategy work better. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DC microgrid; Dual active bridge(DAB) DC-DC converter; dual-phase-shift control; virtual inertia control
Index Keywords: Electric inverters; Electric power system control; Energy storage; MATLAB; Time domain analysis; Dc micro-grid; Dual active bridges; Dual phase; Electrical isolation; Energy storage systems; High frequency interference; High power applications; Time-domain simulations; DC-DC converters

Authors: Zhang D.
Title: Study on the Effects of Different Measures in Promoting Renewable Energy Consumption
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Global Energy Interconnection Research Center, State Grid Energy Research Institute. CO. LTD., Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, D., Global Energy Interconnection Research Center, State Grid Energy Research Institute. CO. LTD., Beijing, China
Abstract: Large-scale renewables integrated into power grid has been an inevitable developing trend worldwide. This paper studied investment and operational costs of power system with high penetration of renewables by using the improved time series system production simulation analysis method. The supply cost of the whole system are taken as objective, and the curtailment of wind and solar generation is considered in optimization process by using a punishment function. Three different regulating measures, i.e., by increasing regulation depth of interconnection lines, by increasing capacity of energy storage and gas-fired power units, and by increasing deep-shaving ability of thermal power units, are considered and studied to show economical differences of the system while meeting the large-scale renewables integration requirements. Research results show that to build more energy storage and other flexible power units is an expensive way to solve intermittent and fluctuant problems caused by renewables integration. And the way to make good use of the regulating potential of thermal power units and cross-regional connecting lines can get the same effects with lower costs. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: cross-regional interconnection lines; curtailment; renewable energy; system cost

Abstract: According to demands for highly reliable energy storage converter system, a modular medium voltage transformerless structure with redundant fault-tolerance is designed, which specifies its treatment procedure of redundant tolerance faults. The reliability and redundant fault-tolerance of the modular system is analyzed. Simulation and experiment results show that the system can satisfy the requirement of redundancy and fault-tolerance. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Cui X., Zhang Z., Tang G., Zhang H.
Title: Seamless Switching Control Strategy for Diesel Generator and Energy Storage Hybrid Emergency Power Supply System
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: North China Electic Power University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Cui, X., North China Electic Power University, Beijing, China; Zhang, Z., North China Electic Power University, Beijing, China; Tang, G., North China Electic Power University, Beijing, China; Zhang, H., North China Electic Power University, Beijing, China
Abstract: The hybrid emergency power supply system composed of a diesel generator and a battery energy storage system(BESS) will complete seamless switching from power grid to BESS at the moment of power grid failure. After a short term power supply BESS needs to transfer power to the diesel generator. In order to ensure the quality of power supply during switching process, seamless switching from BESS to diesel generator is needed. In this paper, the constant voltage and constant frequency control strategy is proposed to stable the frequency and amplitude of the output voltage when BESS works separately. After the diesel generator is put into operation, it provides stable voltage amplitude and frequency support for stand-alone system, therefore, only the power control of the converter is needed, and the output power is gradually reduced according to the reference value of the given power. Then the load is transferred to the diesel generator gradually, and seamless switching from BESS to the diesel generator is completed. The simulation model of the seamless switching process of the hybrid emergency power supply system is built in this paper. In view of the difference between amplitude and frequency of diesel generator voltage and their rated values in the quasi synchronization grid connection, a control strategy for timely switching control mode is worked out. The simulation results show that the control strategy can ensure the uninterrupted power supply for the load and the seamless switching from BESS to the diesel generator. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: BESS; constant voltage and constant frequency control strategy; diesel generator; hybrid emergency power supply system; seamless switching
Index Keywords: Electric power supplies to apparatus; Electric power system control; Electric power systems; Electric power transmission networks; Energy storage; Power control; Switching; BESS; Constant frequency; Diesel generators; Emergency power supply; Seamless switching; Electric machine control

Authors: Xu Y., Wu M., Qu X., Wang J., Li J., Xu Z.
Title: Two-stage coordinated scheduling strategy of a distribution network considering energy storages
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Power Distribution Institute, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; State Grid Chongqing Electric Power Company, Chongqing, China; State Grid Chongqing Electric Power Company, Electric Power Research Institute, Chongqing, China
Authors with affiliations: Xu, Y., Power Distribution Institute, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wu, M., Power Distribution Institute, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Qu, X., Power Distribution Institute, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wang, J., State Grid Chongqing Electric Power Company, Chongqing, China; Li, J., State Grid Chongqing Electric Power Company, Electric Power Research Institute, Chongqing, China; Xu, Z., Power Distribution Institute, China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China
Abstract: In this paper, considering the forecast error of wind power, a two-stage coordinated scheduling strategy considering energy storages is proposed. In the first stage, according to the day-ahead forecast information of wind power, the day-ahead dispatch model is established based on the wind power scenarios, in which the aim is to minimize the expected daily operational cost of the distribution network. In the second stage, based on the latest short-term forecast information of wind power, the energy storage participates in the intra-day scheduling to minimize the power deviation. The simulation results show that through the two-stage coordinated scheduling strategy, the energy storage can not only reduce the operational cost of the distribution network, but also smooth the power fluctuations and improve the flexibility of the distribution network. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: In order to improve the energy efficiency and achieve the purpose of energy saving ad pollutant emission reductions, a model of solar combined cooling heating and power (CCHP) system integrated with energy storage is presented. The indices of prime energy consumption, environment and economy are established and formed as a comprehensive evaluation index using the judgment matrix method. A two-stage optimal planning and design method is applied to optimize the capacity design and operation strategy of CCHP system. The simulation results demonstrate that the comprehensive performances of the solar CCHP system in prime energy consumption and pollutant emission are better than that of the separation production. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Guo Y., Zhang H., Cui K., Zhaojuan
Title: Life-Cycle Low Carbon Simulation of Smart Distribution Network Considering Power Loss
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Distribution Network Planning and Design Department, State Grid Economic and Technological Research Insititute, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Guo, Y., Distribution Network Planning and Design Department, State Grid Economic and Technological Research Insititute, Beijing, China; Zhang, H., Distribution Network Planning and Design Department, State Grid Economic and Technological Research Insititute, Beijing, China; Cui, K., Distribution Network Planning and Design Department, State Grid Economic and Technological Research Insititute, Beijing, China; Zhaojuan, Distribution Network Planning and Design Department, State Grid Economic and Technological Research Insititute, Beijing, China
Abstract: In order to cope with today's climate change and energy crisis, green and low-carbon is an inevitable trend in the electric power development in the future. Smart distribution network is one of the important means in reducing carbon emission of the power system. The research on the relationship of the carbon emission in different stages of the life-cycle of smart distribution network is significant for the green environment-friendly and low-carbon development of the power system, as also the research of the methods to reduce carbon emission. Currently, most of the calculation theories of carbon emission are based on the lossless network, but the practical power system is lossy, so it is necessary to study the calculation method of the carbon emission flow in the full life-cycle of smart distribution network with the consideration of power loss. In the background of low-carbon power system, this paper analyzes the influence of distributed generators (DGs), energy storage systems (ESS), EV chargers on carbon emission of smart distribution network. Considering the access of DGs, ESS and EV chargers on smart distribution network, a life-cycle theory of carbon emission flow is proposed. Suggestions for the low-carbon operation mode of smart distribution network is proposed. The IEEE 33-node distribution system is used to validate the feasibility of the method. An example of a practical smart distribution network in Shanghai is taken at the end. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: carbon emission flow; life cycle; low carbon; power loss; smart distribution network

Authors: Liu Z., Zhao Y., Li L., Li H.
Title: Economic Analysis of Compressed Air Energy Storage System and its Application in Wind Farm
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Jibei Electronic Economic Research Institute, Beijing, 100038, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, Z., State Grid Jibei Electronic Economic Research Institute, Beijing, 100038, China; Zhao, Y., State Grid Jibei Electronic Economic Research Institute, Beijing, 100038, China; Li, L., State Grid Jibei Electronic Economic Research Institute, Beijing, 100038, China; Li, H., State Grid Jibei Electronic Economic Research Institute, Beijing, 100038, China
Abstract: With the increasing application of energy storage technology in power grid, the traditional chemical energy storage technologies such as kinds of batteries have exposed the problems of low capacity, high cost and short service life. Compressed air energy storage system (CAES) provides a promising large-scale and low-cost energy storage solution. In this paper, the key technologies of compressed air energy storage system are analyzed, and an new economic model is established, which takes into account the life cycle cost, direct income and potential income, to analyze the economic efficiency of compressed air energy storage system. At the same time, a control model of compressed air energy storage system based on filter is proposed and the simulation proves that it is effective in the application of stabilizing wind farm power output fluctuation. The research in this paper can provide a reference for the pricing and operation of compressed air energy storage system in power grid. © 2018 IEEE.

Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Corporation of China, State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Xi'An Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Xi'an, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, N., State Grid Corporation of China, State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Jiang, Y., State Grid Corporation of China, State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Liu, Z., Xi'An Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Xi'an, China
Abstract: Cross time zone grid interconnection is the key part of global energy interconnection. Different time zones have certain complementarities in load demand and new energy power output. In power systems with high new energy power generation proportions, cross time zone grid interconnections are more important. The complementary features of cross time zone load demand and new energy power output are quantified in this paper, and the peak-shaving benefits brought by the cross time zone interconnections are calculated. A combined inter-country cross time zone power system planning between China and Germany is carried out on this basis, while the economic competitiveness of interconnected grid regulation, peak-shaving power supply, pumped storage and battery energy storage are compared. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: cross time zone complementarity; grid interconnection; power system planning; regulation resources
Index Keywords: Battery storage; Competition; Electric power system economics; Electric power system interconnection; Electric power transmission networks; Battery energy storage; Complementary features; Economic competitiveness; Grid interconnections; Interconnected grid; Power system planning; regulation resources; Time zones; Electric power system planning

Authors: Rizvi S.A.A., Xin A., Masood A., Iqbal S., Jan M.U., Rehman H.
Title: Electric Vehicles and their Impacts on Integration into Power Grid: A Review
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China
Authors with affiliations: Rizvi, S.A.A., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; Xin, A., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; Masood, A., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; Iqbal, S., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; Jan, M.U., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; Rehman, H., Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China
Abstract: The exponential rise in electricity demand has become the primary reason of generating electricity from various new sources. Up until now, fossil fuels were the major source for generating power but it has changed drastically in recent years. Vehicles commonly used in today's world run solely on fossil fuels (i.e. gasoline, diesel, liquefied petroleum etc.) and their prodigious usage hints at the current over reliance on them. Fossil fuels are non-renewable and consequently, the existing transportability prototype is rendered untenable. Effects of energy shortage, meteoric decline in fossil fuel reserves along with environmental issues have diverted attention towards Electric vehicles. Electric vehicle is now the center of the attention and is termed as the future of transportability model. Use of Electric vehicle gives multiple advantages that include more use of renewable energy, less use of non-renewable energy sources, clean environment and energy storage options. Electric vehicles are capable of serving a dual purpose in terms of distributed storage units and loads both upon their integration with the power grid. Increased use of EVs, despite solving several problems has brought with it some new problems for power system and the grid. In this paper a brief review of Electric vehicles and their effects on power quality and power grid has been presented. In addition to this, a detailed review of impacts of EVs charging and discharging to grid is presented too. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: electric vehicle; power quality; renewable energy sources; V2G
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Electric vehicles; Fossil fuels; Gasoline; Power quality; Proven reserves; Renewable energy resources; Vehicle-to-grid; Clean environment; Distributed storage; Electricity demands; Energy shortages; Environmental issues; Non-renewable energy sources; Renewable energy source; Use of renewable energies; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Wu Y., Yan H., Wu J., Li D., Lin K.
Title: Air conditioning system optimization scheduling algorithm considering building energy storage characteristics
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, China; China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Wu, Y., School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, China; Yan, H., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wu, J., School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, China; Li, D., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Lin, K., School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, China
Abstract: In order to improve the comfort level of power consumers when their air conditioning systems participate in demand response and linearize the energy optimization problem of the air conditioning system to reduce the difficulty of solving it, an air conditioning system optimization scheduling algorithm considering demand response is proposed. This algorithm considers the energy storage characteristics of the building where the air conditioner is located and establishes a new air conditioning system optimization scheduling model; by introducing a new temperature variable, the energy optimization problem of air conditioning system is transformed from nonlinear optimization problem to linear programming problem; allowing the air conditioner to operate in a constant temperature mode within the user-specified time to improve user comfort; further reduce the minimum scheduling time interval of air conditioning to improve the scheduling flexibility of the air conditioning system; finally, according to the outdoor temperature of a region on the typical days in different seasons, a contrast experiment between 4 different scheduling strategies was implemented using Matlab. Simulation and experimental results show that the proposed algorithm can greatly improve the user's comfort while reducing the user's electricity bill. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: air conditioning system; demand response; energy management; linear programming
Index Keywords: Domestic appliances; Electric energy storage; Energy management; Linear programming; MATLAB; Nonlinear programming; Scheduling; Scheduling algorithms; Conditioning systems; Demand response; Energy storage characteristics; Linear programming problem; Non-linear optimization problems; Scheduling flexibility; Scheduling strategies; Temperature variables; Air conditioning

Authors: Zhang X., Wei W., Ni L.
Title: DC Voltage Control of AC/DC Hybrid Distribution Network with Low-Speed Distributed Wind Energy Conversion Systems
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Nanjing Institute of Technology, School of Electric Power Engineering, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, X., Nanjing Institute of Technology, School of Electric Power Engineering, Nanjing, China; Wei, W., Nanjing Institute of Technology, School of Electric Power Engineering, Nanjing, China; Ni, L., Nanjing Institute of Technology, School of Electric Power Engineering, Nanjing, China
Abstract: In order to promote the development of low-speed wind sites close to the load center, an AC/DC hybrid distribution system with low-speed distributed wind energy conversion systems (LD-WECS) was constructed in matlab/simulink. An improved control strategy was proposed to solve the DC bus voltage fluctuation caused by low-speed and high-turbulence wind. In the improved control strategy, the hybrid energy storage system (HESS) was installed in front of the DC bus of wind energy conversion systems (WECS), and the feed forward control based on the predicted wind power was used to control the output power of HESS, maintaining the power of DC bus, therefore, DC bus voltage will be more stable. The results show that the improved strategy can stabilize DC bus voltage under high-turbulence wind speed effectively. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: AC/DC hybrid distribution system; battery; low-speed distributed wind energy conversion systems; super capacitor; voltage control
Index Keywords: Energy conversion; Rectifying circuits; Speed; Turbulence; Voltage control; Wind; battery; DC voltage control; Distributed wind energies; Distribution systems; Hybrid energy storage systems (HESS); Improved controls; Low speed winds; Wind energy conversion system; Wind power

Authors: Chen J., Yan T., Kizhnerman E., Yin H., Zhang M.-X., Hui D.
Title: Numerical Analysis and Optimization on Shunt Losses in a Multi-Stack VRFB System
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: China Electric Power Research Institute, State Key Laboratory of Operation and Control of Renewable Energy and Storage Systems, Beijing, China; Beijing Golden Begonia Technology Co., Ltd., China

Abstract: Relative to conventional self-contained battery technologies, there are many advantages for VRFB using on large, utility-scale bulk energy storage application. During design the large scale VRFB system, the reduction of shunt current has always been focused on. The paper explored a stacks string model based on MultiSim™ software package to analyze and optimize shunt loss. Numerical analysis and optimization result express that the extra pipe resistance breaks the straight-line manifold voltage distribution, the degree of voltage redistribution depends on the resistance of stack feed piping, and shunt geometry optimization ranges are often limited by constrains and considerations. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Ding H., Zhang W., Chen M., Li S., Hou T., Zhou X., Fu Y., Liu Z.
Title: Multi-Objective Optimial Configuration of Distributed Wind-Solar Generation Considering Energy Storage
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Economic Research Institute, State Grid Hubei Electric Power Company Limited, Wuhan, China; Dept. Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China

Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Liu, Z., Dept. Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China
Abstract: Because of the randomness and volatility of the wind-solar power, their integration into grid is limited. An optimal configuration model of distributed wind-solar power generation system is suggested, which includes the total cost of operation, the economic loss of voltage sag and the inhibitory effect of distributed wind-solar power supply fluctuation under the effect of energy storage equipment. The validity of the proposed model is verified in the improved IEEE-33 node simulation system, by combining the improved PSO (Particle Swarm Optimization) algorithm with TOPSIS (Technique for Order Preference by Similarity to an Ideal Solution) of combination weighting. Simulation results show the suggested optimal model can effectively reduce the net loss, the economic loss of the voltage sag and the fluctuation of the output of the DG, and it can improve the economy and stability of the system by considering the time series characteristic of the distributed wind-solar power output and the coordination effect of the energy storage device. © 2018 IEEE.
