Authors: Wang Y., Zhao D., Yin J., Yang M.
Title: An Interconnected Power Grid Active Power Control Performance Evaluation Method Considering Energy Storage Frequency Modulation
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; JiangSu Electric Power Company, State Grid Corporation of China, NanJing, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, Y., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Zhao, D., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Yin, J., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Yang, M., JiangSu Electric Power Company, State Grid Corporation of China, NanJing, China
Abstract: With the energy storage cooperatively participating in AGC of the interconnected power grid, this paper proposed energy storage acti power control performance evaluation standard. called ES (energy storage) standard, for multi-area power grid. The index was a combination of the basic ideas of both NERC's control performance standard (CPS)and unit control performance standard (UCPS). The ES standard used the energy output factor of energy storage to reflect the energy storage participation in the active control and constrained the power grids AGC behaviors with the energy storage cooperatively participating by generalized area control error. The standard evaluated two kinds of different AGC control objectives. It can be used to guide the energy storage active power control method. Finally, the comparative analysis was run for the active control guidance of the ES standard and CPS through simulation. The simulation results show that compared with the CPS, the ES standard promotes the energy storage balance the frequency fluctuations coordinately with AGC units in power grid. It is more adapt to evaluate the energy storage active power control performance. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: active power control; CPS; energy storage load; ES standard; multi-area; UCPS
Index Keywords: Electric power system interconnection; Electric power transmission networks; Energy storage; Frequency modulation; Power control; Active power control; Comparative analysis; Control performance standards; Evaluation standard; Frequency fluctuation; Interconnected power grid; Multi areas; UCPS; Electric power system control

Authors: Liu G., Liang X., Liu L., Luo L., Wang X., Liu M.
Title: Design and Optimization of an Axial-flux Half Air-core Compensated Pulsed Alternator Used for Energy System Integration
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Hunan Electric Power Corporation Maintenance Company, Changsha, China; Huazhong University of Science and Technology (HUST), Wuhan, China

Abstract: The Novel Compensated Pulsed Alternator (NCPA) is one of the most promising development direction on the field of the Energy System Integration (ESI). The basic topology of the Axial-flux Half Air-core Compensated Pulsed Alternator (AHACPA) has been designed in this paper and the basic structure of AHACPA is analyzed by using finite-element method (FEM). Then, the magnetomotive force, partial saturation, leakage factor, compensated disk thickness and designed parameters is optimized to achieve high fundamental value of the air-gap flux density and Increase energy storage density. Most simulation results were in line with designed value. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Hanan M., Ai X., Salman S., Yousaf W., Asghar E., Javed M.Y.
Title: Multi-operating Modes Based Energy Management Strategy of Virtual Power Plant
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical, Beijing, China; School of Control Computer Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Department of Electrical, Computer Engineering COMSATS, University Islamabad, Lahore, Punjab, Pakistan
Authors with affiliations: Hanan, M., Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical, Beijing, China; Ai, X., Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical, Beijing, China; Salman, S., Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical, Beijing, China; Yousaf, W., School of Control Computer Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Asghar, E., School of Control Computer Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Javed, M.Y., Department of Electrical, Computer Engineering COMSATS, University Islamabad, Lahore, Punjab, Pakistan
Abstract: In this paper, a Virtual Power Plant (VPP) consists of a solar photovoltaic (PV) system, a wind turbine (WT) power generation system and an energy storage system (ESS) that is proposed in order to extenuate the utilization of fossil fuels on account of global warming and to cope with the increasing demand of electrical energy. These inexhaustible energy sources and the ESS are integrated to a common AC bus via double stage interfacing power converters. Multi-operating modes are generated by an Energy Management Strategy (EMS) that contingent on solar, wind and load power to control the scheduling operation of loads during dynamic weather and load conditions in order to avoid from blackout which is a primary focus of this paper. The PV and WT power generation systems are contemplated as the main sources of energy that satisfy the load demand in a regular manner whereas the battery is used only as a backup for the exigency. The modelling and the simulation of the presented VPP system are carried out under MATLAB/SIMULINK software. Simulation outcomes are shown and discussed that unveils the effectiveness and performance of the designed EMS. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy Management; Micro-grid; Simulink; VPP

Authors: Salman S., Xin A., Masood A., Ullah Jan M.
Title: Overview of Storage System and EV Aggregation Charging Behavior in Energy Market
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewble Enegy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Salman, S., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewble Enegy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Xin, A., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewble Enegy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Masood, A., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewble Enegy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Ullah Jan, M., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewble Enegy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Abstract: The Electrical vehicle (EV) technology is gaining popularity; it is because of many factors like reduction in carbon and green gas and usage of vehicle batteries as a storage element in the power system. However, the increasing usage of auxiliary loads i.e. EV and heat pumps creates adverse effects on the grid. Flexibility of power consumption due to uncertainty in modern day grid requires some storage elements. In this paper an overview of modern day grid is presented. Moreover the charging scheduling of Aggregators EVs battery is addressed. The mathematical formulation for generalization of EV, battery energy storage system (BESS) is presented with the constraints. Finally the case study for multi aggregator charging schedule generation is presented which can also be extended to a generalized modelling of storage system with different new energy sources in the future. The required results and the proposed mathematical modelling shows the effectiveness of the solution towards a more modern day grid friendly environment. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zhao H., Hu E., Wang Z., Song X., Guo J., Shen Z., Xing Y., Ren F.
Title: Optimal Configuration of Grid Connected Microgrid Considering CCHP and Analysis of Energy Saving and Emission Reduction
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Economic and Electrical Research, Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Measurement Center of Shanxi Electric Power Company, Taiyuan, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, H., Economic and Electrical Research, Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Hu, E., Economic and Electrical Research, Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Wang, Z., Economic and Electrical Research, Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Song, X., Economic and Electrical Research, Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Guo, J., Economic and Electrical Research, Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Shen, Z., Economic and Electrical Research, Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Xing, Y., Economic and Electrical Research, Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Ren, F., Measurement Center of Shanxi Electric Power Company, Taiyuan, China
Abstract: Considering the combined cooling, heating and power (CCHP)supply, the grid connected microgrid can utilize clean energy such as wind energy, photovoltaic energy and the waste heat recovering of micro-gas turbine after power generation, and supply cooling and heating to users, so it has better energy saving and emission reduction effect. In this paper, an optimal economic operation model of microgrid with net present cost as the optimization objective is established for the microgrid system consisting of wind turbine, photovoltaic cell, micro-gas turbine, waste heat boiler, storage battery and cooling, heating and electric load. The optimal configuration scheme is obtained by using HOMER. The energy saving and emission reduction effects of the system are verified by comparing the optimal scheme and the situation that the load is only supplied by the grid. Through the sensitivity analysis of the waste heat utilization rate of the micro-gas turbine with the optimal scheme, the benefit of improving the waste heat utilization rate is illustrated. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Wang N., Wang Y., Cheng Y., Zhang X.
Title: Distributed Wind Turbine Integrating Energy Storage System Optimal Planning Based on Trilateral Interest Subjects
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shandong Electric Power Company, Jinan, China

Abstract: The integration of distributed generation may have a great impact on the stable operation of power system. Aimed at the distributed wind turbine (WT) integrating energy storage system (ESS) planning in medium voltage distribution network, an optimal planning method considering the benefits of distribution network company, WT owner and power consumer is proposed. Besides, a scheduling strategy adopting the reactive power adjustment capacity of WT inverter and power control system of ESS is presented. The demand response is also considered in the proposed method. The planning model is solved by NSGA-II, and more practical schemes of the site and capacity of distributed WT and ESS as well as the trading price between distribution network company and WT owner can be acquired. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Wei-Chun G., Huan-Huan L., Yuan J., Gui-Ping Z., Shun-Jiang W., Cui D.
Title: Flexible Adjustment Method for Power Grid with High-Proportion Clean Energy
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang University of Technology, Shenyang, China; State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang, China

Ltd., Shenyang University of Technology, Shenyang, China; Yuan, J., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang, China; Gui-Ping, Z., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang, China; Shun-Jiang, W., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang, China; Cui, D., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang, China
Abstract: Aiming at the influence of the access of high-proportion clean energy into the power grid, a comprehensive regulation model for such multiple energy as hydropower, thermal power, time-shiftable load, battery energy storage, electric thermal storage and nuclear power as well as the tie line and frequency was proposed. Through combing the operational characteristics, the operation process of power grid was divided into normal regulation domain, abnormal regulation domain and emergency control domain, and the unconventional peak regulation of thermal power unit was classified into the abnormal regulation domain. The flexible adjustment precaution calculation and monitoring method for the power was established, which could provide the basis for the monitoring and control of the operation of power grid. The results show that the characteristics of each stage in the operation of power grid are different, and the required adjustment variables are also different. Similarly, the characteristics of each operation variable are different. Therefore, the division of three operational domains is in line with the actual operation of power grid. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: The Causes of Fire and Explosion of Lithium Ion Battery for Energy Storage
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings

Abstract: Lithium batteries have been rapidly popularized in energy storage for their high energy density and high output power. However, due to the thermal instability of lithium batteries, the probability of fire and explosion under extreme conditions is high. This paper reviews the causes of fire and explosion of lithium-ion batteries from the perspective of physical and chemical mechanism. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Huang X., Liu Y., Liao Y., Jiang Z., He J., Li Y.
Title: Modeling of Distributed Energy System with Multiple Energy Complementation
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Conghua Power Supply Bureau, Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co. Ltd., Guangzhou, China; Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co. Ltd., Guangzhou, China; School of Chemistry and Chemical Engineering South China, University of Technology, Guangzhou, China

Ltd., Guangzhou, China; Jiang, Z., School of Chemistry and Chemical Engineering South China, University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; He, J., School of Chemistry and Chemical Engineering South China, University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Li, Y., Conghua Power Supply Bureau, Guangzhou Power Supply Bureau Co. Ltd., Guangzhou, China
Abstract: The energy flow in energy utilization system is becoming increasingly complex due to the decarbonization tendency of primary energy consumption structure and the application of energy storage technology. There are main issues on how to establish the basic configuration of distributed energy system with multiple energy complementation and how the system can coordinate the start-stop and operation on variable load of the device to achieve maximum economic benefits. Starting from the basic configuration of energy utilization system, it is proposed in this paper that the distributed energy system with multiple energy complementation is a new energy system where natural gas is used as the main primary energy combined with renewable energy at local to satisfy different terminal users. Taking the method of stepwise decomposition and modeling, a superstructure model is established through the integration of different energy conversion technology and combination of different transformation, which can coordinate the energy flow and energy balance constraint in the subsystem such as energy generation, energy conversion and energy storage. Meanwhile, the maximum performance factor indicator is taken as the objective function and the energy balance is chosen as constraint to optimize installation capacity and hourly operation strategy. The established model is applicable to research of energy strategy of distributed energy system with multiple energy complementation and both the planning and designing of the scientific, reasonable and reliable comprehensive energy. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: complementation ofmultiple energy; distributed energy system; Energy Internet; multi-objective; optimization model
Index Keywords: Energy balance; Energy storage; Energy utilization; Natural gasoline plants; Complementation; Distributed energy systems; Energy internet; Multi objective; Optimization modeling; Energy conversion

Title: Daily Economic Optimal Dispatch of Energy Router Considering the Voltage of Distribution Network
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings

Ltd., State Grid Corporation of China Hangzhou, China; Yin, W., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Co. Ltd., State Grid Corporation of China Hangzhou, China
Abstract: With the development of distributed generation and the emergence of flexible loads such as energy storage (ES) and electric vehicle (EV), the control variables of power flow in low voltage distribution network have been increasing. In this paper, the optimal control of a multiport 'PV -ES-EV' energy router (ER) is analyzed. Based on its operation characteristics and the power usage requirements, a daily economic optimal dispatch model is established, which takes minimum cost of the whole system as the objective function while considering the voltage regulation of the distribution network. Finally, a study case is constructed based on actual time of use (TOU) price. And the proposed ER based optimal dispatch strategy is compared with the traditional peak load shifting strategy based on common energy storage system in several aspects. It is proved that the proposed strategy can fully utilize the potential of flexible loads, guarantee the power quality of the distribution network and promote the economy of energy consumption. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: electric vehicle; energy router; energy storage; optimal dispatch; time of use
Index Keywords: Electric load flow; Electric power distribution; Electric vehicles; Energy storage; Energy utilization; Voltage distribution measurement; Voltage regulators; Energy routers; Energy storage systems; Low voltage distribution network; Objective functions; Operation characteristic; Optimal dispatch; Time of use; Time of use prices (TOU); Electric load dispatching

Authors: Wei J., Xiao M.
Title: Stochastic Stability Analysis of the Power Systems Based on Lyapunov Function
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Mathematical and Physical Science, North China Electric Power University Beijing, Beijing, 102206, China
Authors with affiliations: Wei, J., School of Mathematical and Physical Science, North China Electric Power University Beijing, Beijing, 102206, China; Xiao, M., School of Mathematical and Physical Science, North China Electric Power University Beijing, Beijing, 102206, China
Abstract: With the development of new energy power systems, and the penetration of storage equipments and rechargeable equipments, it is imperative to study the stochastic stability of power systems. To determine the stability of the power systems, Lyapunov function played an important role. However, for nonlinear systems, there is no general method to construct Lyapunov functions, and the direct method gives sufficient conditions for the system, which makes it difficult to judge the stability of the system. In addition, if the Lyapunov function of the system exists, the Lyapunov function is generally not unique. In this paper, the equivalent stochastic model of two-machine power systems based on EEAC theory is taken as an example. The separable variable method is proposed to construct the Lyapunov function and then the weak stochastic asymptotic stability of the system is proved. The method is compared with the traditional Lyapunov first method to analyze the stochastic stability of the system. Finally, the case study is given and the stochastic response of the system is verified by simulation. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Lyapunov function; Power system; Stochastic stability
Index Keywords: Asymptotic stability; Electric power system stability; Lyapunov functions; Stochastic systems; Direct method; General method; Lyapunov first methods; New energies; Power system; Stochastic asymptotic stability; Stochastic response; Stochastic stability; Stochastic models

Authors: Lv R., Lv Z., Cao Z.
Title: Economic Dispatch of Off-Grid Photovoltaic Generation System with Hybrid Energy Storage
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Shanghai Economic Research Institute, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Lv, R., State Grid Shanghai Economic Research Institute, Shanghai, China; Lv, Z., State Grid Shanghai Economic Research Institute, Shanghai, China; Cao, Z., State Grid Shanghai Economic Research Institute, Shanghai, China
Abstract: An off-grid photovoitaic(PV) generation system with hybrid energy storage is proposed, and the mathematical models of the key components are built. By which energy supply and demand performance of the system are analyzed, and a coordinated control strategy of energy management is proposed, which is based on the constraints of equipment parameters, self-wastage and the impacts of the capacity in the system. Using Matlab software, a simulation platform for the off-grid PV microgrid with hybrid energy storage is constructed. Taking a microgrid for case study, Simulation results verify the effectiveness of the dynamic economic dispatch. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy management strategy; hybrid energy storage; off-grid; particle swarm optimization; photovoltaic generation
Index Keywords: Economics; Energy management; Energy storage; MATLAB; Particle swarm optimization (PSO); Scheduling; Simulation platform; Coordinated control strategy; Dynamic economic dispatch; Energy management strategies; Equipment parameters; Hybrid energy storage; Off-grids; Photovoltaic generation; Photovoltaic generation system; Electric load dispatching

Authors: Zhao G., Zhao Q., Ren J.
Title: Output Power Modelling for Dynamic Behavior of Doubly-Fed Variable-Speed Pumped Storage Power Station
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, Beijing, China; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, G., North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, Beijing, China; Zhao, Q., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Ren, J., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Abstract: The doubly-fed variable-speed pumped storage (DFVSPS) is an effective method to balance the fluctuation of renewable energy generation and is an important means of frequency and voltage regulation of power grid. Firstly, this paper introduces the model and the control strategy of the DFVSPS unit of generating mode and pumping mode. Secondly, by analyzing the dynamic behavior of the pumped storage power station, the mathematical model of output power of the DFVSPS is established, which includes start-up stage, load increasing stage, steady stage and shutdown stage of generating mode and pumping mode. Thirdly, the output power model of DFVSPS and the simulation example are established in MATLAB/Simulink. At last, the proposed power model is verified by the simulation results. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: dynamic behavior; power grid; power model; variable-speed pumped storage

Title: A Novel Design of Fuzzy Logic Control Algorithm for Hybrid Energy Storage System
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Hebei Electric Power Co., Ltd, Economic Technology Research Institute, Shijiazhuang, 050021, China; School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University050022, China; State Grid Hebei Electric Power Supply Co., Ltd., Shijiazhuang, 050022, China

Abstract: This paper investigates the control methodology of hybrid energy storage system (HESS)in the context of microgrid. It develops a novel fuzzy logic control (FLC)method for HESS aiming at minimizing power fluctuation between the microgrid and the external grid to deal with peak power demands and reduce the disturbance caused by distributed renewable energy sources. The model of microgrid HESS has been tested through Matlab/Simulink platform, and the performance of the novel fuzzy controller has been compared with that of a rule based controller (RBC). The effectiveness of the fuzzy control method were verified. © 2018 IEEE.

Ltd., Research Institute, Ministry of Science and Technology, Changsha, China; Li, C., State Grid Hunan Electric Power Co. Ltd., Research Institute, Ministry of Science and Technology, Changsha, China
Abstract: The precise control system of the pumped storage power station developed in this paper is based on the analysis of the large amount of historical operation scenes of 'source-network-load-storage'. It fully excavates the characteristics and occurrence rules of the abandoned wind/water period, and breaks the contradiction between peak load regulation of the power grid and the problem that the regulating capacity of the pumped storage power station has reached its limit. The energy stratified filling method for pumped storage power station precise control is proposed to cope with the contradiction between the increasing fluctuating power supply and the increasing user terminal load, and to realize the coordination and optimization of various resources such as hydropower, thermal power, wind power, pumped storage power, tie line and short-term load forecasting curve in the energy internet. Enhance the overall capacity to absorb and flexibility. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Pan L., Xu B., Hou X., Kou L., Qu X.
Title: Energy Storage System Planning Based on Cost Analysis in Distribution Network
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co.LTD., Anhui, China; State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co. Ltd, Electric Power Research Institute, Anhui, China; China Electric Power Research Institute Co LTD, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Pan, L., State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co.LTD., Anhui, China; Xu, B., State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co. Ltd, Electric Power Research Institute, Anhui, China; Hou, X., China Electric Power Research Institute Co LTD, Beijing, China; Kou, L., China Electric Power Research Institute Co LTD, Beijing, China; Qu, X., China Electric Power Research Institute Co LTD, Beijing, China
Abstract: With the increasing proportion of distributed energy in distribution network, the characteristics of intermittent and fluctuation greatly reduce the security of the distribution network, and the energy storage system can effectively alleviate this situation. In this paper, the method of storage battery configuration is studied from the point of cost analysis. First, the charging and discharging process of the battery is optimized. Then, the investment income model which aims at the maximum net income of the storage battery system is set up by considering the subsidy of energy storage policy, the electricity price subsidy, the investment cost and the additional benefit. Finally, the difference algorithm and the interior point method are combined to solve the model. In the example part, we consider and compare different battery configurations and the corresponding revenue. The results verify the feasibility of the proposed configuration method. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zhang L., Li G., Xia Y.
Title: Optimal Scheduling Strategy for Active Distribution Network Considering Demand Side Response
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, State Key Laboratory of Alternate, North China Electric Power Universtity, Beijing, China; State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power Company, Nanjing, Jiangsu City, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, L., Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, State Key Laboratory of Alternate, North China Electric Power Universtity, Beijing, China; Li, G., Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, State Key Laboratory of Alternate, North China Electric Power Universtity, Beijing, China; Xia, Y., State Grid Jiangsu Electric Power Company, Nanjing, Jiangsu City, China
Abstract: Active distribution network (ADN) is an effective solution to realize the grid operation control with large-scale intermittent new energy, the interaction between power grid and charging and discharging facilities, intelligent distribution and using of power and other key technologies of grid operation analysis. This paper established the ADN scheduling model including distributed generation unit, energy storage equipment and demand side response load. The electricity price response and interruptible load are integrated to optimize and adjust the load curve considering the user satisfaction. The results show that the proposed optimal scheduling model of ADN considering the demand side response can increase the utilization rate of renewable distributed generation, effectively reduce the network active loss and the operating cost of the system, and improve the economy of the ADN operation on the premise of satisfying the user's electricity satisfaction. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Coordination Optimization for Energy Storage Configuration Based on Fusion of Multi-Level Objective
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Economic and Technological Research Institute CO., LTD., Beijing, 102209, China; Electrical Engineering Department, North China Electric Power University, Hebei province, 071003, China

Abstract: The choice of energy storage capacity often requires consideration for many factors. The importance of various factors is different, resulting in large differences in operational effect. Take many factors into consideration, a multi-level objective fusion method of energy storage capacity coordinated configuration is presented in this paper. According to the importance degree of the objective, the hierarchical setting of model is established. The multi-attribute decision method based on fuzzy entropy weight is used to screen the satisfactory solution of Pareto solution set. The effectiveness of the proposed method is validated by the optimization results on actual case. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: capacity configuration; comprehensive decision; coordination optimization; energy storage; fusion of multi-level objective
Index Keywords: Energy management; Energy resources; capacity configuration; comprehensive decision; Coordination optimization; Energy storage capacity; Fuzzy entropy weights; Multi-attribute decisions; Multilevels; Satisfactory solutions; Energy storage

Authors: Wang J., Dai S., Wei Y., Yu J., He Y., Li S.
Title: Research on A Novel Multilayer Equalization Circuit for Battery Pack Based on Game Theory Control Algorithm
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering New Energy, China Three Gorges University, Yichang, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, J., College of Electrical Engineering New Energy, China Three Gorges University, Yichang, China; Dai, S., College of Electrical Engineering New Energy, China Three Gorges University, Yichang, China; Wei, Y., College of Electrical Engineering New Energy, China Three Gorges University, Yichang, China; Yu, J., College of Electrical Engineering New Energy, China Three Gorges University, Yichang, China; He, Y., College of Electrical Engineering New Energy, China Three Gorges University, Yichang, China; Li, S., College of Electrical Engineering New Energy, China Three Gorges University, Yichang, China
Abstract: The application of modern energy storage is the cornerstone of the development of energy Internet technology, and energy storage components play an important role. However, the use of lithium batteries as energy storage components is also facing application challenges, among which the impact caused by battery inconsistency is particularly critical. A forced equalization circuit is proposed in this paper, which can transfer energy from any battery to other batteries in the battery pack, thereby reducing the inconsistency of each energy storage unit and prolonging the life of the battery pack. The Nash equalization based on the complete information game strategy is used to optimize the control of the circuit. In theory, the low loss is achieved while fast equalization. Finally, the simulation model is built to verify the working principle and equalization strategy of the circuit. The results show that the control method using Nash equalization can effectively improve the circuit efficiency. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy storage; Game Theory; multilayer equalization circuit; Nash Equilibrium
Index Keywords: Battery Pack; Energy storage; Game theory; Lithium batteries; Multilayers; Timing circuits; Circuit efficiency; Complete information; Energy storage components; Energy storage unit; Equalization circuits; Equalization strategy; Nash equilibria; Simulation model; Equalizers

Authors: Fang Y., Zhao S., Li Z.
Title: Concentrating Solar Power Station Optimal Operation Model
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, Hebei, China
Authors with affiliations: Fang, Y., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, Hebei, China; Zhao, S., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, Hebei, China; Li, Z., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Baoding, Hebei, China
Abstract: With the improvement of energy structure, large scale grid connection of renewable energy, as a new technology for absorbing solar energy, concentrating solar power generation uses a thermal storage system to make it a schedulable resource without increasing the uncertainty of the system. This paper considers the energy transfer process and the thermal energy conversion efficiency among the concentrating solar modules, and constructs their basic operation models respectively. Through the design of different operating modes, the examples are simulated. The values of key parameters are taken into account to optimize the operation results. The impact of the analysis shows that concentrating solar power plants have certain advantages in dealing with solar energy uncertainty, prolonging production cycles, improving the utilization efficiency of heat storage tanks, and economic efficiency. © 2018 IEEE.

Index Keywords: Conversion efficiency; Energy transfer; Heat storage; Solar energy; Solar power generation; Solar power plants; Thermal energy; Uncertainty analysis; Concentrating solar power; Concentrating solar power plant; Concentrating solar power stations; Energy transfer process; Optimal operation; Renewable energies; Thermal storage system; Utilization efficiency; Energy efficiency

Authors: Chai J., Peng Y.
Title: Coordinated Power Control for Islanded DC Microgrids Based on Bus-Signaling and Fuzzy Logic Control
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Chai, J., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Peng, Y., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Abstract: In an islanded de microgrid consisting of multiple photovoltaic (PV) generators, energy storage system (ESS) and loads, a coordinated power regulation is critically important to avoid the state-of-charge (SOC) and charging/discharging power of ESS from exceeding their limits while making full use of renewable energy. In this study, a decentralized coordinated power control approach is proposed with considering the limits of maximum charging/discharging power of ESS to achieve power management for islanded dc microgrids. The proposed control strategy is implemented by combining the dc bus voltage signaling with fuzzy logic control and can operate without the need for communication lines. When designing the fuzzy logic controller, in addition to the SOC, the charging/discharging power of ESS is also taken into account to keep both the SOC and power of ESS within the desired ranges. Then, the power limiting controller is designed for PV generators to curtail PV power when bus voltage is high. The fuzzy logic controller changes the bus voltage to make the output power of PV generators decrease or perform the load shedding. Based on the proposed method, the generation-storage-load coordination can be achieved to satisfy different usage scenarios. Finally, the effectiveness of proposed algorithm is verified by the Matlab/Simulink simulation results under different test scenarios. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: charging/discharging power control; dc bus voltage signaling; dc microgrid; fuzzy logic control; power management
Index Keywords: Computer circuits; Controllers; Electric machine control; Energy policy; Fuzzy logic; MATLAB; Power management; Charging/discharging; Dc micro-grid; DC-bus voltages; Energy storage systems; Fuzzy logic control; Fuzzy logic controllers; Matlab/Simulink simulation; Use of renewable energies; Power control

Authors: Sheng C., Liu N., Ma X., Zhou C., Han J.
Title: Probabilistic Production Simulation for Industrial Integrated Energy System with Power and Steam Loads
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Energy Sources North China Electrical, Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable, Beijing, China; Southern Power Grid Guangzhou, Electric Power Research Institute, Guangdong, China
Authors with affiliations: Sheng, C., Energy Sources North China Electrical, Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable, Beijing, China; Liu, N., Energy Sources North China Electrical, Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable, Beijing, China; Ma, X., Energy Sources North China Electrical, Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable, Beijing, China; Zhou, C., Southern Power Grid Guangzhou, Electric Power Research Institute, Guangdong, China; Han, J., Energy Sources North China Electrical, Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable, Beijing, China
Abstract: To make full use of renewable energy, integrated energy system(IES) has been developing in recent years with a variety of energy coordination, in which the power system is the core. This paper improves the probabilistic production simulation (PPS) method which is widely applied to the evaluation of economic efficiency and reliability of power-only system and proposes a probabilistic production simulation method suitable for industrial integrated energy system. This paper briefly introduces the load probability density function (LPDF) considering photovoltaic energy, energy storage, steam load and the unit commissioning convolution calculation. Then, simplify convolution operations using image translation methods. The electricity purchasing from the utility grid and calculation method of reliability index as well as the unit output are given. Finally, Guangdong Mingzhu demonstration zone is taken as an example. Applying the model to the example demonstrates the advantages of the method in the economic evaluation and reliability assessment of integrated energy systems. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Analytical Method for Power Grid Dispatching Centralized Thermal Storage to Reduce Wind Abandoned Rate
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings

Ltd., Shenyang, China; Wang, S.-J., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang, China; Shi, S.-J., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang, China
Abstract: In order to achieve clean heating and reduce the rate of abandoned wind, the northern region has invested in various heat storage devices, especially the large-capacity heat storage devices invested by thermal power plants to improve adjustment flexibility. In this paper, the calculation method of electric power consumed by large-capacity heat storage device and the calculation method of electric power abandonment wind power are proposed. The relationship between the input timing of the heat storage device and the timing of abandoning wind is researched, and the delay of deep peak shaving of the unit after the input of the heat storage device is discussed. It has been verified by actual data, and it has a demonstration effect on the consumption of wind power through thermal storage in the northern region. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zang T., Chen Y., Wang T., Xiang Y., Liu W., Feng D.
Title: Energy Optimization of Rail Transit Power Supply System with PVs and Energy Storage
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Southwest Jiaotong University, National Rail Transit Electrification and Automation Engineering Technology Research Center, Chengdu, China; Xihua University, School of Electrical Engineering and Electronic Information, Chengdu, China; Southwest Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engneering, Chengdu, China

Abstract: In order to reduce the energy consumption of rail transit power supply, promote the local consumption of photovoltaic, and simultaneously, and improve the power supply flexibility of the system, this paper proposes an energy optimization method of photovoltaic and energy storage accessing to rail transit power supply system. Energy management model with minimal operating costs has been established. The constraints of power balance, the photovoltaic power, the battery state, photovoltaic and the grid transmission capacity were considered. A modified particle swarm optimization (MPSO) is used to optimize the solution. To verify the validity of the proposed method, an IEEE9 node system was used for the simulation test. The results show that the photovoltaic can be basically satisfied the traction load demand, when the light is sufficient and the passenger flow is small. Moreover in the load peak period, it is necessary to purchase electricity from the large power grid to maintain normal operation of the system. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Calculation and Consumption Method of Multi-Time Period Abandoned Wind Power
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang University of Technology, Shenyang, China; State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang, China

Ltd., Shenyang, China; Yu-Dong, S., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang, China; Ge, Y.-F., State Grid Liaoning Electric Power Co. Ltd., Shenyang, China
Abstract: China has already become a big country in wind power. It not only has the largest installed capacity in the world, but also has the largest amount of electricity generated. In particular, the disposable wind power is also the highest. In 2016, the power of the abandoned wind reached 49.6 billion kWh. In order to solve the large amount of abandoned wind power problems in the rapid development of wind power, this paper proposes models for annual and daily abandonment rule of wind power in the power grid and the analytical model of the maximum abandoned wind capacity and the maximum wind power law. Combined with practical examples, it reveals the rules of abandoning the wind in the northern power grid, which has important guiding significance for understanding the abandoned wind power and selecting the type of energy storage technology for abandoned wind. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zhang H.-J., Cui C.-G., Zhao J.-L., Gu Y.-X., Yang N.
Title: Research on Operation Optimization of Integrated Energy System Based on Importance Scenario Analysis Method
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: College of Automation Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Huadian Minhang Energy Corporation Ltd, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, H.-J., College of Automation Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; Cui, C.-G., College of Automation Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China; Zhao, J.-L., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China; Gu, Y.-X., Shanghai Huadian Minhang Energy Corporation Ltd, Shanghai, China; Yang, N., College of Automation Engineering, Shanghai University of Electric Power, Shanghai, China
Abstract: The regional integrated energy system refers to a system that contains a variety of heterogeneous energy sources such as oil, natural gas, electric energy, heat, and wind energy in a certain area. As we know, wind's uncertainty and volatility challenge the operational optimization of integrated energy systems. In this paper, the importance scene method is used to model the randomness of wind power output, and a mixed integer programming model of regional integrated energy system including capacity and energy storage equipment is established. Finally, the important scenario analysis method is applied to the random operation optimization problem of regional integrated energy system. The effectiveness of the method is verified by simulation experiments. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Wang C., Pan L., Fang L., Wang Y.
Title: Optimal Dispatch of an Island MG Including a Multiple Energy Storage System
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Anhui Institute of Information Technology, Wuhu, China; State Grid Cangzhou Power Supply Company, SGCC, Cangzhou, China; State Grid Yueyang Power Supply Company, SGCC, Yueyang, China; MCC, Capital Engineering Research Incorporation Limited, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, C., Anhui Institute of Information Technology, Wuhu, China; Pan, L., State Grid Cangzhou Power Supply Company, SGCC, Cangzhou, China; Fang, L., State Grid Yueyang Power Supply Company, SGCC, Yueyang, China; Wang, Y., MCC, Capital Engineering Research Incorporation Limited, Beijing, China
Abstract: The integrated energy MG including electric heat and gas has become a significant part of energy internet. In order to reduce pollution from gas emissions and achieve the economic goal, the multiple energy storage system(MESS) is configured. It is very important to study the economic dispatch problem for an integrated energy microgrid(MG). Hence, this paper proposes a multi-objective optimization scheduling model for an island MG including a MESS. This island MG consists of a wind turbine (WT), a photovoltaic battery (PV), a fuel cell (FC), an electric boiler (EB), an electric storage, (ES) a heat storage (HS) and a gas storage(GS). Minimum economic cost and environmental cost are considered as the two objectives in the operation of this multiple energy source MG system. To solve this two-objective optimization problem, the multi-objective bacterial colony chemotaxis (MOBCC) algorithm is utilized to obtain the operation modes of the micro-sources and the Pareto optimal solution set. Simulation results show that the proposed method is effective and decision makers can choose the appropriate dispatch scheduling in this manner. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Economic dispatch; island MG; multiple energy storage system
Index Keywords: Biochemistry; Decision making; Fuel cells; Gas emissions; Gas fuel storage; Heat storage; Multiobjective optimization; Pareto principle; Scheduling; Wind turbines; Bacterial colony chemotaxis; Economic Dispatch; Economic dispatch problems; Energy storage systems; Environmental costs; Optimal dispatch; Pareto optimal solutions; Two-objective optimization; Electric load dispatching

Title: Optimal Intraday Rolling Operation Strategy of Integrated Energy System with Multi-Storage

Abstract: Traditional energy systems face the problems of low energy utilization rate, expensive energy cost and inaccuracy prediction of day-ahead renewable energy power output and load demand. On this account, an optimal intraday rolling operation strategy of integrated energy system (IES) is formulated in this paper. First, mathematical models of multi-type equipment in the IES are established and their operation character and energy flow character are analyzed. Then, the rolling strategy model is formulated aiming at minimizing the intraday operation cost of integrated energy system and giving equipment more economic and reasonable operation scheme. Case study result proves that with multi-storage the intraday rolling operation strategy of integrated energy system could improve economic efficiency and reliability of energy system effectively. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Xiong X., Ji Y., Wu M., Hui Y.
Title: Microgrid Power Optimal Control with Markov Decision Process by Using the Specific Policy of Wavelet Packet-Fuzzy Control
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Xiong, X., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Ji, Y., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wu, M., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Hui, Y., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China
Abstract: The purpose of this research is to formulate an brand new optimization model, and determine comprehensive optimal operating strategies for microgrid in order to significantly reduce the unbalanced power. This paper presents a microgrid power optimal dispatch control scheme by using markov decision process (MDP). To decrease the exchange power of PCC and smooth the fluctuation, the reward function of MDP is established based on improved entropy. The decision process gets the optimal policy and optimal entropy value through policy iteration. To reduce the policy set, a specific stable policy of wavelet packet-probability fuzzy control has been proposed, which is used as the mapping from state set of state of charge (SOC) of energy storage to action set of charge/discharge power of hybrid energy storage. Case study is tested and the results show that the unbalanced power can be significantly reduced and the fluctuation can be decreased by using the proposed optimal model and specific stable policy. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: fuzzy theory; markov decision process; microgrid; power optimization; wavelet packet-probability

Authors: Guo Z., Yao S., Gu J., Xu C., Li G., Zhou M.
Title: Bi-level Optimal Scheduling of Demand Response Integrated Energy Hub Through Cost and Exergy Assessments
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, Beijing, China; State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Company, Economy and Technology Research Institute, Hangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Guo, Z., North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, Beijing, China; Yao, S., North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, Beijing, China; Gu, J., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Company, Economy and Technology Research Institute, Hangzhou, China; Xu, C., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Company, Economy and Technology Research Institute, Hangzhou, China; Li, G., North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, Beijing, China; Zhou, M., North China Electric Power University, State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, Beijing, China
Abstract: Energy hub has gained its popularity recently in describing the multi-energy complements in integrated energy systems. In this paper, a novel bi-level optimal scheduling model for a demand response integrated energy hub is established aiming at a balance between cost analysis and exergy assessment. A modified steam injected gas turbine structure is introduced to flexibly transit working status according to demand changes. The Karush-Kuhn-Tucker condition and big M method are applied to transform the nonlinear model to a mixed integer linear programming problem, which can be easily solved by commercial solvers. Case study of a smart multi-energy building demonstrates the effectiveness of the proposed model. Results show that the scheduling method in this paper enables significant reduction in the total operating costs and improvement of the overall exergy efficiency. Besides, the modification of energy converting device and application of interruptible load effectively alleviate energy supply pressure of distributed power grid and increase the service life of energy storage devices. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: demand response; energy hub; exergy; steam injected gas turbine

Abstract: Blockchain is a decentralized basic data architecture and distributed computing paradigm that is gradually recognized by everyone with the rise of digital cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin. The application of blockchain technology in the energy field has been extensively explored because of its characteristics and the development needs of the energy Internet. This paper provides a solution for the automatic demand response of pure electric vehicle with battery energy storage system based on blockchain technology, which firstly introduces the fit between blockchain and the system, then constructs the node model of the system, and studies the price formation mechanism, finally the automatic demand response strategy based on blockchain technology is constructed. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Yang M., Chen C., Que B., Zhou Z., Yang Q.
Title: Optimal Placement and Configuration of Hybrid Energy Storage System in Power Distribution Networks with Distributed Photovoltaic Sources
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Research Institute, Hangzhou, China; State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power CO., LTD, Hangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, M., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Chen, C., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Research Institute, Hangzhou, China, State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power CO., LTD, Hangzhou, China; Que, B., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Research Institute, Hangzhou, China, State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power CO., LTD, Hangzhou, China; Zhou, Z., State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power Research Institute, Hangzhou, China, State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power CO., LTD, Hangzhou, China; Yang, Q., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China
Abstract: This paper exploits the optimal allocation and configuration of hybrid energy storage devices consisting of battery and supercapacitor in power distribution networks with distributed renewable generators. The multi-objective optimization model is firstly formulated to determine the placement of the storage devices with the aim to minimize the bus voltage fluctuation and the required energy storage capacity whilst meeting the operational constraints. The multi-objective optimization is transformed into single objective optimization through using the target value normalization, linear weighted aggregation and analytic hierarchy process (AHP), and addressed using linear weighted particle swarm optimization (PSO). Further., the optimal capacity configuration problem is studied to minimize the annual cost and meet the constraints., e.g., instantaneous power balance., energy spillover ratio. The optimal capacity configuration is determined through the simulated annealing particle swarm optimization (SAPSO). Finally., the proposed optimal placement of capacity configuration solution is evaluated through case studies using the IEEE 14-bus test distribution feeder and the numerical result clearly confirms its effectiveness. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Ahmed A., Jiang T.
Title: Operation Management of Power Grid System with Renewable Energy Sources and Energy Storage System Integrations
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, University of Nyala, Nyala, Sudan
Authors with affiliations: Ahmed, A., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China, Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, University of Nyala, Nyala, Sudan; Jiang, T., State Key Laboratory of Alternate Electrical Power System with Renewable Energy Sources, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Abstract: Sudan is a large country because of the large territory and the distance between communities are simply too great, a full- scale power grid is almost impossible to realize. As a result, the construction of small Island power grids in remote areas has been developed. The country shows favorable conditions for the generation of electricity by renewable energies such as wind and solar. Nyala city has been chosen as a preferred wind farm location because the power supply by the existing diesel power plant is expensive due to high costs for fuel transport and the reliability of power supply is low due to uncertain fuel provision. This paper presents a formulation of security-constrained unit commitment (SCUC) with diesel generation and integration of wind power and solar photovoltaic with the compressed air energy storage system (CAES) for Nyala city power plant. The proposed system is formulated as a mixed-integer programming, which is solved in CPLEX 12.7.0. and the results show that the proposed model is suitable for renewable integrations into the power grid system with energy storage systems. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zhao W., Xie W., Liao Q., Fu Y., Cai Z., Liu W., Feng L.
Title: Uncertainty Modeling Analysis of Microgird System Based on the 'Emergence'
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Guizhou Electric Power Grid, Guian Electric Power Company, Guiyang, China; Shandong Electric Power Company Economic Research Institute of the State Grid, Jinan, China; South China University of Technology, School of Electric Power, Guangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, W., Guizhou Electric Power Grid, Guian Electric Power Company, Guiyang, China; Xie, W., Shandong Electric Power Company Economic Research Institute of the State Grid, Jinan, China; Liao, Q., Guizhou Electric Power Grid, Guian Electric Power Company, Guiyang, China; Fu, Y., Guizhou Electric Power Grid, Guian Electric Power Company, Guiyang, China; Cai, Z., Guizhou Electric Power Grid, Guian Electric Power Company, Guiyang, China; Liu, W., South China University of Technology, School of Electric Power, Guangzhou, China; Feng, L., South China University of Technology, School of Electric Power, Guangzhou, China
Abstract: The uncertainty of microgrid operation is increasing by the access of renewable energy sources such as wind power and photovoltaic. Modeling method based on probabilistic distribution is difficult to get information about microgrid operation characteristics. To solve this problem, we propose an uncertainty modeling analysis method of microgird system based on the emergence. Firstly, we introduce the concept of emergence and emergence modeling method based on constrained generating procedure. Then, we propose a microgrid emergence system model based on constrained generating procedure. We define the mechanism composition of microgrid emergence system and corresponding state transition function in detail. Finally, in numerical results, we analysis the uncertainty factors, as well as their influence on microgrid operation, based on the data provided by the emergence model. In this way, the validity of the proposed modeling method is testified. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Ai W., Minru X., Haixiao Z., Ting W., Yao W., Changhong M., Shuting L., Yuming Z., Yingying H.
Title: Study on Transmission Planning of Combined Wind and Storage System
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Economic and Electrical Research Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Beijing Forestry University, Beijing, China; Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Shanxi University, Taiyuan, China; Shanxi Electric Power Company, Taiyuan, China
Authors with affiliations: Ai, W., Economic and Electrical Research Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Minru, X., Beijing Forestry University, Beijing, China; Haixiao, Z., Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Ting, W., Shanxi University, Taiyuan, China; Yao, W., Economic and Electrical Research Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Changhong, M., Shanxi Electric Power Company, Taiyuan, China; Shuting, L.; Yuming, Z., Economic and Electrical Research Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Yingying, H., Economic and Electrical Research Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China
Abstract: The characteristics of wind power generation and the technical breakthrough of energy storage equipment make it possible to put large-scale energy storage equipment into the power grid. The change of the output mode of the wind storage combined system will inevitably affect the operation of the system. The output power curve of the combined system of wind storage and storage system is segmented in the research cycle, and the optimized output strategy is formulated. Other thermal power units use the optimal economic dispatching principle to calculate the force value with the combined system of wind storage. The transmission planning model of the wind-storage joint system is established with the goal of maximizing the total benefit of the system. The example uses the typical sunrise force curve of the wind farm and the improved IEEE-18 node system. The artificial fish swarm algorithm (ASFA) is used to determine the cost and optimal transmission of the wind storage combined system 1, 2, 4 and 8 respectively. Comparing the cost of each segmented system, it can be seen that the transmission planning scheme at the time of the four-segment output is shorter than that of the transmission plan without the energy storage, the investment is reduced, and the total system benefit is the largest. The example proves that it is feasible to invest in energy storage equipment in the power grid and operate in a certain way to effectively reduce transmission investment and improve the economics of the system. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Control Strategy of an AC-DC Hybrid Microgrid Based on Virtual Synchronous Generator
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Henan Electric Power Company Economic Research Institute, Zhengzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Xing, P., State Grid Henan Electric Power Company Economic Research Institute, Zhengzhou, China; Li, M., State Grid Henan Electric Power Company Economic Research Institute, Zhengzhou, China; Li, H., State Grid Henan Electric Power Company Economic Research Institute, Zhengzhou, China; Tian, C., State Grid Henan Electric Power Company Economic Research Institute, Zhengzhou, China; Xu, C., State Grid Henan Electric Power Company Economic Research Institute, Zhengzhou, China
Abstract: Virtual synchronous generator (VSG) provides a friendly grid-integrated method for renewable energies. This paper presents a control storage of an islanded photovoltaic-diesel-battery microgrid, in which the VSG is used as the interface between the AC bus and DC bus. The basic control structure of the VSG and its active power-frequency characteristics are discussed in detail. Besides, a practical control method for the VSG to regulate its output power is proposed on base of moving average method to make full use of the photovoltaics output power and simultaneously reduce the adverse effect of its intermittency on the system stability. Simulations based on Matlab/Simulink and experiments based on a VSG prototype developed in the laboratory proved the proposed method to be effective and verified the improvement of the VSG on microgrid dynamic frequency characteristic. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Guo J., Yin S.
Title: The optimization of household and apartment energy management system
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Guo, J., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China; Yin, S., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China
Abstract: This paper state the optimization of household and apartment energy management system. The content propose 4 parts: The introduction including the background and the theory of household and apartment energy management systems; the design of household energy management (HEM) optimization systems which include the hardware implementation and software application; some case studies are discussed to illustrate the optimization results are effective, for instance it shows clearly that bills are reduced after optimize process; the final conclusions are indicated in the end. The mathematical model was built to solve the optimization problem. The usage of appliances are automatically changed by the system depend on the day-ahead electrical price. The control algorithm is depend on the mixed integer linear programming (MILP). Power balance is the most core idea of the system, since the shared battery system is raised and played as an important role in the control strategy. 4 households are combined together by using one shared battery storage system, which promote the optimization results. There are four case studies are supposed in this paper, which reflected in the impact of different price mechanism; the impact of critical load; the impact of battery size and the impact of generation part. These case studies are comprehensive discussed to certify the optimization effect is obvious. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Tang C., Zhang F.
Title: Distribution Network Scheduling with Distributed Energy Resources Based on Power Scenarios
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, 102209, China
Authors with affiliations: Tang, C., State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, 102209, China; Zhang, F., State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, 102209, China
Abstract: With the development of distributed energy resources (DER) in distribution network, system operations such as peak shaving and voltage stability face more challenges. Battery energy storage (BES) has been widely accepted as the most potential application to cope with the challenge of high penetration of DER. To cope with the uncertainties and variability of DER, a stochastic distribution network scheduling method is proposed. The overall economy is achieved by fully considering the cell degradation, DER, electricity purchasing and active power losses. DER power scenarios are generated to consider the uncertainties and correlations based on the Copula theory. Finally, numerical studies for the day-ahead distribution network scheduling in the IEEE 123-node test feeder are presented to demonstrate the merits of the proposed method. Results show that the problems caused by DER are greatly alleviated by capturing the uncertainties and correlations. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Song Y., Liu Y., Huang S., Zhang T., Wang R.
Title: Multi-Objective Configuration Optimization for Isolated Microgrid with Mobile Energy Storage and Shiftable Load
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: College of Systems Engineering, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China
Authors with affiliations: Song, Y., College of Systems Engineering, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China; Liu, Y., College of Systems Engineering, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China; Huang, S., College of Systems Engineering, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China; Zhang, T., College of Systems Engineering, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China; Wang, R., College of Systems Engineering, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China
Abstract: The configuration of isolated microgrids is of great significance for military outliers built in remote islands and high mountains. To address practical concerns, mobile energy storage system and shiftable load are specifically introduced to represent military battery pack and oxygen generation/seawater desalination unit, respectively, in this study. Then an optimal configuration model for isolated microgrids with multi-objectives is proposed, and it is tackled with an improved preference-incentive co-evolution algorithm (PICEA-ng). Numerical simulation validates the effectiveness of our proposed model and algorithm based on practical data. Finally, the role of the mobile energy storage and shiftable load on influencing the optimization objectives of the microgrid system is analyzed. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Yao W., Minru X., Haixiao Z., Nan W., Zheng S., Shuting L., Ting W., Feihong W., Chen Z.
Title: Transmission Planning Considering the Influence of Wind-Storage System and Technical-Economic Analysis
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Economic and Electrical Research, Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Beijing Forestry University, Beijing, China; Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Beijing Institute of Technology, Beijing, China; Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, China; Taiyuan Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Shanxi University, Taiyuan, China; Electric Power Company, State Grid Maintenance Co. of Shanxi, Taiyuan, China
Authors with affiliations: Yao, W., Economic and Electrical Research, Institute of Shanxi Electrical Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Minru, X., Beijing Forestry University, Beijing, China; Haixiao, Z., Taiyuan University of Technology, Taiyuan, China; Nan, W., Beijing Institute of Technology, Beijing, China; Zheng, S., Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, China; Shuting, L., Taiyuan Power Company of SGCC, Taiyuan, China; Ting, W., Shanxi University, Taiyuan, China; Feihong, W., Electric Power Company, State Grid Maintenance Co. of Shanxi, Taiyuan, China; Chen, Z., Electric Power Company, State Grid Maintenance Co. of Shanxi, Taiyuan, China
Abstract: The shortage of fossil fuels, wind power generation and energy storage equipment are developing so rapidly that make the large-scale energy storage equipment become an trend in the future grid. Seeing the wind-storage system as a whole, the transmission network planning will be inevitably affected by its output mode change. In this paper, a transmission network planning model which considers the influence of the wind-storage system will be established. An optimal operation mode of the wind-storage system will be calculated by the wind plant data from the Eastern Mongolia (according to the peak valley electricity price), and maximizing the energy conversion efficiency. Artificial Fish Swarm Algorithm (ASFA) and the improved Garver 6 node system are used to verify the transmission planning model which is included the influence of the wind-storage system. When the unit price of the energy storage equipment is determined, the corresponding optimal plan of different capacity coefficients is obtained, and the optimal capacity coefficient and the transmission planning under the different unit price are given when the unit price of the energy storage equipment is uncertain. The example shows that it is feasible to add energy storage equipment within a certain price range to effectively improve the economy of transmission network planning. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Chang X., Zheng T., Chen Z., Wei W., Sun X., Xie K., Jiang L.
Title: State-of-Charge Balancing Control Strategy Based on Discrete Consensus Algorithm for Battery Energy Storage in Islanded Microgrid
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Sichuan Electric Power Company, Electric Power Research Institute, Chengdu, China; Tsinghua University, Sichuan Energy Internet Research Institute, Chengdu, China; State Grid Chengdu Electric Power Supply Company, Chengdu, China
Authors with affiliations: Chang, X., State Grid Sichuan Electric Power Company, Electric Power Research Institute, Chengdu, China; Zheng, T., Tsinghua University, Sichuan Energy Internet Research Institute, Chengdu, China; Chen, Z., State Grid Sichuan Electric Power Company, Electric Power Research Institute, Chengdu, China; Wei, W., State Grid Sichuan Electric Power Company, Electric Power Research Institute, Chengdu, China; Sun, X., State Grid Sichuan Electric Power Company, Electric Power Research Institute, Chengdu, China; Xie, K., State Grid Chengdu Electric Power Supply Company, Chengdu, China; Jiang, L., Tsinghua University, Sichuan Energy Internet Research Institute, Chengdu, China
Abstract: This paper proposes state-of-charge (SOC) balancing control based on discrete consensus algorithm to improve the accuracy of power dispatch of the battery energy storage systems (BESS), reducing system cost and prolong the service life of the BESS in islanded microgrid. This has been achieved with hierarchical distributed secondary cooperative control based on discrete consensus algorithm, which modifies the BESS output power to reach a balanced SOC. The control structure has two layers. The cooperative control works as the secondary layer, obtaining equal SOC of the BESS of the grid through interchanges information of energy storage systems state of charge (SOC) with its neighbors. BESS control approach as the primary control layer, they are able to realize the output power sharing and the balancing discharge rate by regulating the virtual resistance. The simulation platform is built based on Matlab/Simulink software. The validity and feasibility of the proposed control strategy has been further verified by various simulation results. © 2018 IEEE.
