Title: A Storage Assignment Method Based on Genetic Algorithm for Electric Power Warehousing System
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Jiangsu Electric Power Information Technology, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Feng, S., Jiangsu Electric Power Information Technology, Nanjing, China; Yang, Y., Jiangsu Electric Power Information Technology, Nanjing, China; Pan, L., Jiangsu Electric Power Information Technology, Nanjing, China
Abstract: An order storage assignment problem (SAP) is to find an effective way to locate products in a warehouse in order to improve the operational efficiency of warehousing system. Since SAP is an NP-hard problem, many heuristic algorithms have been proposed. We analyzed the influence of product weight on the stability of the shelf, as well as the influence of the frequency of products entering the warehouse and the time required to arrive at the warehouse on the efficiency of the warehousing operation. An optimization model based on shelf stability along with inbound and outbound efficiency was proposed and genetic algorithm is used to solve the model. The validity of the model and its solution method is verified by experiment. The results show that the model can effectively reduce the storage time and increase stability of the shelf. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: automated high-rise warehouse; genetic algorithm; storage assignment
Index Keywords: Combinatorial optimization; Computational complexity; Electric energy storage; Genetic algorithms; Heuristic algorithms; High rise; Operational efficiencies; Optimization modeling; Product weight; Shelf stability; Solution methods; Storage assignment; Warehousing systems; Warehouses

Authors: Li J., Fu J., Gao S.
Title: A Conception of a New Generation of Pumped Storage Power Station with Multiple Energy Coupling
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Science and Technology Information Department, State Grid Xinyuan Company Ltd., Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, J., Science and Technology Information Department, State Grid Xinyuan Company Ltd., Beijing, China; Fu, J., Science and Technology Information Department, State Grid Xinyuan Company Ltd., Beijing, China; Gao, S., Science and Technology Information Department, State Grid Xinyuan Company Ltd., Beijing, China
Abstract: This paper proposes a new type of pumped storage power station, a new generation of pumped storage power station that combines the multiple energy coupling of variable speed unit technology, chemical energy storage system, wind energy, solar energy and other new energy storage systems. The advantages of variable speed pumping technology, better stability, greater adjustment range and reactive power compensation capability are introduced in detail. The addition of mature energy storage technology has enabled the power station to respond to faults with a speed of up to milliseconds. New energy sources such as light work together to build a green pumped storage power station. Based on the in-depth analysis of the characteristics of the new pumping station, three areas of the new generation of pumped storage power stations are proposed in the load concentration area, the new energy concentration area and the ultra-high voltage (UHV) drop-end concentration area, respectively. The reconstruction of Mount Langya Pumped Storage Power Station in Anhui power grid is taken as an example in paper. The new generation of pumped storage power station with multiple energy interaction and synergistic complementation can greatly enhance the comprehensive performance of traditional power station. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: chemical energy storage; new generation of pumped storage power station; pumped storage power station; solar energy storage system; variable speed pumped storage
Index Keywords: Energy storage; Reactive power; Solar energy; Wind power; Chemical energy; Comprehensive performance; Energy interactions; Energy storage technologies; New energy sources; Pumped Storage; Pumped storage power station; Reactive power compensation; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Xu G., Zhang B., Zhang S.
Title: Multi-energy Coordination and Schedule Considering large-scale electric vehicles penetration
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Xu, G., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Zhang, B., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China; Zhang, S., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, China
Abstract: The paper propose a novel multi-energy management strategy considering the energy storage and electric vehicles(EVs) participation. Power grid load fluctuates violently because of the intermittence of renewable energy. Data center(DC) energy consumption is taken into account and sustainability supplied by a priority of renewable energy source(RES) in this paper. The priority of a large number of EVs for scheduling is calculated and formed a charge/discharge priority list of schedule EVs. And then based on this.the renewable energy scheduling algorithm(RESA) and optimal charging/discharging control strategy of EVs are presented couple with comprehensively considering the state of multienergy output and real-time grid load. The overall energy management strategy aims to minimize the power fluctuation of grid. The simulation results demonstrate that the strategy proposed could effectively neutralize the intermittence of renewable energy and balance the load fluctuation of power grid to some extent. Meanwhile the EVs users' requirement for routine use could be flexibly satisfied. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: charging/discharging control strategy; data center; energy management; multi-energy; priority of electric vehicles
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Electric vehicles; Energy management; Energy utilization; Green computing; Renewable energy resources; Scheduling algorithms; Control strategies; Data centers; Electric Vehicles (EVs); Energy management strategies; Multi energy; Power fluctuations; Renewable energies; Renewable energy source; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Ma L., Zhang B., Gong C., Li X., Jiao R., Luo S., Ju L., Xu H., Ding L.
Title: Research on Distributed Control of Controllable Micro-Source in Micro-Grid
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Beijing Electric Power Company, Beijing, China; College of Electrical and Control Engineering, North China University of Technology, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Ma, L., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Company, Beijing, China; Zhang, B., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Company, Beijing, China; Gong, C., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Company, Beijing, China; Li, X., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Company, Beijing, China; Jiao, R., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Company, Beijing, China; Luo, S., College of Electrical and Control Engineering, North China University of Technology, Beijing, China; Ju, L., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Company, Beijing, China; Xu, H., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Company, Beijing, China; Ding, L., College of Electrical and Control Engineering, North China University of Technology, Beijing, China
Abstract: To overcome the shortcomings of the centralized control method, such as large calculation, strong communication dependency and poor system reliability. First, based on the traditional IEEE14 standard network topology, this paper introduces the controllable micro-source consist of PV and energy storage basic units. Micro-source cost model and constraints of photovoltaic renewable power generation unit, controllable flexible load, energy storage unit and so on are established. Next, consensus algorithm with no leader of two different communication coefficients D and M, N (CANLD and CANLMN) are finished when controllable micro-sources are inserted into micro-grid, and finally the eigenvalue perturbation method is used to prove the convergence of two different consensus algorithms. The results of the case study show that the two different multi-agent non-leader algorithms with traditional energy and controllable microsources incremental cost as the consistency variable can satisfy the optimal economic objective in microgrid and CANLMN can reach the incremental cost consistency of each micro-source with smaller computation and faster speed. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: consensus algorithm; distributed control strategy; Micro grid; multi-agent system
Index Keywords: Eigenvalues and eigenfunctions; Energy storage; Multi agent systems; Perturbation techniques; Software agents; Centralized control; Consensus algorithms; Distributed control strategy; Economic objectives; Eigenvalue perturbation; Energy storage unit; Micro grid; Renewable power generation; Distributed parameter control systems

Authors: Li S., Guo L., Zhang P., Wang H., Cai Z., Zhu X., Feng Y., Zhang C.
Title: Modeling and Optimization on Energy Efficiency of Urban Integrated Energy System
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Beijing Guodiantong Network Technology Co. Ltd., Beijing, China; State Grid Suzhou City Energy Research Institute Co. Ltd., Suzhou, China; Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Tianjin University, Tianjin, China; Tianjin University, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Tianjin, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, S., Beijing Guodiantong Network Technology Co. Ltd., Beijing, China; Guo, L., State Grid Suzhou City Energy Research Institute Co. Ltd., Suzhou, China; Zhang, P., Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Tianjin University, Tianjin, China; Wang, H., Tianjin University, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Tianjin, China; Cai, Z., Tianjin University, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Tianjin, China; Zhu, X., Tianjin University, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Tianjin, China; Feng, Y., Tianjin University, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Tianjin, China; Zhang, C., Tianjin University, School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Tianjin, China
Abstract: Energy crisis is the key issue in current society, and one solution is to improve the energy efficiency of the urban integrated energy system (UIES). Thus, this paper focus on the modeling and optimization of energy efficiency of UIES. Firstly, the model of energy efficiency for UIES was put forward based on the five segments of UIES, including the process of energy production, transmission, conversion, storage, and utilization. The key techniques in each segment were analyzed for finding the controllable factors of energy efficiency. Secondly, the optimization model of energy efficiency is established and the external point method is implied to solve the optimization problem, by which the key technology factors and optimal energy plan can be obtained. Lastly, a study case of Chengdu City is given to validate the proposed method. The proposed model successfully found the key factors and the optimal energy plan, which is useful for energy policy to improve the energy efficiency. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy efficiency; energy policy; urban integrated energy system
Index Keywords: Energy policy; Optimization; Energy crisis; Energy productions; Integrated energy systems; Key technologies; Modeling and optimization; Optimal energy; Optimization modeling; Optimization problems; Energy efficiency

Authors: Qin H., Li F., Liang Z., Zhang H.
Title: Research on Energy-Storage Capacity Optimal Configuration Based on Scenario Analysis and Seven-spot Ladybird Optimization
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Nanjing Tiko Electric Technology Co. Ltd, Nanjing, China; College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Qin, H., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Li, F., Nanjing Tiko Electric Technology Co. Ltd, Nanjing, China; Liang, Z., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China, College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, China; Zhang, H., College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, China
Abstract: One of pivotal question in wind/photovoltaic /energy storage system is the optimal configuration of energy-storage capacity. Regarding this question, a method for configuring the power and capacity of a single energy storage medium is proposed in grid-connected system of renewable energy. Firstly, the models of wind power, photovoltaics and storage are built, respectively. And then it establishes the objective function of energy-storage capacity's optimal configuration to minimize the sum of the initial investment cost and operating cost of energy storage, and resolves it based on scenario analysis and seven-spot ladybird optimization(SLO). Finally, a large number of cases are analyzed based on combined power generation system of wind/photovoltaics /battery storage hybrid power system and the effectiveness of the energy storage configuration strategy and high efficiency of algorithm are demonstrated through results of simulation. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy-storage configuration; scenarios analysis; SLO; wind/photovoltaic/energy storage
Index Keywords: Cost benefit analysis; Energy storage; Wind power; Energy storage capacity; Grid connected systems; Hybrid power systems; Objective functions; Power generation systems; Renewable energies; Scenario analysis; Scenarios analysis; Investments

Authors: Yousif M., Ai Q., Gao Y., Wattoo W.A., Jiang Z., Hao R.
Title: An Optimal Dispatch Strategy for Distributed Micro-Grids
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiaotong University, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Yousif, M., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiaotong University, Shanghai, China; Ai, Q., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiaotong University, Shanghai, China; Gao, Y., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiaotong University, Shanghai, China; Wattoo, W.A., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiaotong University, Shanghai, China; Jiang, Z., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiaotong University, Shanghai, China; Hao, R., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiaotong University, Shanghai, China
Abstract: Grid structure is changing rapidly in light of current energy policies with the addition of more renewable sources for reduction of carbon emission. Decentralized and low voltage grid are promising approaches to integrate non-dispatchable renewable resources as compared to centralized. It is a recent trend to install local micro-generation like microturbine, fuel cell and energy storage system to reduce microgrids' dependency on main grid and intermittent effect of renewable units. Due to the increasing variety of energy resources with different characteristics, dispatch scheduling is getting more challenging. The authors propose a scheduling solution from an operator's point of view. The main objective of the study is to minimize the cost and emissions caused due to each microgrid. Further, it is observed that transmission losses are reduced for sale and purchase from the main grid. © 2018 IEEE.

Index Keywords: Electric power transmission networks; Energy management systems; Energy resources; Fuel cells; Fuel storage; Scheduling; Smart power grids; Energy storage systems; Micro grid; Optimal dispatch; Power Scheduling; Renewable resource; Renewable sources; Smart grid; Transmission loss; Electric load dispatching

Authors: Peng P., Li Y., Li Z., Shao Y., Luo X., Wang Y., Zhang N.
Title: Analysis of Advantage of the Connection of Energy Storage System to Distribution Network and the Impact on the Voltage Quality
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, China; Shanghai University of Electric Power, China; Shanghai Institute of Ceramics, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Peng, P., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, China; Li, Y., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, China; Li, Z., Shanghai University of Electric Power, China; Shao, Y., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, China; Luo, X., State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, China; Wang, Y., Shanghai University of Electric Power, China; Zhang, N., Shanghai Institute of Ceramics, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Shanghai, China
Abstract: The peak-valley effect on the network load is increasing along with the increasing load of the distribution network. And the large-scale renewable energy which was combined to the grid has great impact on the power grid. They have serious effect on the reliability and economy of the working of power grid. The application of energy storage technology for the distribution network can not only reduce the investment in response to the increase of load peak, but also promote the development and the exploitation of renewable energy, which does a favor for the reliability and quality of power supply. The energy storage system (ESS)as the technical support to intelligent distribution network plays a more and more important role. In this paper, the advantages of ESS applied to power distribution network was evaluated from the point of the perspectives of the network update delaying, network damage reducing, reducing backup power for distributed generation, the reducing of reliability cost, etc. The effect of ESS on the voltage of distribution network was theoretical derived. so the result would provide supporting evidence to the optimization analysis on the locating and capacity of ESS, which produces the important reference for the ESS configured in the distribution network. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zhou J., Liu Y., Li J., Li Z., Wu Z., Liu P.
Title: Distributed Energy Storage System Planning in the Distribution Network Considering the Reactive Power Capability and Network Reconfiguration
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Chongqing Electric Power Co., Electric Power Research Institute, Chongqing, China; School of Electrical Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhou, J., State Grid Chongqing Electric Power Co., Electric Power Research Institute, Chongqing, China; Liu, Y., School of Electrical Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, China; Li, J., State Grid Chongqing Electric Power Co., Electric Power Research Institute, Chongqing, China; Li, Z., State Grid Chongqing Electric Power Co., Electric Power Research Institute, Chongqing, China; Wu, Z., School of Electrical Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, China; Liu, P., School of Electrical Engineering, Southeast University, Nanjing, China
Abstract: This paper presented a mixed-integer second order conic programming (SOCP) model for the distributed energy storage system (DESS) planning in the distribution network. Aimed at minimizing the present value of total investment of DESSs and operation costs of distribution network with high DG penetration, active and reactive power regulation and reconfiguration of the distribution network in different periods were investigated simultaneously. The proposed model used second order conic relaxation to enlarge the feasible region and make the optimal problem convex. Effectiveness of the model was tested on the Wulong distribution network, which is a practical network with high hydroelectric penetration. Result of DESS planning in the distribution network was compared with the simulation of distribution network operation without DESSs. Besides, the effectiveness of SOC relaxation was verified. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Tang C., Zhang F.
Title: Combined Electricity-Gas-Heat Energy Internet Scheduling with Power-To-Gas and Renewable Power Uncertainty
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, 102209, China
Authors with affiliations: Tang, C., State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, 102209, China; Zhang, F., State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, 102209, China
Abstract: As a promising utilization for the future development of energy, the Energy Internet is receiving more attention. In the Energy Internet, electricity, gas, heat and other energy forms are utilized and coupled together. A combined electricity-gas-heat Energy Internet scheduling method is proposed in this paper. The renewable power uncertainty is modeled based on recently proposed truncated versatile distribution and involved in the scheduling model, in which the renewable power cost is considered by underestimation and overestimation penalty. The overall economy is achieved by fully considering the power-to-gas devices, combined heat and power generators and gas-fired boilers. Numerical studies for the day-ahead BES scheduling in an industrial peak are presented to demonstrate the merits of the proposed method. Results show that by capturing renewable power uncertainty, the system cost could be greatly reduced. The energy and gas storage could both greatly contribute to reduce the cost of renewable power uncertainty. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: combined electricity-gas-heat; energy and gas storage; Energy Internet; power-to-gas; renewable power uncertainty
Index Keywords: Cost reduction; Gases; Numerical methods; Scheduling; Combined heat and power; Energy forms; Energy internet; Gas storage; Renewable Power; Scheduling methods; Scheduling models; System costs; Gas fired boilers

Authors: Cheng Y., Tai Y.
Title: A MILP Model for Optimizing Distributed Resource System with Energy Storage and PV Considering Energy Storage Life Loss
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China
Authors with affiliations: Cheng, Y., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China; Tai, Y., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, North China Electric Power University, Beijing, 102206, China
Abstract: The optimized operation of the distributed resource system with energy storage and PV is of great significance for integration of renewable energy and improving the efficiency of power grid operation. In this paper, considering the influence of battery charging and discharging schedule on battery life loss, a chance constrained programming based optimal operation model is proposed. With the minimum operating cost and battery life cost of the distributed resources system as the objective function, the linearization method is developed to transfer the nonlinear optimization model to a mixed integer linear programming(MILP)model which can be solved by off-the-shelf commercial solvers. The simulation results show that facilitated with energy storage system, the distributed integrated renewable energy system has great potential to reduce peaks and fill valleys. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery life loss; mixed integer linear programming; operation optimization; PV

Authors: Jiang Y., Wu Q., Yang Y., Chi X.
Title: Design of a Home Energy Management System Based on Cloud Service
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Institute of Automation Hangzhou, Dianzi University, Hangzhou, China; School of Youngman Automotive, Hangzhou Vocational Technological School, Hangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Jiang, Y., Institute of Automation Hangzhou, Dianzi University, Hangzhou, China; Wu, Q., Institute of Automation Hangzhou, Dianzi University, Hangzhou, China; Yang, Y., Institute of Automation Hangzhou, Dianzi University, Hangzhou, China; Chi, X., School of Youngman Automotive, Hangzhou Vocational Technological School, Hangzhou, China
Abstract: With the increasingly serious energy and environmental problems, the proportion of new energy in total energy consumption increased continuously, the application of new energy in the home micro-grid can effectively alleviate the energy crisis, then the monitoring of energy in the home microgrid is becoming more critical. Based on the traditional home micro-grid, a home energy control system was designed which covers the home micro-grid architecture, the network communication control, and the human-computer interaction. The supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) was designed to monitor the working status of each component in the home micro-grid through various communication methods such as WIFI and RS485. For the current power load which has no communication ability, a smart socket based on WIFI was designed for the monitoring of home appliances and power supply equipment. The working data of the underlying device is upload to the cloud server built by the intelligent gateway and the human-computer interaction interface, the database storage system for running data, and the human-machine interface adopts the WeChat public number which can avoid many developments, then effectively reducing the cost of operations for user learning. The cloud-service-based home energy management system can effectively promote energy utilization and make home energy management more intelligent. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: A Virtual Synchronous Generator System Control Method with Battery SOC Feedback

Abstract: The virtual synchronous generator with the hybrid energy storage system consisting of battery and ultracapacitor allows the inverter to better simulate the inertia of the synchronous generator. When the power fluctuation occurs in the system., by introducing voltage deviation to make the fluctuation reasonably distributed between battery and ultracapacitor. In order to extend the service life of the battery to some extent., a control strategy with battery state of charge (SOC) feedback is proposed. By mode switching., the battery can stop charging when the SOC reaches the upper limit. The simulation model was built in Simulink and the method was verified by analyzing the operation of the battery in the stage of normal charge and discharge and the charge reached the upper limit. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Shi Z., Wang C., Lei X., Ye X., Yuan W., Cao Z.
Title: Research on the Technical Economy and Market Mechanism of Electric Heat Storage System Participating in Auxiliary Service
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Dept. of New Energy and Statistics, State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Jilin Electric Power Company, State Grid Corporation of China, Changchun, China
Authors with affiliations: Shi, Z., Dept. of New Energy and Statistics, State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wang, C., Dept. of New Energy and Statistics, State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Lei, X., Dept. of New Energy and Statistics, State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Ye, X., Dept. of New Energy and Statistics, State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Yuan, W., Dept. of New Energy and Statistics, State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Cao, Z., Jilin Electric Power Company, State Grid Corporation of China, Changchun, China
Abstract: The electric heat storage system has a fast response speed and high adjustment precision, and is an excellent peak-load regulation resource for the power system. This paper explains the basic types and working principles of electric heat storage systems, and summarizes the basic methods and compensation standards for electric heat storage facilities participating in the auxiliary service market. Through the case of a 10MW electric heat storage system in Northeast China, the paper analyzes the profitability of the electricity supply with or without capacity fee, government subsidies and bilateral transactions with the new energy station. The results show that under the current market and price mechanism, electric heat storage facilities participating in the ancillary services are less economical and less motivated, consistent with the actual situation. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Cui H., Hu A., Sang B., Yang B., Li G., Tao Y.
Title: Research on Method of Photovoltaic Power Station Assisting Power Grid Black Start Based on Energy Storage
Source title: 2nd IEEE Conference on Energy Internet and Energy System Integration, EI2 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: State Grid Corporation of China, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Cui, H., State Grid Corporation of China, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Hu, A., State Grid Corporation of China, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Sang, B., State Grid Corporation of China, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Yang, B., State Grid Corporation of China, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Li, G., State Grid Corporation of China, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Tao, Y., State Grid Corporation of China, China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China
Abstract: With the development of photovoltaic power generation and energy storage technology, scale of photovoltaic power station and energy storage power station increasing. After a large area of power outages, photovoltaic power station based on the energy storage can be considered as a black-start power. In this paper, the sustained and effective output of photovoltaic power plant is analyzed and evaluated according to power forecasting data of photovoltaic power station as a criterion for photovoltaic power station used as black-start power. A system black-start scheme optimization model is proposed with target of maximizing the total power provided by photovoltaic power station and energy storage combined system in the start-up time of the conventional thermal power units to be started. Also, photovoltaic power station based on energy storage assisting power grid black start process is presented. Numerical example is used to demonstrate the feasibility of using photovoltaic power station and energy storage system as system auxiliary black-start power and validity of system black-start optimization model. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Kujala M., Kololuoma T., Keskinen J., Lupo D., Mantysalo M., Kraft T.M.
Title: Screen Printed Vias for a Flexible Energy Harvesting and Storage Module
Source title: 2018 International Flexible Electronics Technology Conference, IFETC 2018
Affiliations: Faculty of Computing and Electrical Engineering, Tampere University of Technology, Tampere, Finland; VTT Technical Research Centre of Finland Ltd., Oulu, Finland
Authors with affiliations: Kujala, M., Faculty of Computing and Electrical Engineering, Tampere University of Technology, Tampere, Finland; Kololuoma, T., VTT Technical Research Centre of Finland Ltd., Oulu, Finland; Keskinen, J., Faculty of Computing and Electrical Engineering, Tampere University of Technology, Tampere, Finland; Lupo, D., Faculty of Computing and Electrical Engineering, Tampere University of Technology, Tampere, Finland; Mantysalo, M., Faculty of Computing and Electrical Engineering, Tampere University of Technology, Tampere, Finland; Kraft, T.M., Faculty of Computing and Electrical Engineering, Tampere University of Technology, Tampere, Finland
Abstract: This case study evaluates a highly flexible screen printed through-hole-via using silver microparticle inks for applications in energy harvesting and storage modules. The printed vias fabrication and reliability are evaluated by means of a double sided screen-printing method and repetitive (cyclic) bending tests. Vias, in 125 μm thick PET, were laser cut (50, 100, 150, and 200 μm nominal diameter) then filled, and simultaneously connected to adjacent vias, by screen printing. To investigate the use of the printed via in a monolithic energy module, the vias were used for the fabrication of a flexible printed supercapacitor (aqueous electrolyte and carbon electrode).The results indicate that the lower viscosity silver ink (DuPont 5064H) does not fill the via as effectively as the higher viscosity ink (Asahi LS411AW), and only the sidewall of the vias are coated as the via size increases (≥ 150 μm diameter). Conversely, the Asahi silver paste fills the via more thoroughly and exhibited a 100 % yield (1010 vias; 100 μm nominal via diameter) with the 2-step direct screen-printing method. The bending test showed no signs of via specific breakdown after 30 000 cycles. The results indicate that this via filling process is likely compatible with roll-to-roll screen printing to enable multi-layered printed electronics devices. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Bending reliability; Energy module; Flexible and printed electronics; Printed vias; Screen printing
Index Keywords: Bending tests; Electrodes; Electrolytes; Energy harvesting; Screen printing; Silver; Viscosity; Aqueous electrolyte; Carbon electrode; Energy modules; Lower viscosities; Micro particles; Printed electronics; Printed vias; Screen printing methods; Flexible electronics

Authors: Liu F., Hu B., Li R., Li Y.
Title: A Novel Control Strategy of Energy Storage System Considering Prediction Errors of Photovoltaic Power
Source title: 2018 15th International Conference on Control, Automation, Robotics and Vision, ICARCV 2018
Affiliations: Central South University, School of Information Science and Engineering, Changsha, 410083, China; Global Energy Interconnection Development and Coonertaion Orzanization, Beijing, 102209, China; College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, 410082, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, F., Central South University, School of Information Science and Engineering, Changsha, 410083, China; Hu, B., Central South University, School of Information Science and Engineering, Changsha, 410083, China; Li, R., Global Energy Interconnection Development and Coonertaion Orzanization, Beijing, 102209, China; Li, Y., College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, 410082, China
Abstract: The photovoltaic (PV) energy, as clean and renewable energy, has become increasingly important. With energy storage system, the PV power can become schedulable and the use efficiency of PV power can be greatly improved. The tracking output is one of the running modes for energy storage to adjust the PV power generation. However, the research on the tracking output do not consider the fluctuation of PV power generation, the upper and lower limits of prediction errors, or only consider tracking the power curve. In this paper, a novel control method is proposed based on the super short-term prediction PV power and the prediction errors distribution law to obtain the charge and discharge strategy for energy storage ahead. In this control method, the objective function includes three parts, respectively the D-value between the planned output and actual output of PV power and energy storage system, the change of the state of charge (SOC) with different weight, The constraint condition considers the power demand, flexibility requirement and storage costs comprehensive. Then the prediction errors distribution law can be obtained by analyzing prediction errors of the PV power, the proper errors correction parameters can be selected according to the law to get a more accurate predication range and make the energy storage scheduling strategy more flexible. The particle swarm optimization (PSO) algorithm is used to get the optimal charge and discharge power strategy in advance. With the data collected from typical PV power station as an example, the simulation results verify the feasibility and flexibility of the proposed strategy, it also provides effective reference scheme for day-ahead control of battery energy storage systems. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy storage system (ESS); Errors distribution law; Particle swarm optimization (PSO); Photovoltaic (PV) power; State of charge (SOC)
Index Keywords: Charging (batteries); Computer vision; Digital storage; Energy storage; Errors; Forecasting; Particle swarm optimization (PSO); Photovoltaic cells; Robotics; Battery energy storage systems; Charge and discharge; Constraint conditions; Distribution law; Energy storage systems; Particle swarm optimization algorithm; Photovoltaic; State of charge; Battery management systems

Authors: Rios A.C., Jadan D.M., Buestan F.N.
Title: Determination of the optimal size of the Energy Storage Systems in photovoltaic systems connected to the electricity network, through Mixed-Integer Linear Programming
Source title: 2018 IEEE 3rd Ecuador Technical Chapters Meeting, ETCM 2018
Affiliations: Instituto Superior, Tecnológico Del Azuay, Cuenca, Ecuador; Subdirección de Posgrados, De la Universidad Católica de Cuenca, Cuenca, Ecuador
Authors with affiliations: Rios, A.C., Instituto Superior, Tecnológico Del Azuay, Cuenca, Ecuador; Jadan, D.M., Subdirección de Posgrados, De la Universidad Católica de Cuenca, Cuenca, Ecuador; Buestan, F.N., Instituto Superior, Tecnológico Del Azuay, Cuenca, Ecuador
Abstract: This research and development project presents the optimization of BESS energy storage systems (Battery Energy Storage System) in photovoltaic systems connected to the electricity grid, using mixed integer linear programming algorithms. In the development of this work, the creation of a database of both load and generation profiles was first performed, the data obtained served to propose the mathematical optimization model together with their respective restrictions. The optimization model was solved through mixed linear programming algorithms and finally the optimization algorithm developed was tested for the electrical system of Santa Cruz Island, Galápagos province, where the integration of the electric grid with renewable energies is carried out as the PV generation. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Xu P., Flandre D., Bol D.
Title: Design of a 2.45-GHz RF Energy Harvester for SWIPT IoT smart sensors
Source title: 2018 IEEE Asian Solid-State Circuits Conference, A-SSCC 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: ECS Group, ICTEAM Institute Universite Catholique de Louvain, Belgium
Authors with affiliations: Xu, P., ECS Group, ICTEAM Institute Universite Catholique de Louvain, Belgium; Flandre, D., ECS Group, ICTEAM Institute Universite Catholique de Louvain, Belgium; Bol, D., ECS Group, ICTEAM Institute Universite Catholique de Louvain, Belgium
Abstract: Simultaneous wireless power and information transfer (SWIPT) is a flexible and cheap way to supply IoT smart sensors avoiding battery replacement. In this paper, we study the design of a 2.45-GHz RF energy harvester (RFEH) system based on a discrete-component matching network, a custom 65nm CMOS cross-coupled rectifier coupled with an off-the-shelf storage-charging power management unit (PMU) performing rectifier output voltage regulation with maximum power point tracking (MPPT). For 2.45-GHz operation, we propose a parasitic-aware sizing of π matching network. This introduces a maximum bound on the real impedance at the rectifier input to ensure good impedance matching in practice. MPPT is used to help reaching this target real impedance at given input RF power, as the rectifier input impedance is a function of both its input and output voltages. Measurement results show a sensitivity as low as-17.1 dBm with a peak power harvesting efficiency (PHE) of 48.3% at-3 dBm 2.45-GHz input RF power. Comparison between simulation and measurement results demonstrate that these results are limited by the parasitic capacitance and that PHE around 45% can be obtained down to-10 dBm with PCB/package improvement for lower parasitic capacitance. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: 2.45-GHz; impedance matching; maximum power point tracking; power harvesting efficiency; RF energy harvester
Index Keywords: Capacitance; Energy harvesting; Impedance matching (electric); Internet of things; Maximum power point trackers; Polychlorinated biphenyls; Rectifying circuits; Smart sensors; Voltage regulators; 2.45-GHz; Information transfers; Maximum Power Point Tracking; Power harvesting; Power management units (PMU); Rectifier output voltages; Rf energy harvesters; Simulations and measurements; Electric rectifiers

Authors: Wang H., Ding R., Mou X., Chu H.
Title: Research on the Coordinated Control of the Integrated Wind-PV-ES Microgrid System
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE 3rd Advanced Information Technology, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IAEAC 2018
Affiliations: Nanjing Foreign Language School, Nanjing, China; NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, H., Nanjing Foreign Language School, Nanjing, China; Ding, R., Nanjing Foreign Language School, Nanjing, China; Mou, X., NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China; Chu, H., NARI Group Corporation, State Grid Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, China
Abstract: Considering the characteristics of intermittent and fluctuating characteristics such as wind power, photovoltaic and other new energy generation, the introduction of large capacity energy storage system is an important way to increase the proportion of new energy generation. As an important way to realize the distributed power supply scale utilization, micro grid provides a new idea for the new energy accepted by power grid. However, due to the diverse forms and performance of distributed generation in micro grid, the coordinated control of distributed generation is very important to fully play the potential advantages of micro grid. In this context, the power characteristics of wind power and photovoltaic are analyzed. Based on the natural complementarity between them and the characteristics of real-time charging and discharging of energy storage, a micro grid system combining wind power, photovoltaic and energy storage is constructed. At the same time, the coordinated control of distributed generation is studied. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: coordination control; micro grid; photovoltaic; scenery complementation; wind power
Index Keywords: Distributed power generation; Electric power transmission networks; Energy storage; Wind power; Co-ordinated control; Complementation; Coordination control; Distributed power supplies; Energy storage systems; Micro grid; Photovoltaic; Power characteristic; Electric power system control

Authors: Wang L.
Title: Research on Optimal Scheduling of Energy Storage System Based on Particle Swarm Optimization

Affiliations: Tianjin City Vocational College, Tianjin, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, L., Tianjin City Vocational College, Tianjin, China
Abstract: In the power system, the power load of users will show a large gap between peak and valley, which may leads to the imbalance between supply and demand of power system. In this paper, the particle swarm optimization (PSO) algorithm is used to optimize the battery energy storage system to reduce the impact of peak load on the power grid, and help the power grid to smooth the power load fluctuation, and reduce the cost of the users. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Yang X., Zhu L., Zhang Z., Li L., Wang H.
Title: Electric vehicles charging and discharging control strategy based on independent DC micro-grid
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE 3rd Advanced Information Technology, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IAEAC 2018
Affiliations: College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Lanzhou University of Technology, Lanzhou, 730050, China; National Experimental Teaching Demonstration Center of Electrical and Control Engineering, Lanzhou University of Technology, Lanzhou, 730050, China; Key Laboratory of Advanced Control of Industrial Processes in Gansu Province, Lanzhou, 730050, China; State Key Laboratory of Large Electric Drive Systems and Equipment Technology, Tianshui, Gansu, 741000, China; Xinte Energy Co., Ltd, Urumqi, Xinjiang, 830000, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, X., College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Lanzhou University of Technology, Lanzhou, 730050, China, National Experimental Teaching Demonstration Center of Electrical and Control Engineering, Lanzhou University of Technology, Lanzhou, 730050, China, Key Laboratory of Advanced Control of Industrial Processes in Gansu Province, Lanzhou, 730050, China; Zhu, L., College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Lanzhou University of Technology, Lanzhou, 730050, China, Key Laboratory of Advanced Control of Industrial Processes in Gansu Province, Lanzhou, 730050, China; Zhang, Z., State Key Laboratory of Large Electric Drive Systems and Equipment Technology, Tianshui, Gansu, 741000, China; Li, L., College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Lanzhou University of Technology, Lanzhou, 730050, China, Key Laboratory of Advanced Control of Industrial Processes in Gansu Province, Lanzhou, 730050, China; Wang, H., Xinte Energy Co., Ltd, Urumqi, Xinjiang, 830000, China
Abstract: The independent running DC micro-grid has the problems of small system capacity and poor stability, and the proposed vehicle-to-micro-grid (V2M) concept can effectively alleviate the above problems. In view of the space-time and uncertainty of the charging and discharging characteristics of electric vehicles, a charge and discharge control strategy based on variable power time division control is proposed in this paper. The strategy takes the system power difference as the base, and carries out reasonable charge and discharge control to the electric vehicle group according to the current state of the DC micro-grid, the load demand and the peak valley period, so as to support the power balance of the micro-grid system effectively, and realize the stable operation of the independent DC micro grid. Finally, the simulation model of electric vehicle charging and discharging is built by using Matlab/Simulink to verify the effectiveness of the proposed control strategy. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: distributed energy storage; electric vehicle charging and discharging; independent DC micro-grid; power balance; V2M; variable power time division control

Authors: Li X., Mo Y., Di N., Oiu Y.
Title: Equalization Charge-discharge Control Strategy for Series-connected Vanadium Redox Flow Batteries Based on LC Oscillation Circuit
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE 3rd Advanced Information Technology, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IAEAC 2018
Affiliations: School of Electric Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Anhui, Hefei, 230009, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, X., School of Electric Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Anhui, Hefei, 230009, China; Mo, Y., School of Electric Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Anhui, Hefei, 230009, China; Di, N., School of Electric Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Anhui, Hefei, 230009, China; Oiu, Y., School of Electric Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Anhui, Hefei, 230009, China
Abstract: Research on series-connection vanadium redox fl ow batteries (S-VRBs) energy storage technology, an equalization scheme based on LC oscillation circuit is proposed. The inductor and capacitor are used to store energy and the state of charge (SOC) is used as an equalization criterion. The energy is transferred from the highest voltage VRB to the lowest voltage VRB. We build a simulation model of LC oscillation circuit in MATLAB/SUMLINK to verify the feasibility of the equalization scheme; and the VRB with different parameters is connected in series for charging and discharging equalization experiments. Simulations show that the LC oscillator circuit equalization control strategy can achieve VRB charge and discharge equalization, and the equalization speed is fast. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Yuan Z., Liu R., Ying X.
Title: Design of Bipolar Independent Adjustable Pulse of MAO Power System
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE 3rd Advanced Information Technology, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IAEAC 2018
Affiliations: College of Information Engineering, Shenyang University, China; Yantai Automotive Engineering Vocational College265500, China
Authors with affiliations: Yuan, Z., College of Information Engineering, Shenyang University, China; Liu, R., College of Information Engineering, Shenyang University, China; Ying, X., Yantai Automotive Engineering Vocational College265500, China
Abstract: In order to solve the problems of low power efficiency and high energy consumption in power technology of micro-arc oxidation, a bipolar individually adjustable pulse power system based on the processor STM32F427IIH6 is proposed, and the hardware circuit design is completed. The main circuit adopts the design way of positive and negative individually adjustable circuit; the STM32F427IIH6 processor in the control circuit is responsible for the information detection and data processing of the voltage and current acquisition data, and controls the output of PWM signal in real time by PID adjustment to drive the main circuit rectification and inverter circuit, the purpose is to realize double closed-loop intelligent control. After an actual analysis, the system has the design effects of fast response, high control accuracy, and stable output of positive and negative pulse. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zheng T., Lu W., Li X., Qiu Y., Yu L., Lu W.
Title: Soc Estimation of Vanadium Redox Flow Battery Based on OCV-DKF Algorithm
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE 3rd Advanced Information Technology, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IAEAC 2018
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China; Hefei WEGO Electric Automation Co. Ltd, Hefei, China; University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, China
Authors with affiliations: Zheng, T., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China; Lu, W., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China; Li, X., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China; Qiu, Y., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China; Yu, L., Hefei WEGO Electric Automation Co. Ltd, Hefei, China; Lu, W., University of Science and Technology of China, Hefei, China
Abstract: SOC(State of Charge) of VRB(Vanadium redox flow battery) is an important parameter for evaluating battery performance and estimating battery capacity, it is also a key basis for management and control of energy storage systems. In order to improve the estimation accuracy of SOC, a complex algorithm based on OCV(Open Circuit Voltage) and DKF(Double Kalman Filter) is proposed. After theoretical analysis and process derivation, a real-time charge/discharge simulation platform for 5kW/30 kWh VRB energy storage system was set up. The SOC was online estimated by using OCV-SOC curve and DKF algorithm. The results was compared with EKF(Extended Kalman Filter) algorithm and Ah method. Experiments show that the DKF algorithm has a better estimation effect and can stabilize the SOC estimation error within 1.5%. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Double Kalman Filter; Open Circuit Voltage; State Of Charge; Vanadium Redox Flow battery

Title: Analysis and validation of an LC input filter quadratic buck converter
Source title: International Power Electronics Congress - CIEP
Affiliations: Laboratorio de Electrónica de Potencia, ITESI, Irapuato, Guanajuato, 36821, Mexico; Facultad de Ciencias, UASLP, San Luis Potosí, SLP, 78290, Mexico
Authors with affiliations: Silva-Vera, E.D., Laboratorio de Electrónica de Potencia, ITESI, Irapuato, Guanajuato, 36821, Mexico; Sosa, J.M., Laboratorio de Electrónica de Potencia, ITESI, Irapuato, Guanajuato, 36821, Mexico; Vazquez, G., Laboratorio de Electrónica de Potencia, ITESI, Irapuato, Guanajuato, 36821, Mexico; Martinez-Rodriguez, P.R., Facultad de Ciencias, UASLP, San Luis Potosí, SLP, 78290, Mexico; Limones-Pozos, C.A., Laboratorio de Electrónica de Potencia, ITESI, Irapuato, Guanajuato, 36821, Mexico; Juarez-Balderas, M.A., Laboratorio de Electrónica de Potencia, ITESI, Irapuato, Guanajuato, 36821, Mexico
Abstract: This paper addresses the analysis and experimental validation in steady state of a non-isolated quadratic buck converter to which an LC input filter has been added. This modification ensures that the power source is continually connected and delivering power during each switching period, which yields a reduction of switching components at the input. This may even entail a time-continuous input current. Continuous input current is a desired requirement for sensitive electric power sources and electric storage systems. The space-state model of the converter and the dynamical analysis of the open-loop linearized model are presented. Steady-state analysis is also presented that allows obtaining expressions for switching ripples and average values and conditions for boundary conduction mode operation. Experimental results, performed in a laboratory prototype of the converter, are included to verify the presented analysis. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: current ripple; DC-DC converter; design parameters; LC filter; quadratic buck

Authors: Lopez-Flores D.R., Duran-Gomez J.L.
Title: Control and energy management system techniques in renewable sources: A brief review
Source title: International Power Electronics Congress - CIEP
Affiliations: División de Estudios de Posgrado e Investigación, Tecnológico Nacional de México, Instituto Tecnológico de Chihuahua, Chihuahua, Chih, CP 31310, Mexico
Authors with affiliations: Lopez-Flores, D.R., División de Estudios de Posgrado e Investigación, Tecnológico Nacional de México, Instituto Tecnológico de Chihuahua, Chihuahua, Chih, CP 31310, Mexico; Duran-Gomez, J.L., División de Estudios de Posgrado e Investigación, Tecnológico Nacional de México, Instituto Tecnológico de Chihuahua, Chihuahua, Chih, CP 31310, Mexico
Abstract: Renewable Energy Sources (RES) can be a solution to help in slowing down or mitigating the global climate changes affecting worldwide. Intermittent nature of those RES and the variability of its generated energy, can create some power quality issues, as well as problems related to reliability and stability when RES are connected to utility. One of the solutions to help mitigating those problems can be the integration of Energy Storage Systems (ESS) with renewable energy sources such as solar and/or wind. An efficient and safe control algorithm and an Energy Management System (EMS) are required to share energy from the ESS technology and the RES to the electric power system. In this paper, a brief review of some of the main EMS techniques which will be extensively reviewed and discussed from related papers. Typical applications and their classification are reviewed, as well as a comparative analysis and the selection of an EMS technique, considering several approaches, is presented. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Rodriguez-Benitez O.M., Ponce-Silva M., Aqui-Tapia J.A., Cortes-Garcia C.
Title: Resonant half-bridge current-inverter (RHBCI) used as power supply for induction lamps with high-power-factor and without electrolytic capacitors
Source title: International Power Electronics Congress - CIEP
Affiliations: Departamento de Electrónica, TecNM, CENIDET, Mexico; Osram S.A. de C.V., Mexico; Departamento de Ing. Mecánica, TecNm, CENIDET, Mexico
Authors with affiliations: Rodriguez-Benitez, O.M., Departamento de Electrónica, TecNM, CENIDET, Mexico; Ponce-Silva, M., Departamento de Electrónica, TecNM, CENIDET, Mexico; Aqui-Tapia, J.A., Osram S.A. de C.V., Mexico; Cortes-Garcia, C., Departamento de Ing. Mecánica, TecNm, CENIDET, Mexico
Abstract: This paper presents the use of the Resonant Half-Bridge Current-Inverter (RHBCI) as power supply for an induction fluorescent lamp, avoiding the use of electrolytic capacitors. The inductors of the RHBCI, are used to storage energy during the zero crossing of the input ac main voltage instead of to store it in electrolytic capacitors, in order to obtain high power factor and low total harmonic distortion (THD). Experimental results show a high power factor (95%), a THD less than 30% and compliance with the European standard 61000-3-2 class C. On the other hand, SiC devices are used in order to minimize the inverse recover time of the switches and obtain zero-current switching (ZCS). © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Wang T.
Title: An Analytical Model of Distributed Energy Storage Systems in Power Distribution Networks
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 17th International Symposium on Distributed Computing and Applications for Business Engineering and Science, DCABES 2018
Affiliations: China Energy Corporation, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, T., China Energy Corporation, Beijing, China
Abstract: Distributed Energy storage system (ESS) has a significant impact on the flexibility of medium/low voltage power distribution network to address the challenges. This paper explicitly quantifies the potential benefit of optimal coordinated multiple ESSs to support the secure power supply of power distribution networks with distributed generations (DGs) by providing capacity services. The proposed model was assessed through case studies: different demand conditions, different sizing of ESSs and reactive power provisioning. The numerical result demonstrates various benefit of coordination of ESSs in supporting flexible and secure operation of power distribution networks, e.g. peak demand reduction, reactive power support. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Dai Y., Yang C.S., Huang X., Xu D.
Title: RBF Neural Network Adaptive PID Control for Energy Storage System in Grid-Connected Photovoltaic Microgrid
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Information, Cybernetics, and Computational Social Systems, ICCSS 2018
Affiliations: School of Electric Power Engineering, Nanjing Institute of Technology, Nanjing, Jiangsu, 211167, China; Jiangsu Collaborative Innovation Center, Smart Distribution Network, Nanjing, Jiangsu, 211167, China; School of Internet of Things Engineering, Jiangnan University, Wuxi, Jiangsu, 214122, China
Authors with affiliations: Dai, Y., School of Electric Power Engineering, Nanjing Institute of Technology, Nanjing, Jiangsu, 211167, China, Jiangsu Collaborative Innovation Center, Smart Distribution Network, Nanjing, Jiangsu, 211167, China; Yang, C.S., School of Internet of Things Engineering, Jiangnan University, Wuxi, Jiangsu, 214122, China; Huang, X., School of Electric Power Engineering, Nanjing Institute of Technology, Nanjing, Jiangsu, 211167, China; Xu, D., School of Internet of Things Engineering, Jiangnan University, Wuxi, Jiangsu, 214122, China
Abstract: In photovoltaic microgrid, the output power of PV array will change with the change of external light and temperature. In order to maintain the stability of output power of PV system, energy storage system is usually added into the system. In a energy storage system, the most widely used control method is proportional-integral-derivative (PID)based control, however, the control effect of PID control is dependent on parameter tuning. In this paper, a PID controller based on adaptive radial basis function (RBF)neural network is proposed to adjust the PID parameters adaptively, and improve the response speed, anti-interference ability and robustness of the traditional PID controller. In the end, the energy storage system is built in the MATLAB/Simulink software, which is applied to the 100kW photovoltaic array to stabilize the output power when the light and temperature changed. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: The increasing number of residential energy cooperatives raises the importance of forming a local prosumer marketplace that is capable of managing energy and flexibility exchange efficiently. However, the coordination and control of independently operated flexible resources (e.g. storage, demand response) imposes critical challenges arising from the heterogeneity of the flexible resources, conflict of interests, and impact on the grid. Therefore, designing a simple yet efficient coordination mechanism that works on these distributed resources is of the utmost importance. We introduce a simulation model to study energy exchange with flexibility coordination while working towards an efficient allocation mechanism. A case study analysing different allocation mechanisms and consequent losses (compared to a base-case of No flexibility) in numerical experiments over real demand/generation profiles of the Pecan Street dataset elucidates the efficacy in energy and flexibility allocation while promoting cooperation between co-located flexibilities in residential cooperatives through local exchange. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy Cooperative; Exchange Mechanism; Market Design; Multiagent System
Index Keywords: Commerce; Electric power transmission networks; Multi agent systems; Smart power grids; Coordination and Control; Coordination mechanisms; Distributed resources; Efficient allocations; Energy Cooperative; Exchange mechanism; Market design; Numerical experiments; Housing

Authors: Rigas A., Messinis G., Hatziargyriou N.
Title: Application of Topology Identification on Optimal BESS Sizing in Distribution Systems
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Conference Europe, ISGT-Europe 2018
Affiliations: School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, National Technical University of Athens, Athens, Greece
Authors with affiliations: Rigas, A., School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, National Technical University of Athens, Athens, Greece; Messinis, G., School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, National Technical University of Athens, Athens, Greece; Hatziargyriou, N., School of Electrical and Computer Engineering, National Technical University of Athens, Athens, Greece
Abstract: Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) distributed over the Low Voltage (LV) network have been proposed as means of providing ancillary services in active distribution grids. Hence, optimal planning of BESS places and sizes is important so as to ensure economic and technical viability of such solutions. Most of the existing approaches for the optimal planning rely on previous knowledge of the network topology which, especially in low voltage networks, may not be available in practice. The paper assumes knowledge of P, Q, V measurements from smart meters placed in network leaf nodes only. At first, a topology identification algorithm is applied in order to estimate the network topology. Next, an algorithm for optimal sizing of BESS is applied on both the identified and original networks in order to assess the impact of topology identification potential errors in the planning procedure. Finally, the proposed algorithm is demonstrated on characteristic network cases. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage system; battery sizing; convex relaxation; network tomography; topology identification
Index Keywords: Battery storage; Electric power transmission networks; Planning; Q meters; Relaxation processes; Smart power grids; Topology; Battery energy storage systems; battery sizing; Convex relaxation; Network tomography; Topology identification; Data storage equipment

Authors: Shafiullah D.S., Vo T.H., Nguyen P.H.
Title: A Heuristic Search Approach for Sizing Battery Storage of a Neighbourhood including nearly Zero Energy Buildings (nZEB)
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Conference Europe, ISGT-Europe 2018
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), Eindhoven, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Shafiullah, D.S., Department of Electrical Engineering, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), Eindhoven, Netherlands; Vo, T.H., Department of Electrical Engineering, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), Eindhoven, Netherlands; Nguyen, P.H., Department of Electrical Engineering, Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e), Eindhoven, Netherlands
Abstract: With the changes introduced by the transition towards sustainable energy supply, major concerns like energy efficiency and system resilience can be handled by integrating adequate energy storage with renewable energy sources to realize net-zero energy in the neighbourhoods. In this paper, the neighbourhood surrounding VU medical center and university campus in Amsterdam, is selected as a case study to understand the impact of battery storage and photovoltaic generation in achieving the goal of energy neutrality. An optimization method is developed to identify the optimal size of battery storage by minimizing the net import energy from the grid. The proposed algorithm consists of two stages. The first stage uses mixed integer linear programming (MILP) to find the minimum cost associated with net import energy from the grid and the associated cost of a particular battery. The second stage applies heuristic search approach to identify the optimal size of the battery, which contributes to the most economical dispatch. The simulation results of the case study validate the proposed approach. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Boyouk N., Munzke N., Hiller M.
Title: Peak Shaving of a Grid connected-Photovoltaic Battery System at Helmholtz Institute Ulm (HIU)
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Conference Europe, ISGT-Europe 2018
Authors with affiliations: Boyouk, N.; Munzke, N.; Hiller, M.
Abstract: High demand of photovoltaic (PV) energy presents a challenge to operation and control of a power system. A Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) is an effective way to shave the peaks and to smooth the load during energy production changes with dynamic power demand. This paper introduces a novel peak shaving method with a PV-battery storage system. The method is tested on a system in U1m, Germany. The PV-battery system has 31 kWp from a PV array, which is connected to a 76 kWh Li-Ion battery with a peak power of 60 kW. The system has been in operation since May 2015. The threshold on load and State of Charge (SOC) of the battery is applied in the peak shaving method. The average of SOC and actual state of energy of the battery are used for the determination of the change in the threshold value on load. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Control system; Load; Peak shaving; target power
Index Keywords: Battery management systems; Charging (batteries); Control systems; Electric power transmission networks; Lithium-ion batteries; Loading; Photovoltaic cells; Smart power grids; Battery energy storage system (BESS); Battery storage system; Energy productions; Grid-connected photovoltaic; Operation and control; Peak shaving; Photovoltaic energy; Target power; Battery storage

Abstract: The proceedings contain 230 papers. The topics discussed include: battery energy storage requirements for mitigating pv output fluctuations; a scenario-based framework for technical validation of demand response; automated quantification of PV hosting capacity in distribution networks under user-defined control and optimization procedures; scalable electric power system simulator; impact of electric vehicle charging control on the frequency response: study of the GB system; applying machine learning to study the relationship between electricity consumption and weather variables using open data; real time phasor estimation based on recursive prony with several channels of one PMU; analysis of activation constraints and their effect on demand-side flexibility allocations; and a combined geospatial approach to extension planning of wind farms and transmission networks.

Authors: Mansson D.
Title: Sizing Energy Storage Systems used to Improve Privacy from Smart Meter Readings for Users in Sweden
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Conference Europe, ISGT-Europe 2018
Affiliations: Department of Electromagnetic Engineering, School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, Royal Institute of Technology KTH, Stockholm, Sweden
Authors with affiliations: Mansson, D., Department of Electromagnetic Engineering, School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, Royal Institute of Technology KTH, Stockholm, Sweden
Abstract: The smart power grid of the future will be heavily dependent on accurate information from the users via smart meter readings. However, from the information on the users power profile much knowledge about the behavior can be acquired, resulting in a breach of privacy. To mask the power profile an energy storage system can be used that obfuscates the smart meter readings. In this paper, we investigate the storage capacity needed if the smart meter is required to report a constant power usage for the user, electricity as well as distributed heating, to the utility. Both single and multiple users per energy storage system are investigated using both derived as well as measured power profiles. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Electric power measurement; Electric power transmission networks; Smart meters; Constant power; Energy storage systems; Multiple user; Power profile; Storage capacity; Smart power grids

Authors: Vatani M., Vie P.J.S., Ulleberg O.
Title: Cycling Lifetime Prediction Model for Lithium-ion Batteries Based on Artificial Neural Networks
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Conference Europe, ISGT-Europe 2018
Affiliations: Institute for Energy Technology (IFE), Instituttveien 18, Kjeller, NO-2007, Norway
Authors with affiliations: Vatani, M., Institute for Energy Technology (IFE), Instituttveien 18, Kjeller, NO-2007, Norway; Vie, P.J.S., Institute for Energy Technology (IFE), Instituttveien 18, Kjeller, NO-2007, Norway; Ulleberg, O., Institute for Energy Technology (IFE), Instituttveien 18, Kjeller, NO-2007, Norway
Abstract: Lithium-ion battery is introduced recently as a key solution for energy storage problems both in stationary and mobility applications. However, one main limitation of this technology is the aging, i.e., the degradation of storage capacity. This degradation happens in every condition, whether the battery is used or not, but in different proportions dependent on the usage and external conditions. Due to the complexity of aging phenomena to characterize, lifetime modeling of Li-ion cells attracts the attention of researchers in recent years. This paper develops cycling lifetime prediction models, for two different commercially available Li-ion cells, by using artificial neural networks. First, accelerated cycling tests are performed under different testing conditions, including different temperatures, state of charges, depth of discharges, and discharge current rates. Then, the test data is used to train a feedforward neural network that can predict one-step ahead state of health of the cells that are cycled under different conditions. Thereafter, a sensitivity analysis method is used to investigate the dependence of the state of health of the cells to each input parameter by calculating the partial derivative of the neural network model output with regard to each input. Finally, the sensitivity profile over the whole range of the inputs is provided and discussed. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Battery management systems; Digital storage; Electric power transmission networks; Feedforward neural networks; Forecasting; Ions; Sensitivity analysis; Smart power grids; Depth of discharges; Different proportions; Discharge currents; External conditions; Lifetime prediction models; Neural network model; Partial derivatives; Sensitivity profiles; Lithium-ion batteries

Title: Implementation and Verification of a Realistic Battery Model in the DEMKit Simulation Software
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Conference Europe, ISGT-Europe 2018
Affiliations: Department of EEMCS, University of Twente, Enschede, Netherlands

Abstract: In this work we consider the implementation of the DiBu-model, a realistic model for battery State of Charge prediction, in DEMKit, a smart grid energy management toolkit. The implementation is discussed in detail and the differences between the ideal battery model previously used, and the new realistic model are shown. Lastly the model and implementation are validated by comparing the State of Charge predicted using DEMKit to the State of Charge derived from measurements on an actual battery. The predicted battery behavior matches reality quite well, the difference between the predicted and measured state of charge is generally less than 2 %. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Forecast-based Optimization of Islanded Microgrids
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Conference Europe, ISGT-Europe 2018
Affiliations: Department of Information and Computing Sciences, Utrecht University, Utrecht, Netherlands; Utrecht, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Brouwer, R.J.J., Department of Information and Computing Sciences, Utrecht University, Utrecht, Netherlands; Van Den Akker, J.M., Department of Information and Computing Sciences, Utrecht University, Utrecht, Netherlands; Dignum, F.P.M., Utrecht, Netherlands; Vermeiden, W., Department of Information and Computing Sciences, Utrecht University, Utrecht, Netherlands; Zown, B.V., Department of Information and Computing Sciences, Utrecht University, Utrecht, Netherlands
Abstract: In the context of the energy transition, the operational management of microgrids becomes an issue of increasing importance. In this paper, we compare two optimization models for planning generators and storage units in an islanded microgrid, while dealing with uncertainty in load-and PV-forecasts. These models are combined with a number of re-planning strategies, and evaluated through a case study of an islanded microgrid in the Netherlands. As a result, one of our algorithms is currently implemented in this microgrid. In our analysis of the case study, we identify features of the microgrid that play an important role in determining whether these approaches are useful and we show the effectiveness of using re-planning strategies. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Smart power grids; Energy transitions; Islanded microgrid; Micro grid; Netherlands; Operational management; Optimization models; Re-planning; Storage units; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Becirovic V., Karic F., Ligata K., Smaka S.
Title: Analysis of slow voltage variations and losses in LVN with integrated PV power plants and ESS
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Conference Europe, ISGT-Europe 2018
Affiliations: Faculty of Electrical Engineering Sarajevo, University of Sarajevo, Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina
Authors with affiliations: Becirovic, V., Faculty of Electrical Engineering Sarajevo, University of Sarajevo, Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina; Karic, F., Faculty of Electrical Engineering Sarajevo, University of Sarajevo, Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina; Ligata, K., Faculty of Electrical Engineering Sarajevo, University of Sarajevo, Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina; Smaka, S., Faculty of Electrical Engineering Sarajevo, University of Sarajevo, Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina
Abstract: The power system (PS) evolves with the introduction of new technologies in the sectors of production, transmission, distribution and control of electricity consumption. The philosophy of PS control, operation and management is changing. The public low-voltage network (LVN) faces the major changes due to integration of new smart grid technologies. The integration of photovoltaic power plants (PVPPs) and Energy Storage System (ESS) in LVN is a focus of this paper. Three scenarios are considered: (1) analysis of LVN without PVPPs and ESS, (2) analysis of LVN with PVPPs, where LVN is treated as energy storage (ES), (3) analysis of LVN with PVPPs and ESS. The novel algorithm for ESS control aiming to peak load reduction is presented in the paper. Losses and voltage conditions are analyzed on all LVN buses. The slow voltage variations analysis is carried out according to the EN50160 standard. It was shown that the connection of the ESS has negligible impact on losses in LVN. Slow voltage variations are within limits defined by standard EN50160 for all considered scenarios. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy storage (ES); Energy storage system (ESS); Load profile; Low-voltage network (LVN); Photovoltaic power plant (PVPP); Power System (PS)
