Authors: Jiang H., Zhang C.
Title: Coordinated control scheme for superconducting magnetic energy storage unit to boost transient stability of wind farm connected power system
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE International Conference on Applied Superconductivity and Electromagnetic Devices, ASEMD 2018
Affiliations: School of Electrical and Information Engineering Tianjin University, Tianjin, China
Authors with affiliations: Jiang, H., School of Electrical and Information Engineering Tianjin University, Tianjin, China; Zhang, C., School of Electrical and Information Engineering Tianjin University, Tianjin, China
Abstract: The wind power penetration in power system is increasing yearly, and the requirement of low voltage ridethrough (LVRT) is put forward. Yet all kinds of LVRT schemes commonly used in wind turbines tend to change the running state of the wind turbine and bring double impact to the transient stability of the system. This paper combines the output power of wind turbine with the equivalent mechanical power of the system, deducing the mathematical relationship between them. On this basis, it analyzes the mechanism of the influence of LVRT on the transient stability of the system, simultaneously proposing a superconducting magnetic energy storage (SMES) coordinated control scheme to improve the transient stability of the wind farm connected power system. At the same time that the LVRT is achieved by the crowbar of the rotor, compensatory strategy of SMES, according to the influence law on the mechanical power of the equivalent system, is adjusted to achieve higher transient stability performance of the system. Finally, the effectiveness of the proposed control scheme is demonstrated by simulation in MATLAB/Simulink. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Low voltage ride-through(LVRT); Rotor crowbar; Superconducting magnetic energy storage(SMES); Transient stability

Authors: Chen L., Li G., Chen H., Xu Y., Ren L., Tang Y.
Title: Low-voltage ride-through improvement in a dfigbased wind turbine by integrated use of a SFCL and DC-link regulation of a SMES system
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE International Conference on Applied Superconductivity and Electromagnetic Devices, ASEMD 2018
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China

Abstract: To improve the low-voltage ride-through (LVRT) performance of a doubly-fed induction generator (DFIG)-based wind turbine, this paper proposes the integrated use of a superconducting fault current limiter (SFCL) and a superconducting magnetic energy storage (SMES) system. The SFCL is installed at the stator side of the DFIG, and its functions are to limit the overcurrent and to compensate the voltage sag during the fault feeding. The SMES is located to the DC-link of the DFIG, and its function is to control the surplus unbalanced power. The mathematical modeling and simulation verification are carried out, and also different configurations of the SFCL and the SMES are assessed. From the results, the SFCL-SMES is able to quickly limit the fault current and alleviate the voltage sag. Thus, an effective LVRT support is obtained for the DFIG. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Jiangang C., Jian F., Jianxun J.
Title: Study on the application and control strategy of superconducting magnetic energy storage system in EMU
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE International Conference on Applied Superconductivity and Electromagnetic Devices, ASEMD 2018
Affiliations: School of Information Science Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Tianjin University, Tianjin, China

Abstract: In this paper, the control algorithm of the grid-side converter of CRH EMU is studied, in order to improve the stability of the control system and optimize the output performance index of the grid side converter. Firstly, the operational principle of the grid-side converter and the commonly used transient current control algorithm are analyzed. Then the DQ current decoupling control algorithm is introduced. On this basis, an optimal transient current control algorithm is proposed based on the advantages of the two control algorithms. Finally, the computer simulation and test performance comparison are carried out. The simulation and experimental results indicates, comparing with common transient direct current control algorithm, the optimized transient current control algorithm has better dynamic response capability, and the output performance index of grid-side converter is significantly improved, taking on good robustness. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zhang T., Li H., Chen Y., Li Z., Jiao C., Gao Y.
Title: Simulation of electromagnetic launch system driven by a repetitive inductive pulsed power supply
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE International Conference on Applied Superconductivity and Electromagnetic Devices, ASEMD 2018
Affiliations: School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Shandong University of Technology, Zibo, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, T., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Shandong University of Technology, Zibo, China; Li, H., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Shandong University of Technology, Zibo, China; Chen, Y., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Shandong University of Technology, Zibo, China; Li, Z., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Shandong University of Technology, Zibo, China; Jiao, C., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Shandong University of Technology, Zibo, China; Gao, Y., School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Shandong University of Technology, Zibo, China
Abstract: This paper discusses the feasibility of applying a repetitive inductive pulsed power supply (PPS) in electro-magnetic launch (EML) system. The repetitive inductive PPS was constructed based on a high temperature superconducting pulsed power transformer (HTSPPT). A 3-m long simple railgun model was used for the verification simulation of the PPS. The influence of circuit parameters on the launching performance was studied by using Matlab/Simulink software platform. The simulation results show that the repetitive inductive PPS is suitable for driving the EML system. The load current pulse can be cut off rapidly and the residual energy can be driven back to the primary inductor, which is beneficial to eliminate the muzzle arc of railgun system and improve the launching efficiency. Reasonable selection of circuit parameters can improve the launching performance of the system. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Chen L., Chen H., Li G., Xu Y., Ren L., Tang Y.
Title: Application of a Resistive Type Superconducting Fault Current Limiter for a DC Microgrid System
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE International Conference on Applied Superconductivity and Electromagnetic Devices, ASEMD 2018
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, L., School of Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Chen, H., School of Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Li, G., School of Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Xu, Y., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China; Ren, L., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China; Tang, Y., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China
Abstract: The microgrid technology has been proposed to achieve an efficient integration of distributed renewable energy sources, and it is critical to ensure the microgrid's safety and stability under short-circuit faults. In this paper, the application study of a resistive type superconducting fault current Iimiter (SFCL) for protecting a DC microgrid system is conducted. For the DC microgrid with wind, PV generators and energy storage, the effects of the SFCL are investigated. Using MATLAB, a detailed microgrid model with the resistive SFCL is built, and different current-limiting parameters are taken into account. From the simulation results, applying the resistive SFCL enables to well suppress the DC fault current and compensate the bus voltage sag. In summary, the resistive SFCL may strengthen the DC microgrid's transient characteristics, and make the wind and PV generators meet the fault-ride-through (FRT) requirements. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: In order to reduce the harmonics pollution by AC drive electric locomotive and EMU in traction power supply, the current analytical method is proposed, harmonic formula of grid- side current was given. The effects of harmonic frequency characteristics and amplitude characteristics on the current harmonic are analyzed, the harmonic suppression method is proposed. The correctness of the theoretical analysis method is proved by simulation analysis and experimental verification. In order to solve the problem of harmonic performance of train network side current, an effective and feasible new method is provided. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Geng G., Wu Y., Chen Z., Fang J.
Title: 3-D finite element analysis of electromagnetic characteristics of composite HTS Conductor
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE International Conference on Applied Superconductivity and Electromagnetic Devices, ASEMD 2018
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Geng, G., School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, China; Wu, Y., School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, China; Chen, Z., School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, China; Fang, J., School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing Jiaotong University, Beijing, China
Abstract: With the development of high-temperature superconducting (HTS) magnetic energy storage (SMES) devices, the superconducting electrical equipment becomes lighter and lighter and power density becomes higher and higher. It is an inevitable trend to make SMES magnets with composite HTS conductors. The critical current(Ic) of the composite conductors is affected by the magnetic field and the angle between magnetic field and composite conductor. At the same time, the magnetic field distribution also affects the AC loss in the composite conductor. Therefore, the electromagnetic analysis of the superconducting composite conductor is very significant. By establishing a three-dimensional (3D) finite element simulation model in ANSYS, we can draw the conclusion that the magnetic flux density at the edge of the composite conductor is larger than that of at the middle. Compared with a single superconducting tape, magnetic flux density distribution of composite conductors is more uniform. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Temperature field simulation of a solenoidal magnet wound by ReBCO tapes

Abstract: Superconducting magnetic energy storage (SMES) systems can store magnetic energy in superconducting magnets, and release the stored energy when required. As compared to other commercial energy storage systems like battery energy storage, the SMES is generally highlighted for fast response speed, high power density and high operational efficiency. This paper presents the temperature field distribution of a solenoidal magnet wound by ReBCO tapes to demonstrate the feasibility of the developed ReBCO magnet for the use in various high-current SMES applications. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Hao L., Huang Z., Qiu D., Dong F.
Title: Numerical study on AC Loss of HTS coil with DC transport current under external AC magnetic field
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE International Conference on Applied Superconductivity and Electromagnetic Devices, ASEMD 2018
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Hao, L., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Huang, Z., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Qiu, D., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Dong, F., Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China
Abstract: High temperature superconducting (HTS) coils can produce stronger magnetic fields compared with conventional permanent magnet. Superconducting magnets wound by YBCO coated conductors can be used on high-speed maglev train, wind generator, energy storage, and other applications. In some cases, such as the rotor of the long-stator linear synchronous motor, superconducting magnets carry a DC current under an external AC magnetic field, because of the harmonics of the stator current and the rotor vibration. The AC loss generated by the external AC field is an essential issue for selecting the capacity of the refrigerator. In this paper, a numerical model of a large-scale circular superconducting magnet is built in order to study its AC losses under the external AC magnetic field. Then the AC losses of the DC HTS magnet under external AC field with different amplitudes and frequencies are calculated, and according to the calculation, the change rules of AC loss versus the amplitude and frequency of the magnetic field are obtained. © 2018 IEEE.

As compared to other commercial energy storage systems like battery energy storage, the SMES is generally highlighted for fast response speed, high power density and high operational efficiency. This paper presents the structural design and performance tests of a solenoidal magnet wound by ReBCO tapes to demonstrate the feasibility of the developed ReBCO magnet for the use in various high-current SMES applications. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Yan N., Zhang B., Ma S.
Title: Research on distributed energy planning method of active distribution network based on load forecasting
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE International Conference on Applied Superconductivity and Electromagnetic Devices, ASEMD 2018
Affiliations: Shenyang University of Technology, Shen Yang, China
Authors with affiliations: Yan, N., Shenyang University of Technology, Shen Yang, China; Zhang, B., Shenyang University of Technology, Shen Yang, China; Ma, S., Shenyang University of Technology, Shen Yang, China
Abstract: To ensure the efficiency of the utilization of distributed energy is effectively improved, and the reliability and economy of the power distribution network are increased. In this paper, a location and capacity planning method for distributed energy and energy storage system based on load forecasting is proposed. Firstly, the load is predicted by the requirement correlation group multi time point method. Secondly, the effects of line loss, energy storage system peak regulation and new energy cost on local distribution system are considered, The multi-objective optimization is established with the constraint of power balance and so on, the adaptive genetic algorithm particle swarm optimization (PSO) is used to solve multiple targets. Finally, the IEEE-RTS 24 bus system is used to plan the distribution network. The results show that the proposed planning method can reasonably configure the distributed system capacity, the economic operation of the power grid will be guaranteed, it provides the basis and method for the planning and expansion of the active distribution network. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zheng Z.-X., Xiao X.-Y., Huang C.-J.
Title: Performance evaluation of a MW-class SMES-based DVR and SFCL for enhancing transient voltage quality
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE International Conference on Applied Superconductivity and Electromagnetic Devices, ASEMD 2018

Abstract: Design and performance evaluation of a MW-class dynamic voltage restorer (DVR) and Superconducting Fault Current Limiter (SFCL) combined scheme is presented for current limitation and mitigation of voltage sag disturbances. A 0.3-H/1.76-kA superconducting magnetic energy storage (SMES) and SFCL device are structurally designed for MW-class power exchange operations. Simulation cases with regard to severe grid fault are carried out. Simulations results have demonstrated that the stabilizations of load voltages, and the suppressions of voltage sag and fault current come mainly from the cooperative operation of the SFCL and the fast-response SMES based DVR device. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Li T., Zeng L., Huang Q., Liu X.D., Liu Y., Xie Q., Chen X.Y.
Title: A DC-type dynamic voltage restorer based on hybrid energy storage
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE International Conference on Applied Superconductivity and Electromagnetic Devices, ASEMD 2018
Affiliations: School of Engineering, Sichuan Normal University, Chengdu, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, T., School of Engineering, Sichuan Normal University, Chengdu, China; Zeng, L., School of Engineering, Sichuan Normal University, Chengdu, China; Huang, Q., School of Engineering, Sichuan Normal University, Chengdu, China; Liu, X.D., School of Engineering, Sichuan Normal University, Chengdu, China; Liu, Y., School of Engineering, Sichuan Normal University, Chengdu, China; Xie, Q., School of Engineering, Sichuan Normal University, Chengdu, China; Chen, X.Y., School of Engineering, Sichuan Normal University, Chengdu, China
Abstract: Conceptual design and performance evaluation of a DC-type dynamic voltage restorer (DVR) system are presented for mitigation of DC voltage quality disturbances in various sensitive-load situations such as in electric vehicle charging stations and data centers. A 3-mH/225-A superconducting magnetic energy storage (SMES) coil is introduced to cooperate with conventional battery energy storage (BES) device for developing a new hybrid energy storage (HES) system in the DCtype DVR. Various simulation cases with regard to combined voltage sag and swell disturbances are carried out. The simulations and comparisons among the SMES-based, BESbased and HES-based DVR schemes have demonstrated that the HES-based DVR scheme integrates the merits of fast response speed and high power density from the SMES-based scheme and the merits of low capital cost and high energy density from the BES-based scheme. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Yang Z., Xia L., Guan X.
Title: Fluctuation Reduction of Wind Power with Battery Energy Storage Systems
Source title: IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Department of Automation, Center for Intelligent and Networked Systems (CFINS), Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China; MOE KLINNS Lab, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, 710049, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, Z., Department of Automation, Center for Intelligent and Networked Systems (CFINS), Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China; Xia, L., Department of Automation, Center for Intelligent and Networked Systems (CFINS), Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China; Guan, X., Department of Automation, Center for Intelligent and Networked Systems (CFINS), Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China, MOE KLINNS Lab, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, 710049, China
Abstract: Due to the characteristics of intermittency and uncertainty of wind power, the drastic wind power fluctuations have negative impacts on the safety and stability of power systems. In this paper, we focus on a wind farm with a battery energy storage system (BESS). The objective is to reduce the fluctuation of total output power by dynamically scheduling the charging and discharging power of BESS. The randomness of wind power is characterized by a periodic Markov chain from a long-term viewpoint. The variance of the power output is chosen as the indicator of long-term fluctuations. However, since the variance function is quadratic and non-additive, this scheduling problem does not fit the model of Markov decision processes (MDPs). We use the sensitivity-based optimization method to derive a difference formula to overcome this difficulty, which is the basis of the proposed iterative optimization algorithm. The optimal policy derived by the algorithm can determine the (dis)charging power of the BESS at each situation of the wind power, the battery energy level, and the hour of days. The performance of the proposed approach is verified through numerical experiments using real data from National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL). Simulation results demonstrate the efficiency of the proposed approach, © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage systems; fluctuation reduction; Markov decision processes; Wind power
Index Keywords: Charging (batteries); Digital storage; Iterative methods; Markov processes; Scheduling; Secondary batteries; Wind power; Battery energy storage system (BESS); Battery energy storage systems; Iterative optimization algorithms; Markov Decision Processes; National Renewable Energy Laboratory; Numerical experiments; Safety and stabilities; Sensitivity-based optimizations; Battery storage

Authors: Yang L., Guan X., Wu J., Dai S.
Title: A Multi-layered Distributed Cloud Network for Cyber-Physical Energy System
Source title: IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Ministry of Education, Key Laboratory for Intelligent Networks and Network Security, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, Shaanxi, 710049, China; SKLMS Lab, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, Shaanxi, 710049, China

Abstract: The diversity of power sources for electricity generation excites the current smart grid to evolve towards Cyber-Physical Energy System (CPES), which integrates with other systems, such as natural gas and heat. By advanced communication technologies, CPES can achieve effective energy fusion, real-time computation and precise control. With the increasing number of energy applications that bring large quantities of data, it calls for sufficient computing and storage resources with fast transmission and powerful processing to satisfy users' service level agreements (SLAs). This paper presents a multi-layered distributed cloud network (MDC) for CPES, with the design of the physical integration of energy systems, a distributed cloud architecture and a hierarchal information structure based on the fifth generation (5G). Furthermore, we present a two-level resource allocation model for cloud network, which aims to decide the location of deploying cloud facilities and dynamically adjust the number of virtual machines (VMs) to deal with the demand variation. We also simplify the model to only one level utilizing scalarization. The simulation shows the proposed model performs effectively compared to centralized solutions. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: 5G mobile communication systems; Cyber Physical System; Digital storage; Electric power transmission networks; Network layers; Communication technologies; Electricity generation; Energy applications; Fifth generation (5g); Information structures; Real-time computations; Resource allocation model; Service level agreement (SLAs); Smart power grids

Authors: Lu Z., Peng T., Chen W.
Title: Automated Process State Identification for Metal Additive Manufacturing based on Power Data
Source title: IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering
Affiliations: School of Mechanical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Institute of Industrial Engineering, School of Mechanical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China
Authors with affiliations: Lu, Z., School of Mechanical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Peng, T., Institute of Industrial Engineering, School of Mechanical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Chen, W., Institute of Industrial Engineering, School of Mechanical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China
Abstract: To reduce the energy consumption of metal additive manufacturing, a thorough understanding of energy consumption in each process states is important. This paper introduces an algorithm to automatically identify the process states of a SLM machine based on power data. The proposed algorithm outlines a three-step procedure: data preprocessing, state identifier, results storage and assessment. Savizky-Golay (SG) filter and Extremum Slope of Regression Lines (ESRL) methods were used in the algorithm. Two samples of power profile were used to validate the algorithm, and the total error rates are both within 2%, average identification time for each data is 0.0016 seconds. In addition, some issues to be addressed are given, including potential for process state monitoring, state identification for scanning with different parameters, development of intelligent algorithm, and higher sampling rate. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Wu H., Wang J., Liu T., Xing Y., Xu P.
Title: Performance Evaluation of a Bidirectional Three-Phase DC-AC Converter with Embedded DC-DC Converter and Carrier-Based PWM Strategy
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Center for More-Electric-Aircraft Power System, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Wu, H., Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Center for More-Electric-Aircraft Power System, Nanjing, China; Wang, J., Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Center for More-Electric-Aircraft Power System, Nanjing, China; Liu, T., Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Center for More-Electric-Aircraft Power System, Nanjing, China; Xing, Y., Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Center for More-Electric-Aircraft Power System, Nanjing, China; Xu, P., Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Center for More-Electric-Aircraft Power System, Nanjing, China
Abstract: A bidirectional three-phase DC-AC converter with an embedded DC-DC converter for storage interface is analyzed and evaluated in this paper. With the help of the embedded DC-DC converter, a constant and stable intermittent DC-bus can be provided for the three-phase converter. Different from a conventional two-stage DC-AC converter, only a small ratio of power needs to be processed by the embedded DC-DC converter. Therefore, the conversion stages and power losses of the whole DC-AC converter are reduced. A novel carrier-based (CB) PWM strategy is presented for the proposed bidirectional three-phase DC-AC converter. By injecting a zero-sequence component into the modulation signals, the power processed by the embedded DC-DC converter is minimized. Operation principles, characteristics and implementation of the proposed solution are analyzed in detail. The feasibility and effectiveness of the presented solutions are evaluated with experimental results. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Effect of Battery Power on Capacitor Voltage Ripple Characteristics in Modular Multilevel Converter with Integrated Battery Energy Storage System
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018

Abstract: Modular Multilevel Converter (MMC) with integrated Battery Energy Storage System (BESS), where the battery strings are connected to each Submodule (SM) through DC-DC converters, can transfer energy among the DC link, the AC grid, and the batteries. And this flexible structure is suitable to be applied in the microgrid and the wind power generation system, in which the BESS is needed to smooth energy fluctuations. However, compared with the common MMC, the Battery Manage System (BMS) which is used in BESS to balance the State of Charge (SOC) among batteries makes the capacitor voltage ripple of each Submodule different and complicated. The capacitor selection needs to take this into consideration. Some simulation results under different initial SOC situations derived from a Simulation model are given to evaluate the influence. And some corresponding conclusions and suggestions are obtained based on these simulation results. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Peng F., Wang H., Yu L.
Title: A Hierarchical ZVS Battery Equalizer Based on Bipolar CCM Buck-Boost Units
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Peng, F., School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, China; Wang, H., School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, China; Yu, L., School of Information Science and Technology, ShanghaiTech University, Shanghai, China
Abstract: Conventional battery equalizers rely on unipolar continuous-conduction mode of power electronic converters. This causes substantial energy losses during the switching transitions. To cope with this issue, this paper proposes a novel hierarchical battery equalizer based on bipolar continuous-conduction mode buck-boost units. In the proposed structure, the inductor current is controlled to enter into the negative region at the end of each switching period. Thus, the body diode of power MOSFET provides a freewheeling path for the inductor current during the dead band. This ensures zero-voltage switching of both power MOSFETs. Therefore, the switching losses are significantly reduced. Meanwhile, the integral of the inductor negative current is precisely controlled to minimize the circulating current. This guarantees both minimized conduction losses and suitable equalization speed. The operation principle and control strategy of the equalizer are analyzed. The comparison of equalization speed between different equalizer is presented. An experimental prototype to balance four series-connected Lithium-ion battery cells is implemented. Both simulation and experimental results validate the functionality and analysis of this battery equalizer. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Yang J., Ye C., Zhou Y., Xu W., Li Y., Xiong F.
Title: Design of a Homopolar Inductor Alternator Based on a 2-D Equivalent Model
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Wuhan, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, J., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Wuhan, China; Ye, C., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Wuhan, China; Zhou, Y., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Wuhan, China; Xu, W., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Wuhan, China; Li, Y., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Wuhan, China; Xiong, F., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Wuhan, China
Abstract: Homopolar inductor alternator (HIA) has wide range of applications in the field of flywheel energy storage system with the merits of solid rotor structure, brushless exciting and low idling losses. While the design progress of HIA is complex and time consuming due to its three-denominational (3-D) magnetic circuit structure. To solve the above-mentioned problem, a new method to design HIA and the corresponding optimized measures are implemented. At the beginning, the method and principle of superposing the air-gap flux density are introduced. Based on it, the HIA can be equivalent to a wound-field salient pole alternator (WSPA) with two-denominational (2-D) magnetic circuit structure. The HIA is designed according to the design method of WSPA. Meanwhile, the saturation of stator shell and rotor shaft of HIA is considered in the design progress. To facilitate the design, an automatic design program using Monte Carlo search method is developed. Finally, both the effectiveness of this equivalent method and the correctness of automatic design program are validated by finite-element analysis (FEA) and corresponding experiments. The results show that the proposed method would be helpful for the design of HIA. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: 2-D magnetic circuit structure; Homopolar inductor alternator (HIA); Wound-field salient pole alternator (WSPA)
Index Keywords: Electric inductors; Energy conversion; Magnetic circuits; Magnetic devices; Magnetism; Monte Carlo methods; Synchronous generators; Air gap flux density; Automatic design; Design progress; Equivalent model; Flywheel energy storage system; Homopolar inductor alternator (HIA); Magnetic circuit structures; Salient poles; Design

Authors: Gruber W., Radman K., Gobl E.
Title: Novel Bearingless Flux-Switching Motor with Exterior Rotor
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: Institute of Electrical Drives and Power Electronics, Johannes Kepler University Linz, Linz, 4040, Austria; Linz Center of Competence in Mechatronics, Linz, 4040, Austria
Authors with affiliations: Gruber, W., Institute of Electrical Drives and Power Electronics, Johannes Kepler University Linz, Linz, 4040, Austria; Radman, K., Linz Center of Competence in Mechatronics, Linz, 4040, Austria; Gobl, E., Institute of Electrical Drives and Power Electronics, Johannes Kepler University Linz, Linz, 4040, Austria
Abstract: Several bearingless flux-switching motors have been implemented recently. These magnetically levitated drives create radial suspension forces and drive torque. They represent permanent-magnetic excited synchronous machines but feature rotors without any permanent-magnetic but salient rotor poles. A heteropolar air-gap field is excited by stator permanent magnets, which are located in-between the stator teeth. The rotor teeth change the permanent-magnetic flux paths and switch the magnetic flux linked with the stator coils, which are concentrically wound around the stator teeth. Typical bearingless flux-switching motors feature twelve stator teeth and ten salient rotor poles. However, all the presented designs up to now feature interior rotors. In this work an exterior rotor composition is considered for the first time in bearingless flux-switching motors. Design rules for a proper selection of the rotor tooth number are given using an analytic motor model considering suspension force and drive torque generation. To verify the theoretical results a prototype flux-switching motor with exterior rotor is optimized and manufactured. Its characteristic data is measured and compared to the referring 3D finite-element simulation results. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Bearingless slice motor; Exterior rotor; Flux-switching motor; Permanent-magnetic biased air-gap field; Separated windings

Title: A Cooperative Cell Balancing Approach for Reconfigurable Supercapacitor Energy Storage Systems
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: Central South University, School of Information Science and Engineering, Changsha, 410075, China; Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Railway Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China; Zhuzhou Electric Locomotive Co., Zhuzhou, 412001, China
Authors with affiliations: Jiang, F., Central South University, School of Information Science and Engineering, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Railway Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China; Meng, Z., Central South University, School of Information Science and Engineering, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Railway Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China; Li, H., Central South University, School of Information Science and Engineering, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Railway Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China; Liao, H., Central South University, School of Information Science and Engineering, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Railway Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China, Zhuzhou Electric Locomotive Co., Zhuzhou, 412001, China; Jiao, Y., Central South University, School of Information Science and Engineering, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Railway Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China; Han, M., Central South University, School of Information Science and Engineering, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Railway Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China; Peng, J., Central South University, School of Information Science and Engineering, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Railway Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China; Huang, Z., Central South University, School of Information Science and Engineering, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Railway Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China
Abstract: Reconfigurable supercapacitor energy storage systems have been a promising choice for powering portable electronics since it omits the requirement of passive balancing elements such as resistors in the circuit, which improves the energy efficiency and alleviates the thermal heating effect of the circuit. However, the classical decentralized cell balancing method results in high voltage profiles of cells, which degrades the lifetime of cells in the repeated charging-discharging cycles. To address this challenge, we propose a cooperative cell balancing approach for reconfigurable supercapacitor energy storage systems. In the proposed method, cells communicate with their neighbours to synchronize cell voltages during the charging process. By carefully choosing the communication topology, the voltage profiles of cells can be maintained as low as possible, which alleviates the aging effects and prolongs the lifetime of cells. A laboratory hardware testbed has been built to verify the effectiveness of the proposed method. Extensive experiment results show that the proposed method can prolong the lifetime of cells considerably when compared with the decentralized control method. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Cytology; Energy conversion; Energy efficiency; Energy storage; Supercapacitor; Cell balancing; Charging process; Communication topologies; Laboratory hardware; Portable electronics; Supercapacitor energy storages; Thermal heating effects; Voltage profile; Cells

Title: An Efficient Reference Modulation Based Control Strategy for Active Hybrid Energy Management of EVs
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018

Authors with affiliations: Zhou, Y., Department of School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410083, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Rail Vehicles Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China; Huang, Z., Department of School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410083, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Rail Vehicles Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China; Liao, H., Department of School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410083, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Rail Vehicles Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China, CRRC ZhuZhou Locomotive Co., Ltd., Zhuzhou, 412001, China; Li, H., Department of School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410083, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Rail Vehicles Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China; Jiao, Y., Department of School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410083, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Rail Vehicles Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China; Peng, J., Department of School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410083, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Rail Vehicles Braking Technology, Changsha, 410083, China
Abstract: In the hybrid energy storage system of electric vehicles (EVs), supercapacitors (SCs) are configured to supplement high frequency power loads to reduce battery strains. Continuous supply and quick response to power load through bidirectional power control is of great importance to attain power balance and keep the stability of bus voltage. In this paper, we propose a reference modulation based power management strategy to tackle this problem. Specifically, an adaptive SCs reference current regulation is designed to maintain sustainable power supply for SCs. A discrete lead compensator based reference smoothing control technique is integrated in to bottom layer control in order for quick transient response to stochastic power demand. With the designed SCs current regulation and reference smoothing technique, we aim to reduce the fluctuation of bus voltage. US06 driving cycles are applied in simulation and experiment to verify the effectiveness of the proposed approach. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Voltage Equalization Scheme for Onboard Supercapacitor Based on Sliding Mode Observer
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018

Abstract: In recent years, with the growing population of people swarmed into urban city, supercapacitor tram has been a promising candidate for the current urban rail transportation. However, the series-connection of cells will typically lead to the cell imbalance and dispersion because of the different individual cell properties such as capacitance, internal resistance, self-discharge rate, and environmental conditions. In this paper, a voltage equalization scheme based on an advanced isolated converter topology that utilizes a multi-winding transformer is proposed for onboard supercapacitors of catenary-free trams. Voltage equalization is essential for series-connected supercapacitors in the energy storage system because of the system sustainability and maximizes the available storage energy. An equalizer algorithm based on sliding mode observer is designed. The balancing approach provides both excellent performance and good reliability. Analysis and experiment results are provided to illustrate the effectiveness of the design. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Capacitance; Energy conversion; Equalizers; Sliding mode control; Sustainable development; Trolley cars; Urban transportation; Energy storage systems; Environmental conditions; Internal resistance; Isolated converters; Multi-winding transformer; Sliding mode observers; System sustainability; Urban rail transportations; Supercapacitor

Authors: Ze Z., Lin H., Ma Y., Wang Z.
Title: Assessment of Modular Multilevel Converter with Partly Integrated Battery Energy Storage System
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China
Authors with affiliations: Ze, Z., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China; Lin, H., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China; Ma, Y., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China; Wang, Z., State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Huazhong University of Science and Technology, Wuhan, China
Abstract: Modular multilevel converter can be applied to battery energy storage system by integrating battery with submodules. This paper focuses on the assessment of modular multilevel converter with partly integrated battery energy storage system based on carrier phase shift pulse width modulation, namely the battery equipment ratio or battery fault-tolerant ratio of system. Firstly, power balancing restrictions are analyzed to keep capacitor voltages balanced. Then, this paper analyzes the modulation restrictions in order to avoid over-modulation. Besides, the external characteristic must remain unchanged. By combining these restrictions, the relationships among related parameters, including battery equipment ratio, modulation ratio and power factor angle of AC bus, can be obtained. At last, the correctness of relationships is verified through MATLAB/Simulink simulation. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery energy storage; Battery equipment ratio; Modular multilevel converter; Restrictions analysis; Simulation
Index Keywords: Electric batteries; Energy conversion; Energy storage; MATLAB; Modulation; Voltage control; Battery energy storage; Battery equipment ratio; Modular multilevel converters; Restrictions analysis; Simulation; Power converters

Authors: Do N.N.L., Taberner A.J., Ruddy B.P.
Title: Design of a Portable Pulsed Power System for Needle-Free Jet Injection
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: Auckland Bioengineering Institute, University of Auckland, 70 Symonds Street, Auckland, 1010, New Zealand
Authors with affiliations: Do, N.N.L., Auckland Bioengineering Institute, University of Auckland, 70 Symonds Street, Auckland, 1010, New Zealand; Taberner, A.J., Auckland Bioengineering Institute, University of Auckland, 70 Symonds Street, Auckland, 1010, New Zealand; Ruddy, B.P., Auckland Bioengineering Institute, University of Auckland, 70 Symonds Street, Auckland, 1010, New Zealand
Abstract: Needle-free jet injection (NFJI) is a drug delivery technique that requires the application of a brief (10 ms to 100 ms) pulse of high force to pressurize a liquid drug and force it through the skin. To provide control over this force using an electric motor, high drive power is needed from a compact system. This work outlines the design process of an untethered power and motor drive system that is estimated to weigh approximately 2.5 kg, capable of supplying 1.6 kW at 210 V peak-peak. The device is used to drive a linear synchronous motor to deliver up to 31 large volume (1 mL) needle-free jet injections (NFJI) within a single recharge. The system architecture, gathering of detailed functional requirements, selection of energy storage, and the studies of power electronics and motor drive via system simulation are discussed. Inspired by electric vehicles battery boosted motor drives and cascaded interleaved boost converters for high step-up conversion ratio, the proposed design employs a battery-powered boost converter which then energize a 3-level inverter with the peak to peak voltage of 210 V. The design utilizes the latest gallium nitride (GaN) transistors as well as the latest lithium-ion capacitors (LIC) for energy storage. The power electronic topology introduced in this work is also adaptable for other high energy pulsed applications such as plasma generation, or MRI gradient coils. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Drug delivery; Energy storage; Gallium Nitride transistors; Interleaved boost converters; Lithium ion capacitors; Needle-free jet injection; Portable power supply; Pulsed power converter

Authors: Chen J., Chen C., Duan S., Cheng H., Sun J., Cai T., He J.
Title: Cooperative Optimization of Electric Vehicles and Renewable Energy Sources in Regional Multi-Microgrid System
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, China; China Ship Development and Design Center, Wuhan, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, J., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, China; Chen, C., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, China; Duan, S., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, China; Cheng, H., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, China; Sun, J., China Ship Development and Design Center, Wuhan, China; Cai, T., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, China; He, J., Huazhong University of Science and Technology, State Key Laboratory of Advanced Electromagnetic Engineering and Technology, Wuhan, China
Abstract: Due to the mobile energy storage character of plug-in electric vehicles (PEVs), they can be integrated with renewable energy sources (RESs) to attenuate the negative effect caused by their separate connection and increase the utility of RESs. However, unreasonable configuration of PEV infrastructures and RESs as well as inappropriate scheduling of PEVs and RESs' operation would decrease the advantage of their integration. To improve the benefit of PEVs and RESs' integration, a two-loop cooperative optimization model for configuration and scheduling of PEVs and RESs considering mobile energy storage character of PEVs is proposed. The configuration and scheduling of PEVs and RESs are optimized simultaneously by an improved particle swarm optimization (IPSO) algorithm in the model. The proposed model is validated by several case studies. Results show that by implementing the cooperative optimization, total cost of regional multi-microgrid system is significantly reduced. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Cooperative optimization; Electric Vehicles; Microgrids; Renewable Energy Sources

Authors: Huang X., Ruan X., Wu H., Fang J., Wang Y.
Title: Improving the Stability of Electrolytic-Capacitor-Less Single-Phase Two-Stage AC-DC Rectifier by Shaping the Input Impedance of Second Harmonic Current Compensator
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Huang, X., Department of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China; Ruan, X., Department of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China; Wu, H., Department of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China; Fang, J., Department of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China; Wang, Y., Department of Electrical Engineering, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China
Abstract: In order to eliminate the inherent second harmonic current (SHC) in single-phase power-factor-correction converters, a second harmonic current compensator (SHCC) terminated with a small storage capacitor is connected in parallel with the output of the PFC converter to absorb the SHC. However, with the decreasing of the dc-link capacitor, the system may become unstable due to the impedance interaction between the PFC converter and the downstream dc-dc converter. This paper firstly analyzes the characteristic of the port-impedance of the SHCC, indicating that the SHCC with conventional dual loop is of no ability to solve the instability problem. Then, in order to solve instability problem, a virtual-impedance which connects in parallel with the input of the SHCC is adapted. The realization and design of the virtual impedance are also included in this paper. Finally, the simulation results are presented to verify the validity of the proposed control scheme. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Impedance interaction; Instability; SHC; Single-phase power-factor-correction converters; Virtual impedance

Authors: Zhang X., Zhang H., Li H., Zhou Y., Jiao Y., Liao H., Huang Z.
Title: A Current Controller based on SPAACE for Parallel Charging Systems of Energy-Storage Urban Rails
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410075, China; Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Vehicles Braking Technology, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, X., School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Vehicles Braking Technology, China; Zhang, H., School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Vehicles Braking Technology, China; Li, H., School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Vehicles Braking Technology, China; Zhou, Y., School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Vehicles Braking Technology, China; Jiao, Y., School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Vehicles Braking Technology, China; Liao, H., School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Vehicles Braking Technology, China; Huang, Z., School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, 410075, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Vehicles Braking Technology, China
Abstract: Response overshoot is an undesired behavior that acceleraes system aging and even causes damage in high-power electronics system. In this paper, we proposed a current control method for improving dynamic performance of charging systems that serve for energy-storage urban rails. A current controller is implemented to reduce the damage of capacitors and switching devices in the charging system. Specially, set point automatic adjustment with correction enabled (SPAACE) is designed to the control method, with the aim of reducing the current overshoot. Therefore our method can optimize responsiveness of the charging system especially at the beginning of the charging. Compared with the traditional current controller, the main characteristic of the proposed current controller is that it can effectively reduce the current overshoot without compromising the speed of the closed-loop current control. A laboratory testbed has been built to verify the effectiveness of the design. Experiment results show that the proposed method can suppress the current overshooting as intended. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Influence of DC Link Capacitance on Power Efficiency of Single-Phase Inverter
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018

Abstract: The capacitor sizing for the capacitive DC link of a single-phase inverter is usually based on a pre-determined voltage ripple limitation, ripple current capability, and/or energy storage requirement. Nevertheless, it is lack of justifications of the pre-determined criteria. This paper aims to investigate the dependency between the DC-link capacitance and the converter-level efficiency of a single-phase inverter. The major sources of the converter power loss, i.e., IGBTs, capacitors, and inductors, are quantitatively modeled considering the varying DC-link voltage. It provides an additional dimension to optimize the capacitor selection for capacitive DC links. The theoretical analyses are verified by both simulations and experiments. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zhao A., Shi K., Hu C., Xu D.
Title: A Zero-Voltage-Switching Three-Phase Four-Wire Four-Leg Rectifier
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: Institute of Power Electronics, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, A., Institute of Power Electronics, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Shi, K., Institute of Power Electronics, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Hu, C., Institute of Power Electronics, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China; Xu, D., Institute of Power Electronics, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, 310027, China
Abstract: Three-phase four-wire four-leg rectifier are used in Uninterruptible Power Supply, battery energy storage systems, interface between an AC gird and DC grid etc. A novel zero-voltage-switching (ZVS) three-phase four-wire four-Leg rectifier is proposed in this paper. With the installation of an auxiliary resonant circuit and proposed PWM modulation scheme, all the switches in the three main legs, the balancing leg and the auxiliary circuit can realize ZVS operation. The ZVS-SPWM scheme for the rectifier is introduced and the ZVS condition for the rectifier is derived. Then the design of resonant parameters is discussed. Finally, the proposed circuit with ZVS-SPWM method is verified by the experiment. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Wang Y., Chen X., Tang H., Yang Y., Wen H., Lin Y.
Title: Design a Modified Bi-Directional Converter for Solar LED Lighting System
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: Suzhou Vocational University, School of Electronic and Information Engineering, Suzhou, China; Wuxi Solartale Solar PV Technology Co., Ltd, Wuxi, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China; Soochow University, School of Urban Rail Transportation, Suzhou, China; Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Xian Jiaotong-Liverpool University, Suzhou, China; Suzhou LUXEN Solar Energy Co., Ltd, Suzhou, China

Abstract: Solar photovoltaic power generation has the advantages of green energy and environmentally friendly, light-emitting diode (LED) lighting system is also a new generation of energy-efficient illuminate system. The solar LED lighting system which combines the advantages of both solar and LED, has broad application prospects. The converter is a key component in the solar LED lighting system applications, a novel modified bi-directional Cuk converter for solar LED lighting and its control is analyzed and designed in this paper, which can realize solar photovoltaic MPPT control, storage charge and discharge management, LED constant current control. Compared with the traditional DC/DC converters for solar LED photovoltaic lighting system, the designed converter has simpler structure, higher flexibility, lower cost and higher efficiency. The topology of the circuits and operating principle are analyzed in detail. Finally, the Matlab simulation results and experimental validation are given to demonstrate the designed circuit topology and control strategy. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Xiong M., Liang Z., Hu S., Li F., He X.
Title: Implementation of SVM-DTC on the Integration System with Hybrid Energy Storage and Dual Three-Phase PMSM
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Xiong, M., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Liang, Z., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Hu, S., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Li, F., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; He, X., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Abstract: To improve the performance and integration of the electric vehicles (EV), dual three-phase permanent magnet synchronous machine (PMSM) drive has been studied to achieve the HESS (hybrid energy storage system) management beyond the drive function in previous researches. In this paper, the dynamic performance of the system is enhanced through utilizing the space vector modulation direct torque control (SVM-DTC). Firstly, electromagnetic torque and flux of the dual three-phase windings are modeled. The coupling effect between the dual three-phase windings are studied and its impact to the dynamic interaction are revealed. Then, a decoupling compensation and the flux estimation are studied for the SVM-DTC in dual three-phase system. Based on proposed SVM-DTC, a frequency dividing coordinated control gets realized for better energy storage management. The implementation are verified under different operation modes by simulation and experiments. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Gu J., Yang X., Zheng T.Q., Wang M.
Title: Modelling and Simulation of Double-Train Macroscopic Representation Emulator in Urban Rail Transit
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: Beijing Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Gu, J., Beijing Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Yang, X., Beijing Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Zheng, T.Q., Beijing Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China; Wang, M., Beijing Jiaotong University, School of Electrical Engineering, Beijing, China
Abstract: This paper proposes a double-train macroscopic representation emulator (D-TMRE) to simulate the external current-voltage characteristics and combinations of typical conditions for real urban rail transit trains. Both the state space average model and small signal model of D-TMRE are established to analyze the control strategies, including the current and voltage regulations, condition transition and energy self-feedback process. An energy storage module is employed to assist in energy feedback, recycling and reuse. Moreover, owing to D-TMRE's condition transition, the combinations of typical conditions between two trains are accomplished. The feasibility of D-TMRE is verified through a simulation model in the DC 1500V traction power system and a scale-down experimental platform. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Lin S., Yang C., Song W., Feng Z.
Title: Analysis of capacity and control strategy for distributed energy system with hybrid energy storage system
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Smart Grid and Clean Energy Technologies, ICSGCE 2018
Affiliations: Guangzhou Institute of Energy Conversion, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Guangzhou, 510640, China; CAS Key Laboratory of Renewable Energy, Guangzhou, 510640, China; Guangdong Provincial Key Laboratory of New and Renewable Energy Research and Development, Guangzhou, 510640, China; University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, 100049, China
Authors with affiliations: Lin, S., Guangzhou Institute of Energy Conversion, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Guangzhou, 510640, China, CAS Key Laboratory of Renewable Energy, Guangzhou, 510640, China, Guangdong Provincial Key Laboratory of New and Renewable Energy Research and Development, Guangzhou, 510640, China, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, 100049, China; Yang, C., Guangzhou Institute of Energy Conversion, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Guangzhou, 510640, China, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, 100049, China; Song, W., Guangzhou Institute of Energy Conversion, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Guangzhou, 510640, China, CAS Key Laboratory of Renewable Energy, Guangzhou, 510640, China, Guangdong Provincial Key Laboratory of New and Renewable Energy Research and Development, Guangzhou, 510640, China; Feng, Z., Guangzhou Institute of Energy Conversion, Chinese Academy of Sciences, Guangzhou, 510640, China, CAS Key Laboratory of Renewable Energy, Guangzhou, 510640, China, Guangdong Provincial Key Laboratory of New and Renewable Energy Research and Development, Guangzhou, 510640, China
Abstract: In order to improve the operation efficiency of the combined cooling heating and power system (CCHP) in distributed energy system (DES), the hybrid energy storage technology combining battery energy storage system and heat storage system is proposed in this paper to be applied to DES with photovoltaic electric (PV). According to the mathematical models of gas turbine, PV system and other devices in DES, the energy flow model of the DES is first established in MATLAB and the boundary of the hybrid energy storage system (HESS) is determined. Moreover, the Power-Load-based control strategy is carried out and improved by researching the regulation effect of HESS and applied to the new DES which includes HESS and PV. Finally, the actual examples are analyzed to compare the load rate and running efficiency of the CCHP between traditional DES and the new DES. The results show that HESS could reduce the configuration capacity of CCHP and greatly improves its operation efficiency as well as the energy utilization efficiency of the overall system. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Yao Z., Xu J.
Title: MOSFET-Clamped Three-Level DC-DC Converters for Renewable Energy Resources
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: School of Automotive Engineering, Yancheng Institute of Technology, Yancheng, China; School of Information Engineering, Yancheng Institute of Technology, Yancheng, China
Authors with affiliations: Yao, Z., School of Automotive Engineering, Yancheng Institute of Technology, Yancheng, China; Xu, J., School of Information Engineering, Yancheng Institute of Technology, Yancheng, China
Abstract: Output voltage of renewable energy resources varies in a wide range when environment and load change widely. Therefore, diode-clamped three-level isolated DC-DC converters are adopted to operate in wide input-voltage range application. However, the conduction loss of the diode at three-level cells is high in high power or low input-voltage application. Moreover, the flying capacitor is needed to achieve voltage balance for switches. In order to solve the abovementioned problems, MOSFET-clamped three-level DC-DC converters are proposed. The diode in the three-level cell is substituted by the MOSFET, so one extra control freedom exists in the three-level cell based on the MOSFET. The flying capacitor is not needed by controlling the extra MOSFET. Derivation of the proposed converters is elaborated. Operating principle is illustrated. Comparison of voltage stress of switches among different topologies is given. Experimental results of a 500 W push-pull forward MOSFET-clamped three-level converter confirm the theoretical analysis. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Converter; Diode-clamped; MOSFET-clamped; Renewable energy resources; Three-level converter
Index Keywords: DC-DC converters; Diodes; Electric inverters; Energy conversion; MOSFET devices; Static random access storage; Converter; Diode-clamped; Isolated dc-dc converters; MOS-FET; Operating principles; Three-level converters; Three-level dc-dc converter; Wide input voltage ranges; Renewable energy resources

Authors: Wang Y., Dang J., Hu S., Liang Z., He X.
Title: Efficiency Analysis and Optimal Operation Method for the Energy Stored qZSI System
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Wang, Y., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Dang, J., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Hu, S., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Liang, Z., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; He, X., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Abstract: Energy storage (ES) can be used to solve the power fluctuations in the conventional quasi-Z-source inverter (qZSI). The control and dynamic performance improvement for its application in PV or fuel cell have been well studied. However, its effect for the qZSI in the power loss and current stress aspects are still obscure. This paper presented the current stress and power loss expression in both ac and dc side power switching devices. It is found that the shoot-through current play as a key factor in both the system power distribution and efficiency improvement. Then an optimal operation method based on the shoot-through current is proposed and 46.7% of the power loss get reduced. The theoretical analysis and proposed operation method are verified by the simulation and experimental results. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy storage; Optimal operation; Power loss analysis; QZSI

Authors: Verma A., Singh B.
Title: Energy Management Strategy of Solar PV-Battery and Diesel Generator Based Electric Vehicle Charging Station
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Authors with affiliations: Verma, A.; Singh, B.
Abstract: This paper presents a smart strategy for a charging station in which a single voltage source converter (VSC) does a multiple task such as power management among different energy sources and charging the electric vehicles (EVs), regulation of voltage and frequency of the generator, harmonics current compensation of nonlinear loads. The charging strategy is designed such that it primarily takes power from the solar photovoltaic (PV) array and a storage battery. In absence of these two sources, the charging station wisely takes power from the grid and the squirrel cage induction generator (SEIG) based diesel generator (DG) set. The DG set is operated such that it generates up to 33% more power than it rated capacity without surpassing the rated current in the windings, therefore, the size of the DG is reduced. Moreover, the voltage and frequency of the generator, are regulated at its rated values without a mechanical speed governor. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DG Set; EV Charging Station; Power Quality; Solar PV Generation; Uninterruptible Power

Abstract: The proceedings contain 44 papers. The topics discussed include: H2D4-type single phase transformer-less inverter with reactive power control for grid-tied PV system; design and implementation of a maximum power point tracking algorithm for wind turbines using PLC-SCADA; investigation and analyses of energy-efficient technologies for HVAC and lighting systems via energy auditing processes; a research for the influence of tilt angles of the solar panel on photovoltaic power generation; implementation of single phase cascaded H-bridge nine level inverter and simulation study with PI controller; research on automatic generation technology for secondary equipment of security measures of smart substation; energy internet based distribution transformer loss-of-life evaluation; a method of identifying shift switch of expected failure isolation; and analysis of capacity and control strategy for distributed energy system with hybrid energy storage system.

Authors: Chen Z., Zhang P., Hu W.
Title: A Novel Converter Control Strategy for a DFIM-Based Pumped Storage System in an Islanded Microgrid under Fault Conditions
Source title: 2018 IEEE Energy Conversion Congress and Exposition, ECCE 2018
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Northeast Electric Power University, School of Electrical Engineering, Jilin, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, Z., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Zhang, P., Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Hu, W., Northeast Electric Power University, School of Electrical Engineering, Jilin, China
Abstract: As offshore wind power in microgrid has thrived over the years, Doubly-Fed-Induction-Machine (DFIM)-based pumped storage systems have been expected to provide ancillary service for such microgrid. However, the control strategy of a DFIM-based pumped storage system during a fault period has not yet been studied. This paper provides insights into the function of a pumped storage system in microgrid facing potential faulty events. A novel control strategy derived from the electromagnetic transient model of DFIM during a fault period is proposed. The proposed control strategy is accurate and flexible. It considers the relative importance of both the frequency and voltage variation during the fault period. The simulation results in dSPACE Simulator confirm that the proposed control improves the performance of the pumped storage system in microgrid. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DFIM; Microgrid; Pumped storage; Transient control strategy

Abstract: The proceedings contain 53 papers. The topics discussed include: LabVIEW based measurements and control system of a micro-ORC installation with scroll expander; new means of hydrogen storage the potentials of methanol as energy storage for excessive windpower in North Germany; multi-objective analysis of an influence of a brine mineralization on an optimal evaporation temperature in ORC power plant; preliminary assessment of the efficiency of ORC plant operation supplied with hot water from the HDR system; the use of the T-history method to estimate thermal capacity and latent heat for RT15 and RT18 materials; the range of application of ORC power plant in power stations fed with low and medium thermal sources; and designs of PCM based heat exchangers constructions for thermal energy storage tanks examples and case study for selected design.

Authors: Alshathri S.
Title: Contemporary perception of task scheduling techniques in cloud: A review
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 2nd European Conference on Electrical Engineering and Computer Science, EECS 2018
Affiliations: Information Technology, College of Computer and Information Sciences, Princess Nourah Bint Abdulrahman University, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia
Authors with affiliations: Alshathri, S., Information Technology, College of Computer and Information Sciences, Princess Nourah Bint Abdulrahman University, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia
Abstract: Typically, the constant changes in computers and communications technology led to the need of on-demand network access to a shared computing resources to reduce cost and time and this is known as Cloud computing, which delivers computing services to users as a pay-as-you-go manner by emerging several distributed and high performance computing concepts. The cloud makes reaching any information or source possible from anywhere eliminating the setup and instillation step such that the user and the hardware may co-exist in different places. This comes beneficial for the users or the small companies that cannot effort to pay for the hardware, storage or resources as the big companies. Many of the studies on cloud computing was dedicated to the performance efficiency of task scheduling. Scheduling is a wide concept and it is one of the most important issues that generally work on mapping tasks to appropriate resources efficiently and effectively using one or more strategy. This paper have reviewed and classified the most recent scheduling algorithms in cloud computing and gave examples on each. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Algorithms; Cloud; Energy efficient; Green computing; Optimization; Scheduling techniques

Authors: Sami H., Mourad A.
Title: Towards dynamic on-demand fog computing formation based on containerization technology
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 International Conference on Computational Science and Computational Intelligence, CSCI 2018
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Mathematics, Lebanese American University, Beirut, Lebanon
Authors with affiliations: Sami, H., Department of Computer Science and Mathematics, Lebanese American University, Beirut, Lebanon; Mourad, A., Department of Computer Science and Mathematics, Lebanese American University, Beirut, Lebanon
Abstract: The advantage of having fog nodes near IOT devices can be seen by bringing intelligence near the edge. Fogs form storage place, real time processing for the tremendous amount of data generated by sensors, host for users' services to provide a better quality of service with a fast response time, and most importantly saving the IOT devices energy. If a fog is not present near an IOT device, its advantage will simply be eliminated. The current fogs in the literature are preconfigured in specific locations having some specific services running on them all the time which limits their diverse availabilities and prevent dynamic update and context adaptation. In this paper, we address the aforementioned limitations by proposing on-demand fog formation to create and manage fog devices and services on the fly. Our approach benefits from the containerization technology like Docker to build fog environment on-demand with the least initialization costs possible using volunteering devices and Kubernetes utility called Kubeadm, which allows monitoring fog nodes and orchestrates their services in a highly dynamic environment. A testing strategy composed of real devices is used and promising results are presented illustrating the ability and efficiency of initializing fog devices on the fly anywhere and whenever needed. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Cloud computing; Containers; Docker; Fog formation; IOT; Kubeadm; Kubernetes; On-demand fog
Index Keywords: Ability testing; Artificial intelligence; Cloud computing; Containers; Digital storage; Fog; Internet of things; Packaging; Quality of service; Docker; Fog formation; Kubeadm; Kubernetes; On demands; Fog computing

Title: Integration of Battery Ultracapacitor for Low Weight Electric Vehicle for Bangladesh
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Circuits and Systems in Digital Enterprise Technology, ICCSDET 2018
Affiliations: Dept. of Mechanical Engineering, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology (RUET), Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh; Dept. of Computer Science Engineering, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology (RUET), Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh; Dept. of Mechatronics Engineering, Rajshahi University of Engineering and Technology (RUET), Rajshahi, 6204, Bangladesh
