Authors: Torabi R., Gomes A., Morgado-Dias F.
Title: The Duck Curve Characteristic and Storage Requirements for Greening the Island of Porto Santo
Source title: Energy and Sustainability in Small Developing Economies, ES2DE 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: Faculty of Sciences and Technology, University of Coimbra, Coimbra, Portugal; Madeira Interactive Technology Institute, University of Madeira, Funchal, Portugal
Authors with affiliations: Torabi, R., Faculty of Sciences and Technology, University of Coimbra, Coimbra, Portugal, Madeira Interactive Technology Institute, University of Madeira, Funchal, Portugal; Gomes, A., Faculty of Sciences and Technology, University of Coimbra, Coimbra, Portugal; Morgado-Dias, F., Madeira Interactive Technology Institute, University of Madeira, Funchal, Portugal
Abstract: One of the barriers to a higher dissemination of renewable generation is the mismatch that may exist between availability and energy consumption. Also, when the penetration of solar generation is very high, and due to the natural variation of that energy source some challenging situations may occur if demand varies in the opposite direction, leading to what is called "duck curve". In this situation, conventional generation may be no longer able to accommodate the ramp rate and range needed to fully utilize solar energy in power systems with considerable amount of solar generation. It was revealed that this could result in "overgeneration" leading to generation curtailment, with consequent decrease in benefits and wasted investment Storage and demand-side management are tools that may be used for dealing with that discrepancy between solar and wind generation and the demand, including facilitating the accommodation of higher solar electricity, and at the same time to allow a more efficient operation of the power system. This paper explores the duck chart in Porto Santo island, examining how much photovoltaic generation might need to be cut off if additional grid flexibility operations are not taken into account. It is shown that the solar penetration as low as 40% of annual energy could lead to marginal curtailment rates that exceed 30% of the solar generation. However, employing energy storage systems allow much greater penetration of solar resources, achieving a 50% renewable portfolio standard. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: duck curve; Porto Santo; power grid; solar and wind generation
Index Keywords: Economics; Electric energy storage; Electric power transmission networks; Electric utilities; Energy utilization; Solar energy; Solar power generation; Sustainable development; Conventional generation; duck curve; Energy storage systems; Photovoltaic generation; Porto Santo; Power grids; Renewable portfolio standard; Solar and winds; Investments

Authors: Goncalves J., Neves L., Martins A.G.
Title: Influence of the management perspective for choosing the best location for Distributed electric energy storage units
Source title: Energy and Sustainability in Small Developing Economies, ES2DE 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: INESC Coimbra Coimbra, Portugal; Polytechnic Institute of Leiria, Leiria, Portugal; University of Coimbra, Coimbra, Portugal
Authors with affiliations: Goncalves, J., INESC Coimbra Coimbra, Portugal; Neves, L., Polytechnic Institute of Leiria, Leiria, Portugal; Martins, A.G., University of Coimbra, Coimbra, Portugal
Abstract: A methodology to assist a decision maker (DM) on the assessment of feasible solutions to implement a distributed electric energy storage system (DEESS) is presented. The chosen system is based on the nanophosphate lithium-ion battery technology due to its increasing use in electricity networks and to the advantages when compared to other commercially available technologies. The proposed methodology perfoms the choice of locations, using a definition of the best schedule of operation, while simultaneously optimizing four objective functions: the minimization of losses, voltage deviations and investment cost, and the maximization of the net gains of exploiting the differences among time varying energy prices. Results show that the best DEESS location depends on the energy service to be provided, namely of the goal of the DM that defines the management scheme of the DEESS, suggesting the need to incorporate this level of decision on the multiple objective formulation and making this methodology appropriate for different types of stakeholders. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Uytterhoeven R., Dehaene W.
Title: A sub 10 pJ/Cycle over a 2 to 200 MHz Performance Range RISC-V Microprocessor in 28 nm FDSOI
Source title: ESSCIRC 2018 - IEEE 44th European Solid State Circuits Conference
Affiliations: ESAT-MICAS Kasteelpark, KU Leuven, Arenberg 10, Leuven, B-3001, Belgium
Authors with affiliations: Uytterhoeven, R., ESAT-MICAS Kasteelpark, KU Leuven, Arenberg 10, Leuven, B-3001, Belgium; Dehaene, W., ESAT-MICAS Kasteelpark, KU Leuven, Arenberg 10, Leuven, B-3001, Belgium
Abstract: This work presents a near-threshold microprocessor implementation that aims for ultra-high energy-efficiency, while providing MHz performances over a 100x frequency range. This allows the processor to target a wide range of applications and to provide edge computing capabilities to IoT-devices. The RISC-V IM32 ISA is implemented in 28 nm FDSOI technology. FDSOI's body-biasing capabilities are explored and result in performance specific energy optimization possibilities. Furthermore, near-threshold libraries that are based on the original technology's super-threshold standard-cells, allow for a swift implementation of the processor without the need to design a custom low-voltage standard-cell set. Measurements show that the processor core breaks the 10 pJ/cycle energy barrier over a frequency range from 2-200 MHz. The design remains functional down to 250mV with a MEP of 4.18pJ/cycle at 21.5MHz (380 mV). The 2×32 kB on-chip SRAM consumes between 4.49 pJ/cycle and 9.58 pJ/cycle while operating at 0.5 V. © 2018 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Energy efficiency; Static random access storage; Computing capability; Fdsoi technologies; Frequency ranges; Near thresholds; Processor cores; Specific energy; Standard cell; Ultra-high energies; Integrated circuit design

Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Conference on Environment and Electrical Engineering and 2018 IEEE Industrial and Commercial Power Systems Europe, EEEIC/I and CPS Europe 2018

Abstract: The continuous development of Renewable Energy Technologies, combined with the emergence of Distributed Production have led to a change in the structure of the electricity systems. In this paper, the operation of a DC microgrid integrating Renewable Energy Sources and Storage System, is investigated. In particular, the subsystems of the microgrids, i.e. Photovoltaic Systems, Wind Turbines, Local Load and Storage System, are analyzed and simulated. In order to integrate the microgrid to the utility grid, it is necessary to control the subsystems properly and coordinate them in order to work safely under various operating conditions. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: for last decades we can see a big continuous growth of renewable energy, such as solar and wind, also increase in domestic demand with visible correlation with climate is observed. To avoid imbalances jeopardizing system stability actions to introduce new energy storage and demand response technologies are taken. The contribution of this paper is to create a detailed model of effective industrial load shifting using Battery Energy Storage System-BESS. BESS load shifting performance is determined by the availability of accurate load curves and optimization approaches. Using our model and simulation results we are aiming to develop control strategy and to achieve a maximum economic effect for the chosen enterprise. Control strategy will be applied to the 100 kWh demonstration in Riga, Latvia. © 2018 IEEE.

Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Conference on Environment and Electrical Engineering and 2018 IEEE Industrial and Commercial Power Systems Europe, EEEIC/I and CPS Europe 2018

Abstract: Battery packs with a large number of cells are becoming more and more prominent technology. Monitoring and controlling these packs is now a subject with increased importance. The proposed implemented system consists of only three switches per cell, allowing several types of connection between the cells. The battery management system relies on a distributed hierarchical architecture with n-1local controllers and a global controller. In the proposed algorithm the cells act as a single swarm functioning autonomously and depending on the parameters (voltage, current and temperature) of each cell of the pack. The hardware for each cell is explained and demonstrated. The results obtained both in simulation and in experimental tests show the excellent performance of the proposed methodology. Also, the charging approach based on the traditional multistage method exhibited an excellent performance on charging supercapacitors, concerning its efficiency, charging time and overvoltage protection. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Power Management Strategy for Standalone PV Applications with Hybrid Energy Storage System
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Conference on Environment and Electrical Engineering and 2018 IEEE Industrial and Commercial Power Systems Europe, EEEIC/I and CPS Europe 2018

Abstract: Hybrid energy storage systems that combine the high density power of the supercapacitors with the high energy density of the Li-ion batteries have been substantially researched, with great interest. This manuscript proposes a new power management strategy implemented using the Rule based controller which considers the state of charge of the Li-ion batteries (SOC). The Li-ion batteries are used to provide a steady and constant power, function of the state of charge (SOC), enabling a higher efficiency and extending batteries lifespan. A typical standalone PV application is used to demonstrate and validate the performance of the proposed power management strategy. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: With an increasing public and governmental awareness regarding environment protection and sustainable resources, hand-in-hand with an escalating electricity demand, the exponential growth of renewable energy generation capacity has been the 'answer'. Mitigating the environmental harms associated with the more conventional energy sources such as: Coal, oil, gas and nuclear. Nonetheless, some challenges remain, particularly concerning the integration of these technologies into the conventional generation mix. Hybrid energy systems allow a paradigm shift from a concentrated conventional generation to a more distributed one. This paper discusses the optimized PV-wind with hydro and battery storage capabilities for a grid-connected application considering the Short-Term Price Forecast information. The proposed technique has been tested in different scenarios, and results demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed approach. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: An increase in the installed capacity of renewable energy sources in power system may lead to frequency deviation problems due to their intermittent nature and subsequent mismatch between generation and demand. Therefore, new components should be used to provide frequency regulation, and thus assure stable frequency. One of the solutions is the integration of energy storage systems and flexible loads. This paper investigates the dynamic influence and performance of thermostatically controlled electric water heaters and battery energy storage systems for frequency regulation in an interconnected two-area power system with high penetration of variable renewable energy generation. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Sensitivity Analysis in Switches Automation Based on Active Reconfiguration to Improve System Reliability Considering Renewables and Storage
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Conference on Environment and Electrical Engineering and 2018 IEEE Industrial and Commercial Power Systems Europe, EEEIC/I and CPS Europe 2018
Affiliations: FEUP, Porto, Portugal; C-MAST/UBI, Covilha, Portugal; ESRI, Dublin, Ireland; INESC TEC, FEUP, Porto, Portugal; INESC-ID/IST-UL, Lisbon, Portugal

Abstract: Distributed Smart Systems (DSS) should operate and restore discontinued service to consumers. In order to the system gain theses ability it is necessary to replace the manual switches for remotely controlled switches, improving the system restoration capability having in view the Smart Grids implementation. This paper aims to develop a new model, determining the minimal set of switches to replace in order to automate the system, along with a senility analysis on the position of the new switches, whether it should be placed in the same place as the manual switch or in a new location. The optimization of the system is made considering the renewable energy sources (RES) integration in the grid and energy storage systems (ESS), simultaneously, in order to improve the system reliability. The computational tool is tested using the IEEE 119 Bus test system, where different types of loads are considered, residential, commercial and industrial. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Off-Grid System Evaluation in the Distribution Network
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Conference on Environment and Electrical Engineering and 2018 IEEE Industrial and Commercial Power Systems Europe, EEEIC/I and CPS Europe 2018

Authors with affiliations: Gavrilovs, A., Institute of Power Engineering, Riga Technical University, Riga, Latvia; Varfolomejeva, R., Institute of Power Engineering, Riga Technical University, Riga, Latvia
Abstract: In the European countries, there is a tendency of partly replacing centralized generation with distributed generation. By supplementing distributed generation with an electricity storage system, power companies, along with the usual power supply services, may offer new power supply solutions to their customers. One of such services is the provision of off-grid power supply solutions. Off-grid systems are usually important in rural territories where electricity consumers are scattered and the electricity consumption is low since for entities of this type, providing a power supply connection to the public distribution network requires large capital investments. The article proposes a life cycle cost evaluation model for selecting the most economically advantageous technical solution: Setting up an off-grid system or constructing a connection to the public network by building a long power transmission line. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Kosmak J., Misak S.
Title: Power Quality Management in an Off-Gtrid System
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Conference on Environment and Electrical Engineering and 2018 IEEE Industrial and Commercial Power Systems Europe, EEEIC/I and CPS Europe 2018
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Power Engineering, VSB-TU Ostrava, Ostrava, Czech Republic; ENET Centre, VSB-TU Ostrava, Ostrava, Czech Republic
Authors with affiliations: Kosmak, J., Department of Electrical Power Engineering, VSB-TU Ostrava, Ostrava, Czech Republic; Misak, S., ENET Centre, VSB-TU Ostrava, Ostrava, Czech Republic
Abstract: The themes such as decentralized electricity production, the use of renewable electricity sources, such as photovoltaic and/or wind power plants for self-sufficient energy supply of buildings or micro grids in the so-called Off-Grid autonomous systems can be found more in the field of energy. Considering, the control technology and power quality of tradition distribution networks is facing new opportunities and challenges. This paper proposes a new approach to use the completely new Power Quality Management (hereinafter the PQM) for to avoid inappropriate or dangerous states and abnormal operation states, such as power quality (hereinafter PQ) limit excess according to the standards in an autonomous single phase Off-Grid systems. The Off-Grid system is controlled by the ADSM (Active Demand Side Management), which is a fully functional control system for Off-Grid system. Developed by the PQM which will be integrated in the ADSM in Off-Grid system, thereby adjusting the consumption plan to keep PQ parameters within the allowed limits. In addition, the proposed PQM is based on centralized control system and the real-time analysis of data acquired from conventional electronic measuring devices in common with the PQ parameters prediction. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Nousdilis A.I., Kryonidis G.C., Kontis E.O., Papagiannis G.K., Christoforidis G.C., Panapakidis I.P.
Title: Economic Viability of Residential PV Systems with Battery Energy Storage under Different Incentive Schemes
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Conference on Environment and Electrical Engineering and 2018 IEEE Industrial and Commercial Power Systems Europe, EEEIC/I and CPS Europe 2018
Affiliations: School of Electrical Computer Engineering, Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, Thessaloniki, Greece; Electrical Power Laboratory, Western Macedonia University of Applied Sciences, Kozani, Greece; Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Technological Educational Institute of Thessaly, Larisa, Greece

Abstract: The high penetration of distributed renewable energy sources (DRESs), and especially photovoltaics (PVs), in LV distribution grids questions their safe and reliable operation. In this context, battery energy storage (BES) systems can be an effective solution to reduce the intermittency of electricity generated by DRESs and to enhance the resilience of power systems. However, it is unclear how different incentive schemes and regulatory frameworks affect the BES profitability for prosumers, compared with no incentives at all. In this paper, a techno-economic model is developed to investigate the economic viability of BES for residential PVs, operated under different incentive schemes. The input parameters of the model include typical load and generation profiles, electricity prices as well as typical PV and BES costs. Using these data, an optimization procedure based on an exhaustive search is performed and the optimal size of the integrated PV-BES system is derived. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Pogeira J., Santos S.F., Fitiwi D.Z., Cruz M.R.M., Catalao J.P.S.
Title: Implementing Dynamic Network Reconfiguration with Renewables and Considering Future Grid Technologies: A Real Case Study
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Conference on Environment and Electrical Engineering and 2018 IEEE Industrial and Commercial Power Systems Europe, EEEIC/I and CPS Europe 2018
Affiliations: FEUP, Porto, Portugal; C-MAST/UBI, Covilha, Portugal; ESRI, Dublin, Ireland; INESC TEC and FEUP, Porto, Portugal
Authors with affiliations: Pogeira, J., FEUP, Porto, Portugal; Santos, S.F., C-MAST/UBI, Covilha, Portugal; Fitiwi, D.Z., ESRI, Dublin, Ireland; Cruz, M.R.M., C-MAST/UBI, Covilha, Portugal; Catalao, J.P.S., INESC TEC and FEUP, Porto, Portugal
Abstract: Dynamic distribution system reconfiguration (DDSR) is the process of dynamically changing the network's topology during the operational periods of the system. This process together with the integration of distributed renewable energy sources (DRES) and other enabling technologies allow a more efficient operation of such systems in technical and economic terms, facilitating a seamless integration of DRES in larger quantities. When performing such an optimization process, the stochastic nature of DRES (both variability and uncertainty) needs to be taken into consideration. In this paper, an improved dynamic system reconfiguration model is presented where the goal is to minimize the total cost in the system while satisfying various technical constraints so as to maintain the reliability and stability of the system at required levels. The computational tool is tested in a real system encompassing the distribution system of Lagoa (in São Miguel Island, Azores), and its effectiveness is properly validated. The numerical results demonstrate great benefits in economic terms, such as reduced losses and improved system reliability. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Distributed generation; dynamic reconfiguration; energy storage systems; renewable energy sources; stochastic mixed integer linear programming

Authors: Petrichenko L., Varfolomejeva R., Gavrilovs A., Sauhats A., Petricenko R.
Title: Evaluation of Battery Energy Storage Systems in Distribution Grid
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Conference on Environment and Electrical Engineering and 2018 IEEE Industrial and Commercial Power Systems Europe, EEEIC/I and CPS Europe 2018
Affiliations: Riga Technical University, Institute of Power Engineering, Riga, Latvia
Authors with affiliations: Petrichenko, L., Riga Technical University, Institute of Power Engineering, Riga, Latvia; Varfolomejeva, R., Riga Technical University, Institute of Power Engineering, Riga, Latvia; Gavrilovs, A., Riga Technical University, Institute of Power Engineering, Riga, Latvia; Sauhats, A., Riga Technical University, Institute of Power Engineering, Riga, Latvia; Petricenko, R., Riga Technical University, Institute of Power Engineering, Riga, Latvia
Abstract: The electric grid should ensure a balance between the energy generation and the demand of the electricity consumers. In addition, the network capacity must be sufficient to transmit all the requested energy. Unfortunately, the demand for electricity varies considerably. This can cause network congestion. Foreseeing it, the grid operator ensures its reconstruction in advance. The purpose of this document is to create an effective regulation and load balancing scheme that reduces peak loads and maximizes profit for the energy company. The management of the load depends on the possibility to regulate and accumulate electrical energy in the distribution network during the hours when the consumption or the energy price is low and use this energy first of all during the hours when the energy consumption exceeds the power limits or when the energy price is higher, thus ensuring savings for the facility. Energy accumulation can be carried out on the basis of the use of battery energy storage systems. To understand whether or not a selected energy storage device is profitable, a pre-feasibility study should be performed, which includes NPV estimation. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage system; distribution system; peak shaving

Authors: Fitiwi D.Z., Santos S.F., Catalao J.P.S.
Title: Role of Distributed Energy Storage Systems in the Quest for Carbon-Free Electric Distribution Systems
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Conference on Environment and Electrical Engineering and 2018 IEEE Industrial and Commercial Power Systems Europe, EEEIC/I and CPS Europe 2018
Affiliations: Economic and Social Research Institute, temp Dublin, Ireland; C-MAST/UBI, Covilha, Portugal; INESC TEC, FEUP, Porto, Portugal
Authors with affiliations: Fitiwi, D.Z., Economic and Social Research Institute, temp Dublin, Ireland; Santos, S.F., C-MAST/UBI, Covilha, Portugal; Catalao, J.P.S., INESC TEC, FEUP, Porto, Portugal
Abstract: This paper presents an extensive analysis in relation to transforming electric distribution networks in order to accommodate large quantities of variable renewable energy sources (vRESs). For this purpose, a multi-stage and stochastic mixed integer linear programming (S-MILP) model is employed. The algebraic model developed optimally allocates energy storage systems (ESSs) along with an optimal dynamic distribution network switching. For the analysis, a standard IEEE 119-bus distribution network system was used as a case study. Test results reveal that the joint optimization of ESSs and network reconfiguration markedly increase flexibility in existing systems, leading to an increase in the levels of renewables integration and utilization. Moreover, the analysis of the results shows the prospect of such systems in going fully 'carbon-free', i.e. with vRES power entirely meeting system demand. Generally, the current work demonstrates that a more effective integration and utilization of large-scale vRESs is possible when existing systems are equipped with enabling technologies that are already commercially available. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Distributed generation; energy storage systems; network switching; renewable energy sources; stochastic mixed integer linear programming

Abstract: The regulation abilities of load generation and the balance in the electrical power system are the main objectives: Many Directives have been adopted in the European Union to reach the scope of reliable and safe energy generation, transmission and distribution. The aim of the paper is the creation of the model of effective load regulation and distribution, using the abilities to shave load from peak zones. The management of the load depends from the ability to accumulate electrical energy in distribution network in hours when power generation from RES is high, but consumption is low and using this energy during hours of peak loads. To understand if selected energy storage device is profitable or not, pre-feasibility study should be performed, which includes NPV multidimensional model. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Energy Hub Functioning Model Considering Perspectives for Development of Bioenergy in Ukraine
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Conference on Environment and Electrical Engineering and 2018 IEEE Industrial and Commercial Power Systems Europe, EEEIC/I and CPS Europe 2018
Affiliations: Department of Electricity Supply, National Technical University of Ukraine, Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, Kyiv, Ukraine; Faculty of Power and Electrical, Riga Technical University, Riga, Latvia

Abstract: In conditions of renewable energy sources development and implementaion of modern technologies in the energy sector, energy from biomass in the structure of power supply systems is an actual topic. The article presents the functioning model of integrated energy supply system (energy hub) with cogeneration units operation, taking into account prospects of bioenergy development in Ukraine. The main task was solved to make full use of its own energy sources to meet the needs of consumers in energy carriers with the most effective financial performance. The availability of electric and thermal energy storage devices will allow more efficient usage of available energy resources and equipment. For this purpose, modeling of the considered power hub functioning at the change in the values of the electric battery capacity was performed. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: The proceedings contain 10 papers. The topics discussed include: latency and backlog bounds in time-sensitive networking with credit based shapers and asynchronous traffic shaping; multi-interface communication: interface selection under statistical performance constraints; energy management in wireless communications with energy storage imperfections; stochastic guarantees for rate-adaptive streaming; a fluid-flow interpretation of SCED scheduling; a general per-flow service curve for GPS; integrating fractional Brownian motion arrivals into the statistical network calculus; the case for a network calculus heuristic: using insights from data for tighter bounds; of kernels and queues: when network calculus meets analytic combinatorics; and network calculus for mean delay analysis through a network.

Authors: Chen L., Wang D.-P.
Title: Energy Consumption Modeling and Energy Saving Analysis of Supercapacitor Tramcar
Source title: 2018 IEEE International Conference of Intelligent Robotic and Control Engineering, IRCE 2018
Affiliations: Electrification Company of CCCC Tunnel Engineering Co. Ltd, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, L., Electrification Company of CCCC Tunnel Engineering Co. Ltd, Beijing, China; Wang, D.-P., Electrification Company of CCCC Tunnel Engineering Co. Ltd, Beijing, China
Abstract: As an emerging urban public transport, energy storage trams are the major electricity consumers in the city. Most of the trams use distributed power supply, and the traction substations are derived from the urban medium-voltage network. Therefore, it is of great significance to establish a model that can predict the energy consumption distribution at each site. Existing models mostly use regression methods, focusing on analyzing the correlation between various influencing factors and energy consumption, and forecasting the total energy consumption of tram lines through a large amount of statistical data. Analyze the complete operation process of the tram between the stations, use MATLAB/Simulink to build its operation model, simulate the operating conditions of the tram, and obtain the traction energy consumption model of the energy storage tram. Regarding the vehicle air conditioning energy consumption model, the vehicle energy consumption model was further obtained. By verifying the model with the existing operating data, the error is within the allowable range, which has certain practicality and provides a basis for energy-saving analysis. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy consumption model; energy consumption prediction; energy storage tram; energy-saving analysis

Authors: Tang X., Ren Q.
Title: Design and Implementation of Energy Consumption Data Collector for Tram Stations
Source title: 2018 IEEE International Conference of Intelligent Robotic and Control Engineering, IRCE 2018
Affiliations: CCCC Tunnel Engineering Bureau Co Ltd., Beijing, 100102, China
Authors with affiliations: Tang, X., CCCC Tunnel Engineering Bureau Co Ltd., Beijing, 100102, China; Ren, Q., CCCC Tunnel Engineering Bureau Co Ltd., Beijing, 100102, China
Abstract: Energy consumption acquisition is an important part of energy conservation management, combined with the real-time requirements for the automatic collection of energy consumption data in modern tram stations. According to the characteristics of energy consumption in tram stations, the method of energy consumption data collection based on DSP as the embedded real-time acquisition system is proposed. First, the TMS320F28335 series 32-bit floating point DSP controller is used to collect and store the main energy consumption data of the tram station. Then, ZigBee technology is used to carry out energy data transmission, remote configuration, and hardware fault tolerance to achieve dynamic detection of data to determine the existence of faults; Finally, use LabVIEW for software development. Design tram data station data acquisition system with energy consumption data acquisition monitoring and data processing analysis. Compared with the traditional energy consumption data collector, it has the characteristics of good real-time performance, high data acquisition accuracy, and strong anti-interference, and provides a powerful source of data for station energy monitoring and management. Realize the functions of collection, storage, analysis, transmission, diagnosis and maintenance of energy consumption data for smart tram stations. It is helpful to improve the efficiency of energy-saving management of tram stations. This study further provides a certain reference for the energy management of tram stations. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Hao L., Fan Y.
Title: Modeling and Passivity-PI Control of a Fuel Cell-Supercapacitor Hybrid Energy Storage System
Source title: 2018 IEEE International Conference on Mechatronics, Robotics and Automation, ICMRA 2018
Affiliations: Ship Installation Department, Shanghai Marine Equipment Research Institute, Shanghai, China; Shanghai University of Electric Power, College of Electric Power and Automation Engineering, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Hao, L., Ship Installation Department, Shanghai Marine Equipment Research Institute, Shanghai, China; Fan, Y., Shanghai University of Electric Power, College of Electric Power and Automation Engineering, Shanghai, China
Abstract: This paper deals with the problem of controlling a hybrid energy storage system consisted of a Proton Exchange Membrane Fuel Cell (PEMFC) as the main power source and Supercapacitors (SCs) as the auxiliary power source for electrical applications. The energy control strategy aims at reasonably distributing the load power demand into the two different sources and making sure that each source can be optimally used. The energy controller is devised based on the Passivity-Based Control (PBC) method with the Interconnection and Damping Assignment (IDA) technique. Moreover, a complementary PI controller is designed to enhance the robustness of the closed-loop system under system model uncertainties. Simulation results show that the proposed control strategy could help the hybrid system fast response to electrical load demand with strong robustness. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Comparison study the management of fuel cell power and battery state-of-charge for smart home
Source title: ACM International Conference Proceeding Series
Affiliations: RITM Laboratory, EST, Casablanca, Morocco; SEISEE Laboratory, ENSAM, Casablanca, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: Labrini, A., RITM Laboratory, EST, Casablanca, Morocco; Rabbah, N., SEISEE Laboratory, ENSAM, Casablanca, Morocco; Belhaddoui, H., RITM Laboratory, EST, Casablanca, Morocco; Rifi, M., RITM Laboratory, EST, Casablanca, Morocco
Abstract: Managing the distribution of electrical energy in a multi-source system (Smart Home) is essential for future smart cities, which reduces the dependency on the traditional electricity grid. In this paper, a hybrid power system is proposed consisting of a hydrogen fuel cell and a storage system. The latter will be used as support during the period of high energy demand to power a smart home. The presence of these two energy sources requires the global system to be governed by a control strategy. This strategy determines the energy distribution between the source and the load by optimally modeling system with satisfaction of constraints such as the state of charge (Soc), the storage system and the hydrogen consumption. Two energy management strategies have been developed: The Equivalent Consumption Minimization Strategy (ECMS) and the state machine method. The simulation was performed on MATLAB/Simulink to show performance in terms of hydrogen consumption and the state of charge (SOC) of the systems battery. 1 © 2018 Association for Computing Machinery.

Authors: El Kalkha H., Mimet A.
Title: Study of a new design of a solar adsorption sensor for a refrigeration system
Source title: ACM International Conference Proceeding Series
Affiliations: Laboratory of innovative technologies, National School of Applied Sciences, Tangier, Morocco; Faculty of Sciences, University Abdelmalek Essaidi, Tetuan, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: El Kalkha, H., Laboratory of innovative technologies, National School of Applied Sciences, Tangier, Morocco; Mimet, A., Faculty of Sciences, University Abdelmalek Essaidi, Tetuan, Morocco
Abstract: Morocco's climate encompasses a wide range of weather conditions over a broad geographic scale that can improve the performance of the solar adsorption refrigeration system. Solar energy technologies have attracted worldwide attention because of their non-polluting nature. Also, Solar refrigeration based on adsorption cycles is simple, silent and adaptable to small, medium or large systems. Application potentials include storage of vaccines for immunization against deadly diseases, conservation of food products for future use and ice making. This paper illustrates a new design to improve the performance of the solar adsorption machine to achieve a good thermal efficiency with an emission of approximately zero CO2. The mechanism of this design is based on dual phases: desorption and adsorption. The new solar collector will have to convert solar energy into heat and provide the effective temperature for a longer period of time than that obtained by a plan solar collector. © 2018 Association for Computing Machinery.

Authors: Kartite J., Cherkaoui M.
Title: What solution for Morocco: Photovoltaic alone, wind alone or both? case study of Dakhla city*
Source title: ACM International Conference Proceeding Series
Affiliations: Electrical Engineering Department, Mohammedia School of engineers, Rabat, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: Kartite, J., Electrical Engineering Department, Mohammedia School of engineers, Rabat, Morocco; Cherkaoui, M., Electrical Engineering Department, Mohammedia School of engineers, Rabat, Morocco
Abstract: Hybrid Renewable Energy System (HRES) is becoming attractive due to its ability to electrify remote area. This paper presents a methodology for electrifying the Dakhla city localized in the west of Morocco. The idea is based on using a Hybrid PV/Wind system with battery storage. The optimization method used is Backtracking Search Optimization Algorithm, which is an evolutionary algorithm newly proposed. The input data is the solar irradiation and wind speed. The algorithm parameters are the population size, the number of iteration, the mutation value and the crossover. © 2018 Association for Computing Machinery. All rights reserved.

Authors: Alami A., Benhlima L., Bah S.
Title: A study of security requirements in wireless sensor networks for smart home healthcare systems
Source title: ACM International Conference Proceeding Series
Affiliations: Mohammadia School of Engineers (EMI), Mohamed V University, Rabat, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: Alami, A., Mohammadia School of Engineers (EMI), Mohamed V University, Rabat, Morocco; Benhlima, L., Mohammadia School of Engineers (EMI), Mohamed V University, Rabat, Morocco; Bah, S., Mohammadia School of Engineers (EMI), Mohamed V University, Rabat, Morocco
Abstract: Smart home healthcare are systems used to monitor patient in home by expecting and responding to their needs and granting their independence. This remote patient’s monitoring is becoming more feasible as specialized sensors can be placed inside homes. In fact, wireless sensor network are used to collect medical data such as vital signs and personal data to transmit it to the caregiver. Therefore, the preserving security and privacy of this sensitive information is very crucial. This is particularly challenging because of the specific characteristics of WSN (e.g. limited resources: energy, storage, computation, communication) and the specific smart home environment. This paper tends to analyze the security related issues in smart home healthcare systems and proposes security requirements for these systems. We highlight the security threats for networks in healthcare, discuss issues related to the existing security systems and also present the proposed and derived requirements of security in this context. © 2018 Copyright is held by the owner/author(s).

Authors: Kharrich M., Sayouti Y., Akherraz M.
Title: Microgrid sizing with environmental and economic optimization
Source title: 3rd Renewable Energies, Power Systems and Green Inclusive Economy, REPS and GIE 2018
Affiliations: EEPC-Mohammed v University, B.P 765 Agdal, Rabat, Morocco; LEEATI-Hassan II University, B.P 146, Mohammedia, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: Kharrich, M., EEPC-Mohammed v University, B.P 765 Agdal, Rabat, Morocco; Sayouti, Y., LEEATI-Hassan II University, B.P 146, Mohammedia, Morocco; Akherraz, M., EEPC-Mohammed v University, B.P 765 Agdal, Rabat, Morocco
Abstract: Hybrid microgrid is the best system to build for the lower demand mainly in the non-electrified rural area. However, a hybrid system based on PV, wind turbine, diesel and Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) must be optimized. In this paper, Multi-Objective Particle Swarm Optimization (MOPSO) method is used to design the hybrid system. Net Present Cost (NPC) that cover all capital, operation maintenance and replacement cost, and emission cost to evaluate the damage caused by the pollution are the choosen obective functions. Two location area are considered to sizing the hybrid system taking in account reliability with Loss of Power Supply Probability (LPSP), Fraction Renewable (FR) that must be upper to 90% and availability should be upper to 96%. A Pareto-optimal solution using Pareto frontier give the best results with highest reliability and availability of this system. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Mehdi L., Hayar A., Sendama N.B.
Title: Autonomous collaborative solar home system-public lighting (SHS-PL) using Bin Packing algorithm in rural Off-Grid environment
Source title: 3rd Renewable Energies, Power Systems and Green Inclusive Economy, REPS and GIE 2018
Affiliations: Smart City Team, CED ENSEM, GREENTIC Université, RITM Laboratory, Hassan II, Casablanca, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: Mehdi, L., Smart City Team, CED ENSEM, GREENTIC Université, RITM Laboratory, Hassan II, Casablanca, Morocco; Hayar, A., Smart City Team, CED ENSEM, GREENTIC Université, RITM Laboratory, Hassan II, Casablanca, Morocco; Sendama, N.B., Smart City Team, CED ENSEM, GREENTIC Université, RITM Laboratory, Hassan II, Casablanca, Morocco
Abstract: Many people in the world do not have access to electricity, a majority of them lives in rural areas that are not yet covered by the main electrical grid and may not be covered in the short term. Faced with this situation, off-grid solutions have been developed. They allow electrification outside the main electrical grid and take two main forms. Indeed, there are two types of off-grid solution: the Mini-grid and the Solar Home System SHS. The main focus of this article is to propose a new collaborative street Public Lighting system (PL) based on Bin Packing algorithm aiming to show how our proposed system can reduce significantly the energy consumption while feeding our SHS-PL collaborative system composed of the smart home and its associated public streetlamp in a rural environment. This article presents also new smart storage algorithms, which guaranty the SHS-PL energy capacity while reducing the size and the cost of battery and the renewable energy sources infrastructure. The solutions proposed in this paper are economic and inclusive, making possible, and at a low cost, to open up rural areas, and allowing them access to clean electricity and enabling them to develop local activities in line with sustainable development and thus contribute to limiting rural exodus. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: Hybrid renewable energy systems (HRES) based on multiple energy sources and storage are attractive configurations used for different applications, especially in standalone power generation systems. The aim of this system is to supply load by ensuring the availability of power on demand, improve the dynamic behavior of the hybrid system by stabilizing AC/DC Bus and enhancing the quality of the generated power. This paper proposes a robust control strategy based on DC bus control and energy management using fuzzy logic. Simulation results illustrate the performances of the developed control strategy. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Antar A., Takky D., Naimi Y.
Title: Oxygen evolution reaction study on platinized carbon and transition metals (Ni, Co, Mn) for electrolysis of alkaline water
Source title: 3rd Renewable Energies, Power Systems and Green Inclusive Economy, REPS and GIE 2018
Affiliations: Faculty of Sciences Ben m'Sik, University of Hassan II Casablanca, Laboratory of Physical Chemistry of Materials, Casablanca, Morocco
Authors with affiliations: Antar, A., Faculty of Sciences Ben m'Sik, University of Hassan II Casablanca, Laboratory of Physical Chemistry of Materials, Casablanca, Morocco; Takky, D., Faculty of Sciences Ben m'Sik, University of Hassan II Casablanca, Laboratory of Physical Chemistry of Materials, Casablanca, Morocco; Naimi, Y., Faculty of Sciences Ben m'Sik, University of Hassan II Casablanca, Laboratory of Physical Chemistry of Materials, Casablanca, Morocco
Abstract: Water electrolysis is a promising method for efficient production of high purity oxygen and hydrogen. Even though noble-metal oxides (PtO2 IrO2, RuO2, and RhO2) are the most active materials for the oxygen evolution reaction, low-cost transition metal oxides are typically used in alkaline electrolysis due to their abundance and relatively high activity and stability. Thus, nickel, cobalt, and manganese have been extensively explored as bifunctional catalysts, capable of catalyzing both the oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) and the oxygen evolution reaction (OER) for the conversion and storage of energy. To improve their catalytic properties, different strategies are used; either by changing the method of preparation or the doping of metal ions. In this paper, we describe the preparation of Mn0.5Ni1.5CoO4oxide by sol-gel method, and we discuss a comparison of electrocatalytic properties between NiO, Mn0.5Ni1.5CoO4and Pt/C. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Chen X., Liu G., Shi J., Xu J., Xu B.
Title: Distilled Binary Neural Network for Monaural Speech Separation
Source title: Proceedings of the International Joint Conference on Neural Networks
Affiliations: Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences (CASIA), Beijing, China; Research Center for Brain-inspired Intelligence, CASIA, China; University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, China; Center for Excellence in Brain Science and Intelligence Technology, CAS, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, X., Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences (CASIA), Beijing, China, Research Center for Brain-inspired Intelligence, CASIA, China, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, China; Liu, G., Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences (CASIA), Beijing, China, Research Center for Brain-inspired Intelligence, CASIA, China, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, China; Shi, J., Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences (CASIA), Beijing, China, Research Center for Brain-inspired Intelligence, CASIA, China, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, China; Xu, J., Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences (CASIA), Beijing, China, Research Center for Brain-inspired Intelligence, CASIA, China; Xu, B., Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences (CASIA), Beijing, China, Research Center for Brain-inspired Intelligence, CASIA, China, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, China, Center for Excellence in Brain Science and Intelligence Technology, CAS, China
Abstract: Monaural speech separation, aiming at solving the cocktail party problem, has many important application scenarios, most of which ask for the real-time response, high energy efficiency and efficient storage. However, the state-of-the-art Deep Neural Network based separation models usually require huge memory and computation for the 32-bit floating point multiply accumulations, hence most of them cannot meet those requirements. Recently, there are many methods proposed to solve the problem, and binary neural networks have drawn many attentions for they compress and speed up its counterparts at the cost of some performance. Hence, in this paper, we binarize Deep Neural Network based separation models, aiming to deploy them on embedded devices for real-time applications. Furthermore, we improve the separation performance by integrating knowledge distillation into the training phase of binary neural network based models, which is referred as Distilled Binary Neural Network (DBNN). To the best of our knowledge, DBNN is the first attempt to integrate two types of model compression. In the experiments, we demonstrate the effectiveness of our proposed method, which successfully binarizes the Deep Neural Network based separation models with a comparable performance. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Binary Neural Network; Knowledge Distillation; Monaural Speech Separation
Index Keywords: Digital arithmetic; Distillation; Energy efficiency; Source separation; Speech analysis; Application scenario; Binary neural networks; Cocktail party problems; Floating point multiply; High energy efficiency; Real-time application; Separation performance; Speech separation; Deep neural networks

Abstract: Deep convolutional neural networks (ConvNets) have achieved the state-of-the-art performance on many real-world applications. However, significant computation and storage demands are required by ConvNets. Spiking neural networks (SNNs), with sparsely activated neurons and event-driven computations, show great potential to take advantage of the ultra- low power spike-based hardware architectures. Yet, training SNN with similar accuracy as ConvNets is difficult. Recent researchers have demonstrated the work of converting ConvNets to SNNs (CNN-SNN conversion) with similar accuracy. However, the energy-efficiency of the converted SNNs is impaired by the increased classification latency. In this paper, we focus on optimizing the classification latency of the converted SNNs. First, we propose a restricted output training method to normalize the converted weights dynamically in the CNN-SNN training phase. Second, false spikes are identified and the false spike inhibition theory is derived to speedup the convergence of the classification process. Third, we propose a temporal max pooling method to approximate the max pooling operation in ConvNets without accuracy loss. The evaluation shows that the converted SNNs converge in about 30 time-steps and achieve the best classification accuracy of 94% on CIFAR -10 dataset. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: CNN-SNN Conversion; Convolutional Neural Networks; Spiking Neural Networks
Index Keywords: Classification (of information); Computation theory; Convolution; Deep neural networks; Energy efficiency; Neural networks; Classification accuracy; Classification process; Convolutional neural network; Deep convolutional neural networks; Hardware architecture; Spiking neural networks; State-of-the-art performance; Training methods; Low power electronics

Authors: Fernandes M.P., Vieira S.M., Henriques J.C.C., Valerio D., Gato L.M.C.
Title: Short-term prediction in an Oscillating Water Column using Artificial Neural Networks
Source title: Proceedings of the International Joint Conference on Neural Networks
Affiliations: IDMEC, Instituto Superior Técnico, Universidade de Lisboa, Portugal, Portugal
Authors with affiliations: Fernandes, M.P., IDMEC, Instituto Superior Técnico, Universidade de Lisboa, Portugal, Portugal; Vieira, S.M., IDMEC, Instituto Superior Técnico, Universidade de Lisboa, Portugal, Portugal; Henriques, J.C.C., IDMEC, Instituto Superior Técnico, Universidade de Lisboa, Portugal, Portugal; Valerio, D., IDMEC, Instituto Superior Técnico, Universidade de Lisboa, Portugal, Portugal; Gato, L.M.C., IDMEC, Instituto Superior Técnico, Universidade de Lisboa, Portugal, Portugal
Abstract: The oscillating-water-column (OWC) is widely regarded as the simplest and most reliable type of wave energy converter. An OWC device comprises a partly submerged hollow structure composed of an aperture below the water surface and an air chamber above the free surface. The oscillating motion of the internal free water surface produced by the incident waves compresses and expands the air in the chamber. The pressure between the air chamber and the atmosphere can be used to drive a turbine connected directly to an electrical generator. Usually the turbines used in OWCs are of the self-rectifying type, i.e., they rotate always in the same sense independently of the flow direction. The aim of this paper is to assess the potential use of experimental data collected in the Mutriku breakwater wave power plant, located in the north of Spain, to perform short-term prediction of the pressure inside the air chamber by a Nonlinear Autoregressive with eXogenous inputs (NARX) Artificial Neural Network (ANN). The NARX model is explored and tuned for a one-step and multi-step-ahead prediction. The results showed that the model is able to capture the OWC system dynamics for a few-steps ahead with a good performance. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Multi-step-ahead prediction; NARX neural networks; Oscillating water column; Wave energy

Title: Real-Time Battery Bank Charge-Discharge Using Neural Sliding Mode Control
Source title: Proceedings of the International Joint Conference on Neural Networks

El Bajýo, Zapopan, Jalisco, 45019, Mexico
Abstract: Batteries are one of the most important technologies for energy storage, and an important part of the renewable energy generation systems. Nowadays, there exist diverse types of batteries with different characteristics and it is very important to be able to charge and discharge the battery at a safe and effective rate to maximize the battery life and fulfill the requirements of each application. Different power electronics circuits can be used to control battery charge and discharge; one of the most used is the DC-DC Buck-Boost converter. Typically, this type of converter only allows for energy transfer in one direction; otherwise a different topology and two controllers are needed, which must commute between charging and discharging mode. The objective of this work is to develop a single neural sliding modes control with on-line identification for both battery charge and discharge processes. The proposed controller does not depend on the converter parameters; for this reason, it can be used under different voltage and current requirements without the need of considerable changes in its implementation. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Prakash S.S., Mamun K.A., Islam F.R., Cirrincione M.
Title: Design of a Hybrid Microgrid for a Rural Community in Pacific Island Countries
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 4th Asia-Pacific World Congress on Computer Science and Engineering, APWC on CSE 2017
Affiliations: School of Engineering and Physics, University of the South Pacific, USP, Suva, Fiji
Authors with affiliations: Prakash, S.S., School of Engineering and Physics, University of the South Pacific, USP, Suva, Fiji; Mamun, K.A., School of Engineering and Physics, University of the South Pacific, USP, Suva, Fiji; Islam, F.R., School of Engineering and Physics, University of the South Pacific, USP, Suva, Fiji; Cirrincione, M., School of Engineering and Physics, University of the South Pacific, USP, Suva, Fiji
Abstract: In Pacific Island Countries (PICs) villages are scattered due to the inherited islanding nature hence access to electricity from utility grids becomes difficult. As a result, rural communities depended on electricity that generated from fossil fuels (FFs) powered generators and renewable energy sources (RES). Localized hybrid microgrids can be designed to cater electricity needs for such communities. The prerequisite for the design of a rural microgrid is: a load model which can be extrapolated either from a similar system or loading information gathered from FF based existing systems. In this paper such an extrapolated model has been simulated to obtain optimum microgrid design for the Nasau Village (Koro Island, Fiji) located in the pacific region which includes a methodology for designing a hybrid microgrid. An estimated load model has been designed for the village based on the existing system load and then the system has been simulated using HOMER Pro (microgrid software by HOMER Energy) to determine the supply required from Photovoltaic (PV) cells, Battery Energy Storage System (BESS) and Diesel Generator in the hybrid microgrid. This paper will help to design a microgrid for a rural community which can serve as a reference for the future development of rural microgrid in PICs. © 2017 IEEE.

Abstract: Wasting food is a common problem in our society. Food waste management is crucial since it can improve our environmental and economic sustainability. We have identified the use of mobile technology to reduce food waste management and built an android mobile application that allows restaurants to donate and share their foods and leftovers with people in need. This app will enable users to register, login, view items, add items, add items to cart, remove an item from the cart, and log out. This app is using the firebase storage and real-time database. Any user in need can see all the food images donated by different users and add it to his or her cart. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Design and application of energy router to realise the smart power microgrid
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 IEEE International Conference on Mechatronics and Automation, ICMA 2018

Abstract: With the rapid development of smart grid and information technology, Energy Internet has been attracting increasing attention from government as well industry. The current power grid and energy management system cannot meet optimal allocation and auxiliary function of clean energy power generation.The Energy router is an effective power device which cannot only realise the power control of each power supply, but also can optimise the allocation of electrical energy by communication equipment.Within an Energy Internet, energy router is the key element to receive, control, transmit, transfer, store and distribute energies, just like what a conventional router does in telecommunications.The energy router is designed as a control center on the distribution side. Based on conventional concept of energy hub, new features and improvements, including combining information processing unit, adding renewable energy as input power, proposing cost deduction solutions, and redesigning the storage system, have been added in designing energy router, which is to realize the final target of Energy Internet.In the end, with the consideration of market conditions, energy routers can be constructed based on existed industrial foundation, including in the markets that are controlled by monopoly electricity enterprises. Feasibility analysis and related advantages of developing energy routers are provided in the paper. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: This paper introduces energy storage technology in Power Grid. Firstly,it briefly expounds the significance and value of energy storage technology research in Power Grid, analyzes the role of it.Then this paper introduces various types of storage technology such as superconducting magnetic energy storage, super capacitor energy storage, sodium sulfur battery, lithium ion, flow battery technology, and discusses their advantages and disadvantages. Demands on energy storage technology in Power Grid are also summarized.And it focuses on the research status of energy storage technology in power grid. Finally, both some existing problems and the future development trend of energy storage technology in power grid are presented. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: In ship electric propulsion and other energy storage applications, in order to ensure continuous and smooth output of energy, we often use two kinds of energy storage device mixed. In this paper, we use batteries and super capacitor device as mixed energy storage system. This paper focuses on the super capacitor and battery energy storage control strategy, so that the super capacitor and battery terminal voltage tends to balance and stability in a relatively short period of time. At the same time, the change of the load condition will cause large fluctuation of the DC bus voltage of the ship electric propulsion system. the simulation results show that the design of energy storage system can improve the voltage stability of DC bus obviously. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zhao J., Peng M., Zhong J., Li G.
Title: Low-carbon optimized control for peak load based on V2G storage
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, 410082, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhao, J., College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, 410082, China; Peng, M., College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, 410082, China; Zhong, J., College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, 410082, China; Li, G., College of Electrical and Information Engineering, Hunan University, Changsha, 410082, China
Abstract: With the increasing consumption of electricity and the aggravation of global warming, encouraging EV owners participates in V2G energy storage by using financial compensation measures during peak periods, which is significant for conserving energy and reducing emissions of the power grid and alleviating the power supply shortage. Aiming at the peak load of the power grid, this paper puts forward a three-stage regulation strategy based on step-wise economic incentive method. At the same time, a mathematical model with the lowest grid power financial loss, the minimum carbon emission and the minimum loss of power supply probability is constructed. By selecting a domestic area as the research object, three kinds of control schemes are proposed to optimize the actual system aiming at its peak load level. The schemes not only reduce carbon emission and achieve double win-win of the grid and EV owners, but also improve the reliability of power supply, which verify the effectiveness and practicality of low-carbon control strategy. © 2018 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.

Authors: Liu J., Zheng Z.
Title: Distributed cooperative optimal load-sharing control for coupled parallel-connected dynamical systems
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: School of Mathematics and Statistics, Hunan University of Commerce, Changsha, Hunan, 410205, China; Department of Automation, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, 410073, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, J., School of Mathematics and Statistics, Hunan University of Commerce, Changsha, Hunan, 410205, China, Department of Automation, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, 410073, China; Zheng, Z., Department of Automation, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, 410073, China
Abstract: In this paper, a distributed load-sharing control is proposed for one class of coupled parallel-connected dynamical systems with non-identical nonlinear dynamics. The communication between subsystems is modeled into a digraph. To construct the relationship between input and output, the input-output linearization technique is adopted to transform the load-sharing control design into a tracking synchronization problem of a general linear multi-agent system. LQR-based method is introduced to design the cooperative load-sharing control law based on the nearest neighbor principle, which makes the coupling strength only depend on the communication topology and the control gain only depend on the sub-system model. The asymptotical stability of the entire closed-loop systems can be decoupled into each sub-system's stability through matrix transformation provided that the directed graph has a spanning tree, which is rigorously proved with the aid of the Lyapunov function. A desired response speed can be obtained by tuning the control parameters based on the LQR method. The proposed approach is successfully applied to address the current-sharing problem of parallel charging systems for energy storage type light rail vehicles. © 2018 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: Cooperative Control; Coupled Parallel-Connected Dynamical Systems; Distributed Load-Sharing; Input-Output Linearization; Parallel Chargers

Abstract: In order to make better use of new energy and improve the utilization rate of energy, much concern have been paid to large-scale energy storage and combined cooling, heating and power (CCHP) technology. This study proposes a novel combined cooling, heating and power (CCHP) system with compressed air energy storage(CAES). In order to improve the power generation efficiency and operating economy of the system, the multi-objective optimization algorithm based on genetic algorithm is used to control the output power of the two subsystems. The results show that the efficiency of the gas internal combustion engine can be maintained at a high level, while operating cost is low, the output power can be selected according to the actual requirements. © 2018 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.

Title: Self-Starting Analysis of New Energy System with Wind Power and Energy Storage
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC

Abstract: Power grid is developing towards the direction of intelligence. Nevertheless, the giant grid scale, complicated structure and external natural factors result in the potential of large-scaled power failure. Traditional black start power gives priority to hydropower. In areas with shortage of hydro power resources, suitable black start power is insufficient. The key of black start is able to realize the safe and stable operation of wind power and energy storage cogeneration system. Due to the combination of wind turbines and energy storage is a small system, energy storage, as a black start power source, starts the wind turbines together to supply power for the remote load. Therefore, it is necessary to run the balance and stable operation of a small system. In this paper, PSCAD simulation software is employed to conduct modeling of wind power and energy storage system, and the self-starting process of wind storage cogeneration system is analyzed by using resistance sensor as the load. The result verifies the wind power storage system's initiation process. © 2018 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.

Authors: Xu M., Liu Q., Mao C., Wang Q., Sun P.
Title: Energy-efficient Control of Energy Storage Tram with Signaling Constraints
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, 610031, China
Authors with affiliations: Xu, M., School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, 610031, China; Liu, Q., School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, 610031, China; Mao, C., School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, 610031, China; Wang, Q., School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, 610031, China; Sun, P., School of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, 610031, China
Abstract: Trajectory optimization for energy storage tram (EST) aims at finding the optimal speed profile that can reduce the discharge energy of energy storage system (ESS) and absorb the regenerative braking energy as much as possible. This paper proposes a two-level programming framework considering the operational and signaling constraints as well as the efficiencies of ESS. The minimization of equivalent energy consumption of ESS is chosen as the optimization objective. At the first level, the algorithm that can calculate an energy saving minimum trip time speed profile (MTTSP) without unnecessary braking considering signaling at the intersection was developed. At the second level, the algorithms that can calculate an energy-efficient speed profile (EESP) based on the coasting control were proposed too. With the foundation of the two-level programming framework, we can effectively obtain the EESP consequently. The framework is applied in two main signal control modes for tram: the signal priority mode and the signal passive priority mode to verify its effectiveness. Simulations of three cases for each mode demonstrate that the proposed programming framework can provide an effective approach in solving the EST control problem with signaling constraints for reducing energy consumption. © 2018 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.

Authors: Lyu X., Xu Z., Zhang J., Wang N., Xu W.
Title: An Hour-ahead Cooperation Model of Virtual Power Plants Considering Uncertainties of Wind/Photovoltaic Power
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: College of Electronics Information Engineering, Tongji University, Shanghai, 201804, China
Authors with affiliations: Lyu, X., College of Electronics Information Engineering, Tongji University, Shanghai, 201804, China; Xu, Z., College of Electronics Information Engineering, Tongji University, Shanghai, 201804, China; Zhang, J., College of Electronics Information Engineering, Tongji University, Shanghai, 201804, China; Wang, N., College of Electronics Information Engineering, Tongji University, Shanghai, 201804, China; Xu, W., College of Electronics Information Engineering, Tongji University, Shanghai, 201804, China
Abstract: Virtual power plant (VPP) is a main method of solving grid-integration of distributed generators (DG). This paper proposes an hour-ahead cooperation model of VPPs, including wind turbines, photovoltaic panels, controllable load and energy storage system (ESS), and focuses on hour-ahead cooperative space of VPPs, considering uncertainties of wind and photovoltaic power. In order to obtain the day-ahead results of VPPs, a day-ahead independent scheduling model is built as well. Typical scenarios with probability information are used to describe the uncertainties of wind and photovoltaic output. Roth-Erevalgorithm and clearing mechanism are applied to simulate hour-ahead cooperation process. The case study compares the results before cooperation with that after cooperation, which proves that the cooperation can reduce day-ahead bidding deviations from the actual output and increase profits. Besides, the number of VPPs and the involvement of demand response (DR) and ESS also have an impact on the results, which provides a reference for the cooperation of VPPs in the hour-ahead market. © 2018 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.

Title: Distributed Game-theoretic Interactive Algorithm for Microgrid Optimization

Abstract: Considering the decentralization characteristic of microgrid, this paper presents a distributed game-theoretic interative optimization algorithm. It aims at achieving distributed operation optimization for microgrid energy management system and supporting plug-and-play. On the basis of analysis of microgrid structure, game models are built for modular component units according to the three elements of a strategic game. In the meantime, considering satisfaction of load and cost of electricity, demand response is introduced and an iterative game-theoretic resource-storage-load optimization model is built. And a best-response mechanism is adopted to solve the Nash equilibrium. Finally, the feasibility and availability of the proposed algorithm are validated by simulation of a typical islanded microgrid. © 2018 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.

Title: The Load Aggregation Strategy of Central Air-conditioning for Smoothing Wind Power Fluctuation
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: School of Automation, Hangzhou Dianzi University, Hangzhou, 310018, China; Hangzhou Power Supply Company, Zhejiang Electric Power Corporation of State Grid, Hangzhou, 310009, China
Authors with affiliations: Lujie, H., School of Automation, Hangzhou Dianzi University, Hangzhou, 310018, China; Ping, L., School of Automation, Hangzhou Dianzi University, Hangzhou, 310018, China; Sheng, C., School of Automation, Hangzhou Dianzi University, Hangzhou, 310018, China; Qiaoyong, C., Hangzhou Power Supply Company, Zhejiang Electric Power Corporation of State Grid, Hangzhou, 310009, China
Abstract: Compared with the household air-conditioning, central air-conditioning has larger rated capacity and more concentrated operating period. These characteristics of the central air-conditioning make it a high quality resource that can be participated in the centralized load regulation. Firstly, the equivalent thermal parameters model of central air-conditioning and the thermal comfort model of human body are established, and then the aggregation strategy of central air-conditioning loads is proposed to minimize the operation fees of load aggregator under the constraints of the minimum aggregated load requirement, adjustment time period and users' comfort index. The particle swarm optimization algorithm is adopted to solve the optimal problem in this paper. Finally, the aggregated central air-conditioning loads are used to smooth the wind power fluctuation in the wind farm, and the optimal dispatch costs are compared with the investment cost of energy storage equipment needed to compensate the power fluctuation. The analysis results show that the load aggregation strategy of central air-conditioning is more economical than the configuration of traditional energy storage equipment. © 2018 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: Central air-conditioning; Load aggregation; Smooth wind power fluctuation; Virtual energy storage
Index Keywords: Energy storage; Investments; Particle swarm optimization (PSO); Wind power; Aggregation strategy; Central air-conditioning; Equivalent thermal; Load aggregation; Operating periods; Particle swarm optimization algorithm; Power fluctuations; Thermal comfort models; Air conditioning

Authors: Zhu B., Liao H., Wang R., Jiao Y., Huang Z., Peng J.
Title: A Novel Charging Strategy to Reduce Voltage Variation for Reconfigurable Energy Storage System of Modern Tram
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, China; Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Rail Vehicles Braking Technology, Zhuzhou, China; CRRC ZhuZhou Locomotive Co., Ltd., Zhuzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhu, B., School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Rail Vehicles Braking Technology, Zhuzhou, China; Liao, H., School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Rail Vehicles Braking Technology, Zhuzhou, China, CRRC ZhuZhou Locomotive Co., Ltd., Zhuzhou, China; Wang, R., School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Rail Vehicles Braking Technology, Zhuzhou, China; Jiao, Y., School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Rail Vehicles Braking Technology, Zhuzhou, China; Huang, Z., School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Rail Vehicles Braking Technology, Zhuzhou, China; Peng, J., School of Information Science and Engineering, Central South University, Changsha, China, Hunan Engineering Laboratory of Rail Vehicles Braking Technology, Zhuzhou, China
Abstract: Due to the voltage limitation, large number of ultracapacitor cells need to be connected in parallel and series to provide a specific voltage level for trams. However, a large scale of series-connected ultracapacitors increase the voltage variation of the DC bus, which affects the size and efficiency of the subsequent power converter stage and undermines the energy utilization of the ultracapacitor. Moreover, ultracapacitors in series-connection inevitably suffer from voltage imbalance, which limits the capacity of energy storage system by the weakest cell. To alleviate the above problems, ultracapacitor parallel-series reconfiguration is employed to reduce the voltage variation in this paper. Particularly, a synchronous equilibrium strategy based on consensus tracking control is designed for voltage balance among series-connected ultracapacitors. First, we mathematically model the ultracapacitor-based energy storage system using the state-space averaging method. Second, the law of reconfiguration and synchronous equilibrium strategy is analyzed and designed. Finally, both simulation and experiment results verify that the proposed charging strategy effectively suppresses the voltage variation of the DC bus and evidently reduces balance time during charging. © 2018 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: Reconfigurable topology; The voltage variation; Ultracapacitor; Voltage imbalance
Index Keywords: Capacitor storage; Energy utilization; Land vehicle propulsion; Railroad rolling stock; Capacity of energies; Charging strategies; Energy storage systems; Equilibrium strategy; Reconfigurable; State space averaging method; Voltage imbalance; Voltage variation; Supercapacitor

Authors: Zhang J., Nong J., Xu Z., Zhu F., Xu W.
Title: A Costs-Emissions Bi-objective Optimization of Virtual Power Plant Operation in Hongfeng Eco-town
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
Affiliations: College of Electronics and Information Engineering, Tongji University, Shanghai, 201804, China; Power Grid Planning and Research Center of Guizhou Power Grid Co. Ltd., Guiyang, 550003, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, J., College of Electronics and Information Engineering, Tongji University, Shanghai, 201804, China; Nong, J., Power Grid Planning and Research Center of Guizhou Power Grid Co. Ltd., Guiyang, 550003, China; Xu, Z., College of Electronics and Information Engineering, Tongji University, Shanghai, 201804, China; Zhu, F., College of Electronics and Information Engineering, Tongji University, Shanghai, 201804, China; Xu, W., College of Electronics and Information Engineering, Tongji University, Shanghai, 201804, China
Abstract: This paper addresses the optimal operation issues for virtual power plant (VPP). Two conflicting objectives are considered and a bi-objective problem is formulated mathematically. The first objective (economical performance) contains cost of fuel consumption and cost of power purchased from grid. The second objective (environmental performance) takes account of several pollutant emissions. Multi-objective particle swarm optimization (MOPSO) is applied to derive the Pareto frontier which is a set of noninferior solutions. A realistic case study is performed on Hongfeng Eco-town as a model of VPP, which includes various distributed energy resources (DER) such as hydropower units, wind turbines, photovoltaic panels, combined cooling heating and power units (CCHP) and storage devices. Simulation concentrates on three strategies: 1) money-oriented, 2) environment-only, 3) Pareto-optimal. Comparison of simulation results reveals that Pareto-optimal strategy can better compromise costs and emissions. Further, system operators could choose noninferior solutions from Pareto frontier according to their specific preference. © 2018 Technical Committee on Control Theory, Chinese Association of Automation.
Author Keywords: Bi-objective; Distributed Energy Resources; Hongfeng Eco-town; Multi-objective Particle Swarm Optimization; Virtual Power Plant

Authors: Lu J., Ling C., Shicong Z., Yi Y., Jian Q., Wen Z.
Title: Regional Phase Change Storage Station Optimal Operation Considering Dynamic Temperature Estimation Based on BP Neural Network
Source title: Chinese Control Conference, CCC
