Authors: Xue Q.
Title: Study on Reliability Sensitivity Algorithm of Small Component Thermal Ignition Device
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 2nd IEEE Advanced Information Management, Communicates, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IMCEC 2018
Affiliations: Xi'An Research Institute of China, Coal Technology Engineering Group Corp, Xi'an, China
Authors with affiliations: Xue, Q., Xi'An Research Institute of China, Coal Technology Engineering Group Corp, Xi'an, China
Abstract: Thermal ignition device is testing equipment of intrinsically safe electrical products about thermal igniting for small element. Its research and application is an important link in the development of energy control about energy storage components. The paper takes influencing factors as starting point to study on the reliability sensitivity of small component thermal ignition device. On the basis of analyzing uncertainty of the basic variables, the curves of the related input are fitted. Paper making a binary linear regression analysis method based on covariance of correlation input is proposed to modify the sensitivity. In order to verify validity and accuracy of reliability sensitivity analysis, sensitivity tests were carried out on small component thermal ignition device repeatedly. From the operation status and the experimental data, it is reasonable and feasible for optimizing the evaluation process and improving the verification efficiency. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: Large capacity energy storage system is one of the effective measures to solve the problem of grid connection of a series of renewable energy generation power generation like wind power generation. Aiming at the imbalance of battery's SOC (state of charge SOC) in large-capacity energy storage system, we regulate the output power of each phase by injecting zero sequence voltage into cascade H bridge energy storage system and select the amplitude and phase angle of zero sequence voltage reasonably, through this method SOC equalization can be realized by adj usting the additional power of each phase. The system model has been built in the MATLAB simulation environment, and the simulation results verify the effectiveness and feasibility of the control method. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Introduction and Protective Measures of LWG9-252 Type SF6 High Voltage Circuit Breaker Electromotor Circuit
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 2nd IEEE Advanced Information Management, Communicates, Electronic and Automation Control Conference, IMCEC 2018

Abstract: Under humid coastal climate conditions, 'Over-current or timeout' signal appears in the process of energy storage, then the electromotor burnout. The phenomenon is common for LWG9-252 type SF6 high voltage circuit breaker. The problems related to relay selection, circuit design, climatic conditions and working condition of heater and dehumidifier. This paper points out that the selection of airbag type time relay is an important cause of the stored energy electromotor frequent burning out. In addition, the optimization suggestions of energy storage circuit are put forward. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Miettinen J.J., Ikaheimo J., Rasku T., Holttinen H., Kiviluoma J.
Title: Impact of longer stochastic forecast horizon on the operational cost of a power system
Source title: International Conference on the European Energy Market, EEM
Affiliations: VTT - Technical Research Centre of Finland, Finland
Authors with affiliations: Miettinen, J.J., VTT - Technical Research Centre of Finland, Finland; Ikaheimo, J., VTT - Technical Research Centre of Finland, Finland; Rasku, T., VTT - Technical Research Centre of Finland, Finland; Holttinen, H., VTT - Technical Research Centre of Finland, Finland; Kiviluoma, J., VTT - Technical Research Centre of Finland, Finland
Abstract: Many decisions in the power system are based on the day-ahead forecasting of production and consumption. In the presence of storages and demand side management (together the 'flexibility assets') the day-ahead forecast horizon might not be enough for optimal utilization of these assets. This paper shows that by increasing the forecast horizon of wind power the operational costs in the power system of the Baltic Sea region can be reduced. As the forecast horizon increases the largest cost savings are on the fuel cost of mid-merit units, whereas for the base load units the longer forecast horizon increases the operational costs. Furthermore, as the forecast horizon approaches one week, the results indicate that the relative impact on the operational cost savings start to reduce. Therefore, the increase of the forecast horizon can run up against a limit, which after the forecasts may not contain any valuable information for decision making. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy storage; Power system modeling; Wind energy; Wind energy integration

Authors: Soares T., Sousa T., Andersen P.B., Pinson P.
Title: Optimal offering strategy of an EV aggregator in the frequency-controlled normal operation reserve market
Source title: International Conference on the European Energy Market, EEM
Affiliations: INESC TEC, Center for Power and Energy Systems, Porto, Portugal; Technical University of Denmark (DTU), Department of Electrical Engineering, Lyngby, Denmark
Authors with affiliations: Soares, T., INESC TEC, Center for Power and Energy Systems, Porto, Portugal; Sousa, T., Technical University of Denmark (DTU), Department of Electrical Engineering, Lyngby, Denmark; Andersen, P.B., Technical University of Denmark (DTU), Department of Electrical Engineering, Lyngby, Denmark; Pinson, P., Technical University of Denmark (DTU), Department of Electrical Engineering, Lyngby, Denmark
Abstract: Electric vehicles (EVs) are to play an important role in electricity markets, since their energy storage capability can be beneficial to power systems operation. Electric vehicle aggregators will consequently develop adequate offering strategies to participate in energy and reserve markets, accounting for the market rules and operational capabilities of EVs aggregators (e.g., fleet of EVs). In this paper, we propose an offering strategy model for an EV aggregator to participate in the frequency-controlled normal operation reserve service (FCR-N) in Eastern Denmark. The aim is to maximize the expected revenue of the aggregator, accounting for potential penalties for missing the provision of both upward and downward reserves. The methodology has been modeled and tested under the scope of the PARKER project, which considers a case study based on real data from a small fleet of electric vehicles. An important conclusion relates to the availability patterns of the EVs that significantly changes the strategical participation of the EV aggregator in the service. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Fernandes F., Sousa J.A.M., Santana J., Lagarto J.
Title: Scheduling of a pumped-storage hydro in the day-ahead market and in the secondary reserve market
Source title: International Conference on the European Energy Market, EEM
Affiliations: IST, Lisbon, Portugal; INESC-ID, ISEL/ADEEEA, Lisbon, Portugal; IST INESC-ID, Lisbon, Portugal
Authors with affiliations: Fernandes, F., IST, Lisbon, Portugal; Sousa, J.A.M., INESC-ID, ISEL/ADEEEA, Lisbon, Portugal; Santana, J., IST INESC-ID, Lisbon, Portugal; Lagarto, J., INESC-ID, ISEL/ADEEEA, Lisbon, Portugal
Abstract: The increasing integration of wind power in the Portuguese energy market has been raising some challenges in terms of operation and planning of the generation portfolio and of power system management, with ancillary services playing a major role in system stability. A generation company (GENCO) aiming at maximizing its profits has to deal with bids to several available markets, among which are the Day-ahead Market (DAM) and the Secondary Reserve Market (SRM). This paper presents a scheduling solution of a price-maker GENCO whose portfolio comprises a pumped-storage hydro (PSH) unit with variable pumping capacity, acting simultaneously in the DAM and SRM. The results were obtained for four different scenarios, where the PSH may or may not possess variable pumping capacity and compares the PSH behavior in one or both markets simultaneously. The model was implemented in General Algebraic Modeling System (GAMS) as a Mixed Integer Programming (MIP) using CPLEX solver. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Petrichenko L., Broka Z., Sauhats A., Bezrukovs D.
Title: Cost-benefit analysis of li-ion batteries in a distribution network
Source title: International Conference on the European Energy Market, EEM
Affiliations: Riga Technical University (RTU), Institute of Power Engineering, Riga, Latvia
Authors with affiliations: Petrichenko, L., Riga Technical University (RTU), Institute of Power Engineering, Riga, Latvia; Broka, Z., Riga Technical University (RTU), Institute of Power Engineering, Riga, Latvia; Sauhats, A., Riga Technical University (RTU), Institute of Power Engineering, Riga, Latvia; Bezrukovs, D., Riga Technical University (RTU), Institute of Power Engineering, Riga, Latvia
Abstract: The paper is focused on economic feasibility analysis of battery energy storage providing load shifting to the end-user. Electro-chemical storage technology is considered, as it is envisioned to play an important role in future power systems by reducing costs, deferring investments and increasing reliability of system operation. In the study, cash-flows arising from battery investment and operation in a representative distribution grid are considered for a planning period of 33 years. Forecasting methodology based on Fourier transform for the hourly electricity market price is proposed and performed for a particular bidding area of the Nord Pool day-ahead market. Results of the case study demonstrate that with the current trends of market price and tariff structure of electricity paid by the end-users, investments in BESS may not be profitable and some additional incentives should be introduced. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Farrokhseresht M., Paterakis N.G., Gibescu M., Slootweg J.G.
Title: Participation of a combined wind and storage unit in the day-ahead and local balancing markets
Source title: International Conference on the European Energy Market, EEM
Affiliations: Eindhoven University of Technology, Electrical Energy Systems, Eindhoven, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Farrokhseresht, M., Eindhoven University of Technology, Electrical Energy Systems, Eindhoven, Netherlands; Paterakis, N.G., Eindhoven University of Technology, Electrical Energy Systems, Eindhoven, Netherlands; Gibescu, M., Eindhoven University of Technology, Electrical Energy Systems, Eindhoven, Netherlands; Slootweg, J.G., Eindhoven University of Technology, Electrical Energy Systems, Eindhoven, Netherlands
Abstract: In this paper, the market participation of an independent energy producer owning a combined wind generator-energy storage system (WG-ESS) connected to the distribution network is considered. A mathematical model for the profit maximization of the WG-ESS participating strategically in wholesale day-ahead and local balancing markets (LBMs) is proposed. We assume that in a future dominated by uncertainty and variability from distributed renewable energy sources, such a LBM, to be operated by a new entity called distribution market operator (DMO) will evolve. A stochastic bi-level optimization algorithm is adopted, where the WG-ESS maximizes its profit in the day-ahead market and the DMO-operated LBM. The results show that the strategic decisions of the WG-ESS in multiple markets significantly change compared to a single DA energy-only market. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Song M., Amelin M., Wang X., Saleem A.
Title: Optimized operational management of an EV sharing community integrated with battery energy storage and PV generation
Source title: International Conference on the European Energy Market, EEM
Affiliations: Department of Electric Power and Energy Systems, Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden; InnoEnergy Scandinavia, Stockholm, Sweden
Authors with affiliations: Song, M., Department of Electric Power and Energy Systems, Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden; Amelin, M., Department of Electric Power and Energy Systems, Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden; Wang, X., InnoEnergy Scandinavia, Stockholm, Sweden; Saleem, A., InnoEnergy Scandinavia, Stockholm, Sweden
Abstract: Sharing schemes are emerging in residential and business sectors to reduce the purchase and operation cost of individuals. This paper proposes a framework to support the operational management of a shared EV fleet. An optimization algorithm is developed to coordinate the charging and reservation assignment using mixed integer programming. The integration with local PV production and battery storage is taken into account. A booking algorithm is also developed to determine whether a reservation can be accepted or not. Monte Carlo simulation is performed in the case study to demonstrate an application of the proposed framework with the Swedish travel patterns. The result provides an overview about the utilization rate of the fleet with different number of EVs, which can support the investment decision of an EV sharing community. The result also shows that the EVs and battery are effectively coordinated to minimize the total cost, satisfy the reservations and comply with grid limits. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: The proceedings contain 223 papers. Authors: Zupancic J., Lakic E., Medved T., Gubina A.F.
Title: Analysis of large scale storage impact on distribution network
Source title: International Conference on the European Energy Market, EEM
Affiliations: Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Laboratory for Energy Policy, University of Ljubljana, Ljubljana, Slovenia
Authors with affiliations: Zupancic, J., Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Laboratory for Energy Policy, University of Ljubljana, Ljubljana, Slovenia; Lakic, E., Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Laboratory for Energy Policy, University of Ljubljana, Ljubljana, Slovenia; Medved, T., Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Laboratory for Energy Policy, University of Ljubljana, Ljubljana, Slovenia; Gubina, A.F., Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Laboratory for Energy Policy, University of Ljubljana, Ljubljana, Slovenia
Abstract: The installation of new smart grid technologies brings additional possibilities for power system operation. Among those technologies, energy storage promises to support energy transition towards a system with a high share of renewable energy sources. The paper outlines the results of the large-scale simulation in the distribution grid obtained within Horizon 2020 project STORY. Due to the characteristics of the modelled network, a stochastic Monte Carlo simulation approach is used for the network simulation with Matlab and OpenDSS software. The real-world database was tuned for Central European region and daily power flow simulations were performed for all four seasons. The impact of the storage was compared, based on the installed capacity in the network and in combination with different technology drivers. The results confirmed that the integration of battery storage devices has a considerable positive impact on the power system but there are still many challenges awaiting in the near future. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Control architecture requirements of multitasking battery resource operation
Source title: International Conference on the European Energy Market, EEM

Authors with affiliations: Tikka, V., Lappeenranta University of Technology, LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Belonoaova, N., Lappeenranta University of Technology, LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Lana, A., Lappeenranta University of Technology, LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Honkapurc, S., Lappeenranta University of Technology, LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Lassila, J., Lappeenranta University of Technology, LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Partanen, J., Lappeenranta University of Technology, LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland
Abstract: The paper addresses data exchange and telecontrol requirements of battery energy storage systems (BESSs) aimed to operate in a multitask environment. Requirements for the control architecture are set by tasks that are intended to be executed in parallel. In the paper, a semicentralized telecontrol structure is proposed. The control stucture is divided into three layers by taking into account the specific requirements of the battery system. The telecontrol architecture was tested and validated on an actual test platform having access to several BESS resources. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Haapaniemi J., Haakana J., Belonogova N., Lassila J., Partanen J.
Title: Changing to power-based grid pricing - An incentive for grid defections in nordic conditions?
Source title: International Conference on the European Energy Market, EEM
Affiliations: Lappeenranta University of Technology, LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland
Authors with affiliations: Haapaniemi, J., Lappeenranta University of Technology, LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Haakana, J., Lappeenranta University of Technology, LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Belonogova, N., Lappeenranta University of Technology, LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Lassila, J., Lappeenranta University of Technology, LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Partanen, J., Lappeenranta University of Technology, LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland
Abstract: Distribution system operators' (DSO) operating environment is changing significantly since customers' distributed production, electric vehicles, heat pump systems and battery energy storage systems (BESS) are becoming more common. In this paper, the proportion of rural area customers in Nordic conditions who could go off-grid and operate independently by investing in solar photovoltaics (PV) and BESS is studied. Further, the effects on these customers' electricity bill is studied, and thereby to grid defection profitability, if DSO changes tariff system towards power-based tariff (PBT) is examined. Analyses are conducted with real customers' hourly load data from four different case areas, covering a total of 10808 customers. The study shows that the number of possible customers in the studied rural case areas is 8-19 %. If DSO changes the tariff structure from energy-based tariffs to power-based tariffs, it has significant effects on grid defection profitability whether the tariff structure includes minimum charged power or not. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Distribution pricing; Grid defection; Off-grid; Tariff change

Authors: Jakus D., Vasilj J., Bosnjak J., Sarajcev P., Vodopija S.
Title: Optimal scheduling of distributed generation and flexible storage in smart buildings
Source title: International Conference on the European Energy Market, EEM
Affiliations: University of Split - FESB, Power System Department, Rudera Boškovića 32, Split, 21000, Croatia
Authors with affiliations: Jakus, D., University of Split - FESB, Power System Department, Rudera Boškovića 32, Split, 21000, Croatia; Vasilj, J., University of Split - FESB, Power System Department, Rudera Boškovića 32, Split, 21000, Croatia; Bosnjak, J., University of Split - FESB, Power System Department, Rudera Boškovića 32, Split, 21000, Croatia; Sarajcev, P., University of Split - FESB, Power System Department, Rudera Boškovića 32, Split, 21000, Croatia; Vodopija, S., University of Split - FESB, Power System Department, Rudera Boškovića 32, Split, 21000, Croatia
Abstract: In the past, the main reason for the large scale integration of PV plants at consumer level was a potential profit guaranteed through feed-in tariffs. With this incentive mechanism and significant battery storage installation costs, there wasn't any motivation for the consumers to integrate energy storage to balance out the mismatch between local generation and demand. With the significant cost reduction of PV modules and falling costs of battery storage, these technologies become more attractive. By integrating these technologies together with the other distributed generation resources available at the consumer level, we can reduce grid supply costs and use this to finance such projects. In order to achieve such cost reduction, available production and storage resources need to be scheduled in optimal manner. This paper describes an optimization model for the optimal scheduling of distributed generation and battery storage in order to assure minimal supply costs for the grid connected consumer. The model is casted as MIP and verified through year-scale simulations based on the actual electricity consumption data, electricity price and PV plant production data for University building. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Distributed generation; Energy storage; Optimal scheduling; Smart building

Authors: Rikkas E.R.
Title: Standalone electrical storages as part of the network system in metropolitan area in Finland
Source title: International Conference on the European Energy Market, EEM
Affiliations: School of Engineering, Department of Mechanical Engineering, Energy and Efficiency Systems, Aalto University, Otakaari 4 (K1), Espoo, 02150, Finland
Authors with affiliations: Rikkas, E.R., School of Engineering, Department of Mechanical Engineering, Energy and Efficiency Systems, Aalto University, Otakaari 4 (K1), Espoo, 02150, Finland
Abstract: The paper provides an overview on potential network alternative investments like standalone electrical storages integrated close to Helsinki metropolitan office areas, suitable storage technologies and feasible idea for future corporate communities to emerge. The calculation was provided for the selected office areas: Pasila-Vallilla-Sdrnainen-Kalasatama (Helsinki), Keilaniemi-Otaniemi-Tapiola-Niittykumpu-Olari-Matinkyla (Espoo) and Aviapolis (Vantaa). The author formed prime theoretical study on potential of standalone storages to integrate into the grid as part of distribution network in the business areas with possibility of Corporate Electrical Communities to be formed. The method was composed with support of Long-range Energy Alternatives Planning System (LEAP) software taking into account both growth of the population around the selected areas and jobs there by 2030. Besides, the result was expected to confirm the necessity of the distribution companies to own the standalone electrical storages as part of the network system. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Belonogova N., Tikka V., Haapaniemi J., Haakana J., Honkapuro S., Partanen J., Heine P., Pihkala A., Hellman H.-P., Hvvarinen M.
Title: Methodology to define a BESS operating strategy for the end-customer in the changing business environment
Source title: International Conference on the European Energy Market, EEM
Affiliations: Lappeenranta University of Technology (LUT), LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Helen Electricity Network Ltd, Helsinki, Finland
Authors with affiliations: Belonogova, N., Lappeenranta University of Technology (LUT), LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Tikka, V., Lappeenranta University of Technology (LUT), LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Haapaniemi, J., Lappeenranta University of Technology (LUT), LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Haakana, J., Lappeenranta University of Technology (LUT), LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Honkapuro, S., Lappeenranta University of Technology (LUT), LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Partanen, J., Lappeenranta University of Technology (LUT), LUT School of Energy Systems, Lappeenranta, Finland; Heine, P., Helen Electricity Network Ltd, Helsinki, Finland; Pihkala, A., Helen Electricity Network Ltd, Helsinki, Finland; Hellman, H.-P., Helen Electricity Network Ltd, Helsinki, Finland; Hvvarinen, M., Helen Electricity Network Ltd, Helsinki, Finland
Abstract: The objective of the study is to develop a methodology to define the optimal operating strategy of a battery energy storage system (BESS) on the end-customer's premises that delivers him/her the maximum annual profit. The applications considered are peak shaving and frequency regulation in the FCR-N hourly market. The methodology is applied to a large group of actual end-customers with hourly measured electricity consumption. The results indicate that the operating strategy depends strongly on the shape of the end-customer's load and the reward level in both applications. Finally, the sensitivity parameters and further research needs are listed. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Zhou Y., Li Q.
Title: High-temperature and high-energy-density polymer dielectrics for capacitive energy storage
Source title: 2018 IEEE 2nd International Conference on Dielectrics, ICD 2018
Affiliations: State Kay Laboratory of Power Systems, Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhou, Y., State Kay Laboratory of Power Systems, Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China; Li, Q., State Kay Laboratory of Power Systems, Tsinghua University, Beijing, 100084, China
Abstract: High-temperature and high-energy-density polymer dielectrics for capacitive energy storage are critical in capacitors orient to harsh-environment application. The dielectric properties of poly(tetrafluoroethylene-hexafluoropropylene-vinylidene fluoride) (THV) terpolymer are investigated in a broad temperature range. It was found that the thermal stability of the THV terpolymer is significantly improved and a melting temperature of 226 °C can be achieved. Due to the higher dielectric constant of 3.6, the THV terpolymer shows 64% higher discharged energy density compared with BOPP. Its high melting temperature, low leakage current, high discharged energy density and high charge-discharge efficiency make THV potentially to be used as dielectric films for high-temperature and high-energy-density capacitive energy storage application. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Capacitors; dielectric properties; energy storage; high temperature
Index Keywords: Capacitors; Dielectric devices; Dielectric films; Dielectric properties; Fluorine compounds; Leakage currents; Melting point; Thermodynamic stability; Broad temperature ranges; Capacitive energy storage; Discharged energy densities; High energy densities; High temperature; Low-leakage current; Polymer dielectrics; Tetrafluoroethylene; Energy storage

Authors: Cheng L., Liu W., Liu X., Liu C., Li S.
Title: Morphology and energy storage properties of nano-ZrO2/Polypropylene composite
Source title: 2018 IEEE 2nd International Conference on Dielectrics, ICD 2018
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China
Authors with affiliations: Cheng, L., State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China; Liu, W., State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China; Liu, X., State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China; Liu, C., State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China; Li, S., State Key Laboratory of Electrical Insulation and Power Equipment, Xi'an Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China
Abstract: In the present study, we introduced the nano-ZrO2 into the polypropylene (PP) matrix and systematically studied its effect on the morphology and energy storage properties of the obtained nano-composites. Nano-ZrO2 showed good dispersion in PP matrix and suppressed the formation of β-crystal, modifying the microstructure and decreasing the crystallinity to a small extent. The DC breakdown test results show that both the scaled parameter and shape parameter of Weibull distribution were improved by nano-ZrO2 doping, and at the same time the dielectric constant also increased comparing with neat PP. Consequently, the energy density of nano-ZrO2/PP composites was enhanced to 1.47 J/cm3 with 0.5 wt% nano-ZrO2 doped, while the losses kept the low value same as neat PP. This work provides a promising candidate of PP nano-composites for industry practical application due to the combination of enhanced energy density and low losses. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: dielectric; energy storage; nanocomposite; polypropylene
Index Keywords: Crystal microstructure; Dielectric materials; Energy storage; Nanocomposites; Polypropylenes; Weibull distribution; Beta crystals; Breakdown tests; Crystallinities; Energy density; Energy storage properties; PP matrix; Shape parameters; Zirconia

Abstract: In the present study, we introduced the nano-ZrO2 into the polypropylene (PP) matrix and systematically studied its effect on the morphology and energy storage properties of the obtained nano-composites. Authors: Gao Q., Liu Y., Gao Y., Du B.X., Wang Q., Liu H., Ye K.
Title: Effects of Charging/Discharging Cycles on Breakdown Characteristics of Polypropylene Film
Source title: 2018 IEEE 2nd International Conference on Dielectrics, ICD 2018
Affiliations: School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Tianjin University, Tianjin, 300072, China; State Grid Beijing Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100075, China
Authors with affiliations: Gao, Q., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Tianjin University, Tianjin, 300072, China; Liu, Y., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Tianjin University, Tianjin, 300072, China; Gao, Y., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Tianjin University, Tianjin, 300072, China; Du, B.X., School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Tianjin University, Tianjin, 300072, China; Wang, Q., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100075, China; Liu, H., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100075, China; Ye, K., State Grid Beijing Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, 100075, China
Abstract: With the high-speed development of smart grid and microgrid in China, high energy density capacitor (HEDC) becomes one of the most important storage components in the electrical system, in which the dielectric reliability of polypropylene (PP) film is a critical factor affecting the operating reliability. During the lifetime of PP, it is generally known that charging/discharging cycles can increase the ageing occurrence, even the breakdown. In this paper, the charging/discharging experiments were conducted based on polarization and depolarization current method, and the breakdown experiments were constructed with different electric-field patterns and electrode spaces. After the charging/discharging experiments, the breakdown voltage and breakdown currents were measured. The images of breakdown craters were captured through applying a monocular-videozoom microscope, and then quantitatively characterized by using an image-pattern-identification technique to obtain the breakdown characteristics of PP films. The results obtained show that both charging/discharging cycles and electric-field patterns have significant influence on the breakdown characteristics of PP films. With increasing the electrode space and uniformity of electric field, the breakdown voltage, breakdown energy and breakdown degree all show the increasing tendency. While with the increase in the charging/discharging cycles, the breakdown voltage, breakdown energy and breakdown degree show the decreasing tendency. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Breakdown characteristics; Charging/discharging cycles; Electrical ageing; Polypropylene film
Index Keywords: Depolarization; Dielectric materials; Electric breakdown; Electric power transmission networks; Electrodes; Metallic films; Plasma theory; Plastic films; Polypropylenes; Breakdown characteristics; Charging/discharging; Dielectric reliability; Electric field patterns; Electrical ageing; High energy density capacitors; Polarization and depolarization currents; Poly-propylene film; Smart power grids

Authors: Arif S., Aziz T.
Title: Study of Frequency Response with Centralized vs. Distributed Placement of Battery Energy Storage Systems in Renewable Integrated Microgrid
Source title: WIECON-ECE 2017 - IEEE International WIE Conference on Electrical and Computer Engineering 2017
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Electronic Engineering, Ahsanullah University of Science Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Arif, S., Department of Electrical Electronic Engineering, Ahsanullah University of Science Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh, Bangladesh; Aziz, T., Department of Electrical Electronic Engineering, Ahsanullah University of Science Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh, Bangladesh
Abstract: Due to a number of benefits, share of renewable energy based generation is increasing rapidly. However, intermittent behavior of renewable energy is challenging to keep the frequency stable; specially in isolated microgrids. Deploying battery energy storage system (BESS) in microgrid could be helpful to lessen such frequency excursion problems. This paper investigates the effect of various placement strategies of BESS in an isolated renewable integrated microgrid. BESS has been placed in centralized as well as in distributed manner throughout the test microgrid. Results show that, in comparison to centralized placement, distributed placement of BESS offers better frequency response with events such as large load connection. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: distributed generation; energy storage system; frequency response; microgrid
Index Keywords: Distributed power generation; Electric batteries; Frequency response; Renewable energy resources; Battery energy storage system (BESS); Battery energy storage systems; Energy storage systems; Frequency excursion; Intermittent behaviors; Isolated microgrids; Micro grid; Renewable energy based generations; Battery storage

Authors: Arif S., Aziz T.
Title: Study of Transient Stability with Battery Energy Storage Systems in Renewable Integrated Islanded Microgrid
Source title: WIECON-ECE 2017 - IEEE International WIE Conference on Electrical and Computer Engineering 2017
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Electronic Engineering, Ahsanullah University of Science Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Arif, S., Department of Electrical Electronic Engineering, Ahsanullah University of Science Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh, Bangladesh; Aziz, T., Department of Electrical Electronic Engineering, Ahsanullah University of Science Technology, Dhaka, Bangladesh, Bangladesh
Abstract: The microgrid has become praise worthy concept due to a number of advantages. It can meet the increasing demand as well as can be a better solution for environmental pollution because of its renewable sources. A microgrid has to maintain voltage and frequency regulation in grid connected as well as in islanded mode. One of the challenges in islanded operation is transient stability. Battery energy storage system (BESS) is part and parcel of a renewable integrated microgrid. Impact of BESS on transient stability has been investigated in this study with IEEE 43 bus industrial test system. Results show that centralized placement offers improved transient stability than the distributed placement of BESS in microgrid. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: critical clearing time; distributed generation; energy storage system; microgrid; transient stability
Index Keywords: Distributed power generation; Electric batteries; Stability; System stability; Transients; Battery energy storage system (BESS); Battery energy storage systems; Critical clearing time; Energy storage systems; Environmental pollutions; Frequency regulations; Islanded operation; Micro grid; Battery storage

Authors: Vo T., Nguyen P.
Title: Energy Flexibility from Prosumers and BESS Coordination to Support Distribution Network Operation
Source title: International Conference on Innovative Smart Grid Technologies, ISGT Asia 2018
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Technology Eindhoven (TU/e), Eindhoven, 5600MB, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Vo, T., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Technology Eindhoven (TU/e), Eindhoven, 5600MB, Netherlands; Nguyen, P., Department of Electrical Engineering, University of Technology Eindhoven (TU/e), Eindhoven, 5600MB, Netherlands
Abstract: With the new Dutch regulation on banning the newly-built petrol vehicles by 2030, urban areas are predicted in the short-term local congestion situation dues to the high penetration level of electric vehicles. These vehicles with fast charging technologies require a high electric demand over some hours to charge their batteries. In order to provide a feasible solution at the utility level to that problem, large-scale battery energy storage systems (BESS) are considered as vital means to provide flexibility and effectively support the local networks. However, the capital cost of the BESS is still a main concern leading to a cost-effective operation schedule is required to ensure the desirable power quality while the lifetime of BESS is extended. This paper investigates the solutions to the power congestion problem and under-voltage issue of a Dutch medium voltage network around the Amsterdam Arena stadium once the penetration of electric vehicles keeps increasing in the years to come. The coordination scheme among BESS is then proposed to ensure the maximum life span of BESS. The numerical results from this work confirm the feasibility and effectiveness of the large-scale BESS in modern distribution networks and suggest the potential benefit that the stadium owner could gain when their BESS system supports the local network. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Amsterdam Arena stadium; BESS coordination; congestion management; electric vehicle; energy flexibility
Index Keywords: Charging (batteries); Cost effectiveness; Data storage equipment; Electric power distribution; Electric power transmission networks; Electric vehicles; Recreation centers; Secondary batteries; Smart power grids; Stadiums; Amsterdam; Battery energy storage system (BESS); BESS coordination; Congestion management; Coordination scheme; Distribution network operation; Energy flexibility; Medium voltage networks; Traffic congestion

Authors: Yang Z., Liao Q., Liu D., Lin G., Peng S., Xu Y.
Title: Emergency Ancillary Service Provided by Electric Vehicles for Building Integrated Energy System under the Malfunction of Energy Supply
Source title: International Conference on Innovative Smart Grid Technologies, ISGT Asia 2018
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering Wuhan University, Wuhan, China
Authors with affiliations: Yang, Z., School of Electrical Engineering Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Liao, Q., School of Electrical Engineering Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Liu, D., School of Electrical Engineering Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Lin, G., School of Electrical Engineering Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Peng, S., School of Electrical Engineering Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Xu, Y., School of Electrical Engineering Wuhan University, Wuhan, China
Abstract: Building integrated energy system (BIES) is coupled with multiple energy carriers and connected with electric vehicles (EVs), having a higher efficiency and reliability of operation. Considering the features of reducible loads and mobile energy storage devices of EVs, it's possible that EVs provide emergency ancillary service when the energy supply of BIES is malfunctioned. In this paper, the framework of BIES is firstly established and modeled. For the sake of exploiting EVs to provide emergency ancillary service for the building, an optimization dispatching model of BIES under different kinds of malfunctioning scenarios of energy supply is set up, aiming at minimizing the cost of building operation. Meanwhile, the curtailment of load demands and battery discharge of EVs can be subsidized. Through the simulation and analysis of the proposed model, the results of case study demonstrate that EV emergency ancillary service can reduce charging loads and provide reserve capacity to BIES when the energy carriers are malfunctioned. The building can maintain supply of heat and electricity without increasing the investment of backup generators and energy storage devices. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: Microgrid is an effective approach to accommodate renewable energy. This paper analyzes the operating principle of Hybrid Energy Storage System (HESS) and proposes a method to manage the power among generators, loads and HESS based on the PI controller. Finally, it shows the simulation system of DC coupled hybrid microgrid, and test it by changing the load demand and output power of distributed generator to observe the work process of HESS. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Manditereza P.T., Bansal R.C.
Title: Introducing A New Type of Protection Zone for the Smart Grid Incorporating Distributed Generation
Source title: International Conference on Innovative Smart Grid Technologies, ISGT Asia 2018
Affiliations: Dept. of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Central University of Technology, Free State, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Manditereza, P.T., Dept. of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Central University of Technology, Free State, South Africa; Bansal, R.C., Dept. of Electrical, Electronic and Computer Engineering, Central University of Technology, Free State, South Africa
Abstract: One of the performance criteria of protection is selectivity which aims to minimise the area shut down following fault occurrence. Selectivity is facilitated by splitting the electrical power network into zones. Protection schemes are incorporated into each zone to provide primary protection and back-up protection for external faults. The integration of distributed generators is contributing to the transformation of the power grid to a distributed architecture that incorporates hybrid microgrids and energy storage systems. This transformation impacts the sensitivity, stability and speed of the existing protection schemes leading to possible loss of selectivity, especially at the distribution level. This paper proposes a new type of protection zone, the Busbar Area Protection (BAP) zone that extends to include a busbar and all feeders fed from that busbar. The BAP zone facilitates protection that is able to eliminate the impact of DG integration on selectivity, while significantly reducing the protection component count at a busbar to only one primary relay irrespective of the number of feeders terminating at that node, in contrast to most other protection relaying systems that require at least one relay dedicated to each feeder. The protection operates under smart grid environment with intelligent electronic devices (IEDs) exchanging voltage measurements using peer-to-peer communications. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: distributed control; multi-agent systems; power network modelling; Protection zones

Title: Solutions for Remote Island Microgrids : Discussion and analysis of Indonesia's remote island energy system
Source title: International Conference on Innovative Smart Grid Technologies, ISGT Asia 2018

Abstract: Energy poverty is widespread in island countries, especially for the low-income countries. It is around 70% households in the Pacific island countries do not have access to electricity. With the fast development of renewable technologies, feasible and cost-efficient microgrid solutions are expected to mitigate this issue. This paper uses Indonesia as an example to investigate, develop and evaluate the potential microgrid solutions for the remote islands. There are six potential microgrid solutions are discussed, and two solutions (photovoltaic cells and storage; diesel generator, photovoltaic cells, and battery) are evaluated and identified as the most feasible, cheapest, and green solutions for the remote island microgrids. © 2018 IEEE.

Title: Determination of Optimal Capacity of Battery Energy Storage System for Large-Scale Wind Farm Integration Considering Peaking Demand
Source title: International Conference on Innovative Smart Grid Technologies, ISGT Asia 2018

Abstract: Energy storage systems (ESS) for wind farm can be used to ease the peaking burden of conventional units tracking with wind power through charging/discharging wind power, which makes it possible for the fluctuant wind power adapting deterministic scheduling. This paper proposes a method to optimize the capacity of a BESS for wind farms considering peaking demand, and also the economics of the BESS as well as its adaptability to the dispatching decision is taken into account. The constraints of peak power demand are given, and based on an optimal wind power output value adapting to the presupposed dispatching plan, a comprehensive cost-benefit model is built. In light of the actual wind power data, the effectiveness of the proposed optimization method is verified by use of simulations. The demonstrated results enable to provide a good reference for the capacity design of the BESS with the coordination of the power dispatching. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: In this paper, a day-ahead wind-solar-hydro-thermal coordinating optimal dispatch with pumped-storage hydropower integration is analyzed in order to make full utilization of renewable energy and reduce the energy consumption of thermal power. A chance constrained programming method is used to tackle the uncertainties of wind and solar power. A mathematical model of cascade hydropower system with pumped storage is proposed. A day-ahead wind-solar-hydro-thermal optimal scheduling model considering pumped-storage hydropower integration is established to utilize the regulation capacity of pumped-storage and reduce the fuel cost. The coordinating optimal dispatch model is solved by a improved heuristic algorithm according to decomposition theory. The proposed model and method is tested in numerical simulation. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: the development of multi-energy interconnection system has attracts intense attention recently due to its high efficient and environmental-friendly features. Power to Gas (PTG) technologies play an important role in the multi-energy interconnection system because of its energy storage and fast energy conversation abilities. This work explores PTG's revenue-obtaining possibilities in the market environment with daily fluctuations of both electricity price and nature gas price. The Coordinated operation with natural gas-fired plant (NGFP) and the participation in the regulation market is also considered to improve their overall profits. Finally, the simulation results demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed model and provide a viable scheme for the large-scale practical application of PTG technologies. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: In this paper, an energy consumption monitoring platform for the college compus has been developed. The implemented platform can realize the distributed monitoring and centralized control & management for the real-time energy and water consumption data for four-level measurement. It can provide data analysis, data storage, information remote transmission and intuitive display to the administrative control center and personnel. Furthermore, it can realize the water metering balance and appropriate public air-conditioner energy adjusting consumption. The water and electricity consumption of the student dormitories and office buildings can be monitored, remotely measured and intelligently paid, possessing the antitheft function. Besides, the specific energy APPs are also developed to control the terminals remotely via the mobile phone. The designed energy monitoring system has been implemented in the compus successfully. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: In the field of power electronics converters constitute a major portion of studies and practical applications. Converter can be divided in mainly four types. (I) DC-DC (II) DCAC (III) AC-DC (IV) AC-AC. Amongst them DC-DC converter is the only converter that can be used for both harvesting energy and in consumption as well as storage with minimal losses. A DC converter may have a single or multi input and output. A Multi Input Multi Output (MIMO) converter has many advantages over a Single Input Single Output (SISO), Single Input Multi Output (SIMO) and Multi Input Single Output (MISO) converters. A MIMO converter is allowing for users to have input from various sources and thus utilizing them in different types of loads. Typically such converter helps in integrating many sources which directly generate DC power. This research is the building block to solve the problem of load diversity in the DC system. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: 4K ultra high definition (HD) technology has been the focus of television production in recent years. Increasing TV stations and TV operators enter the 4K TV program production. In 2014, the world of 4K HD broadcast live opened up when Brazil hosted the World Cup 4K broadcast. The 2016 graduation ceremony of Communication University of China with 4K live was a new challenge and attempt of 4K broadcast in China. Based on this 4K broadcast, this paper introduces the application of 4K broadcast signal recording, material transferring, material backup storage and related products, which will allow audience to have further understanding on 4K broadcast signal recording and video material storage. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Ouyang T., Cao Y.
Title: Research and Optimization of Massive Music Data Access Based on HDFS
Source title: Proceedings - 17th IEEE/ACIS International Conference on Computer and Information Science, ICIS 2018
Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Communication University of China, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Ouyang, T., School of Computer Science, Communication University of China, Beijing, China; Cao, Y., School of Computer Science, Communication University of China, Beijing, China
Abstract: To build a storage management platform for music big data, we need to collect massive heterogeneous music resources from the Internet and store them on big data platforms. Therefore, it is a key problem to build a storage management system that is high performance, extensible, scalable and capable of supporting big data. Building big data platform based on HDFS is a feasible scheme. However, HDFS has good performance for accessing large files, but it is very inefficient for small files such as music source files and music metadata. In view of this, this paper proposes a geared to the needs of mass music based on HDFS small file access optimization scheme, using the format of the music data classification, build multistage merger queue, merging small files into large files in order to reduce the number of files, and create an indexing mechanism to access small files. The index file is then stored in the Phoenix + HBase storage repository and associated with the music metadata to improve the reading efficiency of music small files and music metadata. The experimental test verifies the effectiveness of the optimized scheme and meets the demand of music big data storage management platform. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Jahid A., Hossain S.
Title: Intelligent Energy Cooperation Framework for Green Cellular Base Stations
Source title: International Conference on Computer, Communication, Chemical, Material and Electronic Engineering, IC4ME2 2018
Affiliations: Department of Electrical, MIST, Dhaka, 1216, Bangladesh
Authors with affiliations: Jahid, A., Department of Electrical, MIST, Dhaka, 1216, Bangladesh; Hossain, S., Department of Electrical, MIST, Dhaka, 1216, Bangladesh
Abstract: Cellular operators are increasingly deploying a clean renewable energy (RE) resource like solar with zero carbon emission as an alternative using conventional electricity in order to maintain profitability. Owing to the dynamics of RE generation, green energy may not guarantee sufficient power supplies for base stations (BSs). To enhance sustainable network operations, we envision future BSs to be powered by hybrid supplies including commercial grid supply or diesel generators (DG) in conjunction with the solar array. This paper focuses a hybrid energy sharing framework among RE powered BSs via physical power lines. Under the proposed framework, each BS is equipped with onsite green energy harvester having an independent storage device and the BSs share excess electricity through resistive power cables to reduce dependency on the traditional energy supply. An extensive simulation-based study in the downlink of a long term evolution (LTE) cellular system is carried out for evaluating the benefits of energy cooperation, eco-sustainability and cost-effectiveness of the proposed framework. The prime objective is the energy optimization in such networks by maximizing solar energy utilization considering the temporal dynamics of traffic intensity and RE generation. Results show that considerable reduction in average energy consumption is attained through energy sharing scheme. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy cooperation; Energy harvesting; Green cellular networks; Hybrid supplies; Sustainability

Authors: Kuyumani M., Joseph M.K., Hassan S.
Title: Communication Technologies for Efficient Energy Management in Smart Grid
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Advances in Big Data, Computing and Data Communication Systems, icABCD 2018
Affiliations: University of Johannesburg, Johannesburg, South Africa; Walter Sisulu University, Eastern Cape, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Kuyumani, M., University of Johannesburg, Johannesburg, South Africa; Joseph, M.K., University of Johannesburg, Johannesburg, South Africa; Hassan, S., Walter Sisulu University, Eastern Cape, South Africa
Abstract: The existing radial topology makes the power system less reliable since any part in the system failure will disrupt electrical power delivery in the network. The increasing security concerns, electrical energy theft, and present advancement in Information and Communication Technologies are some factors that led to modernization of power system. In a smart grid, a network of smart sensors offers numerous opportunities that may include monitoring of power, consumer-side energy management, synchronization of dispersed power storage, and integrating sources of renewable energy. Smart sensor networks are low cost and are ease to deploy hence they are favorable contestants for deployment smart power grids at a larger scale. These networks will result in a colossal volume of dissimilar range of data that require an efficient processing and analyzing process in order to realize an efficient smart grid. The existing technology can be used to collect data but dealing with the collected information proficiently as well as mining valuable material out of it remains challenging. The paper investigates communication technologies that maybe deployed in a smart grid. In this paper simulations results for the Additive White Gaussian Noise (AWGN) channel are illustrated. We propose a model and a communication network domain riding on the power system domain. The model was interrogated by simulation in MATLAB. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: demand-side energy management; Information and Communication Technology; smart grid; smart senor network

Authors: Li S.
Title: Application of blockchain technology in smart city infrastructure
Source title: Proceedings - 2018 IEEE International Conference on Smart Internet of Things, SmartIoT 2018
Affiliations: Xi'an Eurasia University, Xian Shaanxi, 710065, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, S., Xi'an Eurasia University, Xian Shaanxi, 710065, China
Abstract: With the rapid growth of urbanization, smart city needs efficient and sustainable intelligent solutions in the transportation, environment, energy, government affairs. The smart city infrastructure, which combines the IoT, Big Data and Energy Internet, is one of the most effective solutions. It's facing many problems such as poor security of IoT, equipment maintenance and upgrade difficulty, high operating costs of large data center construction, poor resistance to damage, the difficulty of establishing the energy Internet users trust, user privacy is easy to leak, market model is not applicable and so on. The Blockchain is a kind of distributed P2P network common intelligence accounting technology based on cryptography. The features of open, transparent, interconnection and peer-to-peer, storage and sharing in the Blockchain are relevant to the openness, interconnection, peer-to-peer and Shared characteristics of the energy Internet. Its features of redundant storage and distribution also make up for the disadvantages of large data center's high operation cost, poor recovery ability and the difficulties for the maintenance of IoT equipment. This paper, first introduces the role of the big data, IoT, and the energy Internet in the construction of smart city and Blockchain technology. By analyzing their respective characteristics and comparing their similarities, corresponding solutions are put forward to aim at the problems such as poor security of IoT, upgrading of equipment maintenance and upgrading, construction and operation cost of large data center, poor flexibility in anti-attack, difficulty in establishing trust in energy Internet users, user privacy leakage and inapplicability of trading market mode. A kind of architecture of P2P light-heavy backup is put forward to overcome the high cost of Blockchain data storage. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Big data; Blockchain; Energy internet; Internet of things; Smart city
Index Keywords: Blockchain; Commerce; Construction equipment; Costs; Data privacy; Digital storage; Internet of things; Maintenance; Operating costs; Peer to peer networks; Smart city; Corresponding solutions; Effective solution; Energy internet; Equipment maintenance; Government affairs; Intelligent solutions; Operation cost; Technology-based; Big data

Authors: Xia W., Yin Y., Xing J., Zhang N., Xu Z.
Title: An Ag Decorated P(VDF-CTFE)/BT@HBP@PDA Nanocomposites with Double-Shell Core Structure for High Dielectric Performance
Source title: 2018 IEEE ISAF-FMA-AMF-AMEC-PFM Joint Conference, IFAAP 2018
Affiliations: Faculty of Printing Packaging, Digital Media Technology, Xi'An University of Technology, Xi'an, China; Electronic Materials Research Laboratory, Key Laboratory of the Ministry of Education, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China
Authors with affiliations: Xia, W., Faculty of Printing Packaging, Digital Media Technology, Xi'An University of Technology, Xi'an, China; Yin, Y., Faculty of Printing Packaging, Digital Media Technology, Xi'An University of Technology, Xi'an, China; Xing, J., Faculty of Printing Packaging, Digital Media Technology, Xi'An University of Technology, Xi'an, China; Zhang, N., Faculty of Printing Packaging, Digital Media Technology, Xi'An University of Technology, Xi'an, China; Xu, Z., Electronic Materials Research Laboratory, Key Laboratory of the Ministry of Education, Xi'An Jiaotong University, Xi'an, China
Abstract: A core-shell inorganic/polymer materials with abundant compositions and multiple shapes have attracted many attentions recently for their harmonious interfacial compatibility, high dielectric performance, and thereby the prospect of applications in energy storage devices. In this work, for improving the interfacial compatibility of in organiclpolymer nanocomposites, the BaTiO3 (BT) nano-powders are coated successively by using double shell polyamide (HBP) and dopamine (PDA) that is decorated with nanoscale Ag particles. In addition, a P(VDF-CTFE) with high breakdown electric field and proper dielectric permittivity are selected as the polymer matrix, and the flexible 0-3 nanocomposite of Ag decorated P(VDF-CTFE)/BT@HBP@PDA films with 20μm in thickness are obtained through spin-casting method. The morphologies from FESEM show that the interface between BaTiO3 and P(VDF-CTFE) has been improved significantly and BaTiO3 is homogeneous dispersion in the polymer matrix. Consequently, the multicomponent nanocomposites possess the large dielectric permittivity (ϵr40) and a low dielectric loss tangent (0.1 Hz) since the ionic polarization of BaTiO3 and the penetration effect of electrons. The result provides an effective way of interfacial improving that through various mutual promoting mediums to achieve high dielectric performance composite materials for their potential applications in energy storage areas. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: BaTiO3; Dielectric; Double-shell core; P(VDF-CTFE)

Title: A Novel Capacitor Sizing Method for Active DC Link Capacitance Reduction Circuit
Source title: 2018 IEEE 19th Workshop on Control and Modeling for Power Electronics, COMPEL 2018
Affiliations: Electrical and Computer Engineering, Ben Gurion University, Beer Sheva, Israel; Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Ariel University Samaria, Israel

Abstract: The paper focuses on a novel capacitor sizing method for direct voltage regulated active capacitance reduction circuit. The aim of such a system is replacing the bulk DC bus capacitor without escalating the ripple. But the reduced capacitance implies a reduction on the storage energy, causing a large voltage drop during transients. The primary goal of the proposed method is to find the appropriate capacitor size to keep the voltage of the reduction circuit above a preset minimum voltage, even during transients. Mathematical analyses of the minimum capacitor voltage as well as the required capacitor size expression are presented. The revealed findings are fully supported by simulations and experimental results. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Hu S., Li G., Liang Z., He X.
Title: Modeling and Enhancement for the Current Dynamic Regulation in Energy Stored Quasi-Z-Source Inverter System
Source title: 2018 IEEE 19th Workshop on Control and Modeling for Power Electronics, COMPEL 2018
Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Hu, S., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Li, G., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Liang, Z., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; He, X., College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China
Abstract: Energy stored quasi-Z-source inverter (qZSI) combines the advantages of qZSI and energy storage technology. The energy storage units (like battery or ultra-capacitor) are utilized to reduce the power fluctuation in the PV and fuel cells systems based on the qZSI topology. This paper focuses on the theoretical analysis of the dynamic regulation for the embedded energy storage units. By modeling with the battery and corresponding eigenvalues analysis, the low damping ratio issue related with the battery internal resistance is found to be the key obstacle for the dynamic process improvement. The resulted bandwidth limitation on the conventional PI type current controller is explored mathematically. An enhancement based on the active damping technique is then proposed. The bandwidth gets extended and better dynamic performances are achieved. The theory and design method are verified by the simulations and experiments. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: For battery energy storage system (BESS), accurate state-of-health (SOH) testing is critical for determining which battery should be replaced and it is also the foundation for battery SOH balancing, fault prevention and maintenance, especially when using retired batteries from electric vehicle. However, the traditional SOH testing method requires the BESS to quit operation and takes a long time, which results in profit loss. The modular multilevel converter (MMC) can improve this situation to some extent, but the battery pack still needs to be disassembled and redundant sub-modules are needed. In order to obtain the real-time SOH and keep the BESS still be able to work at the same time without battery disassembling, this paper further proposes an online SOH testing method for MMC-BESS with DC-DC converter control, voltage balancing control of half-bridge and the power distributing method. Simulation and experimental results are presented to verify the validity of the proposed method. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage system (BESS); battery management system (BMS); modular multilevel converter (MMC); state-of-health (SOH)
Index Keywords: DC-DC converters; Electric inverters; Energy storage; Power control; Power electronics; Secondary batteries; Battery energy storage system (BESS); Battery energy storage systems; Battery Management Systems (BMS); Fault prevention; Modular multi-level converters; State of health; Testing method; Voltage balancing control; Battery management systems

Authors: Sabbah M., Rizk M., Al Ghouwayel A.C., Omar S.-M., Bazzal Z.E.
Title: Enhanced Throughput and Energy-Efficient MRAM-Based NB-LDPC Decoder
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Computer and Applications, ICCA 2018
Affiliations: CCE Department, School of Engineering, Lebanese International University (LIU), Beirut, Lebanon
Authors with affiliations: Sabbah, M., CCE Department, School of Engineering, Lebanese International University (LIU), Beirut, Lebanon; Rizk, M., CCE Department, School of Engineering, Lebanese International University (LIU), Beirut, Lebanon; Al Ghouwayel, A.C., CCE Department, School of Engineering, Lebanese International University (LIU), Beirut, Lebanon; Omar, S.-M., CCE Department, School of Engineering, Lebanese International University (LIU), Beirut, Lebanon; Bazzal, Z.E., CCE Department, School of Engineering, Lebanese International University (LIU), Beirut, Lebanon
Abstract: In this paper, an adaptive and efficient memorization system based on Spin-Transfer-Torque Magneto-resistive Random Access Memory (STT-MRAM) is proposed to be implemented within Non Binary-Low Density Parity Check (NB-LDPC) Decoder. Based on the available MRAM types and array dimensions, new data mapping and efficient structure of the memorization system are proposed. The power consumption of the NB-LDPC decoder with STT-MRAM is evaluated and compared to the Static Random Access Memory (SRAM)-based one. Simulation results show that the proposed memorization system offers an energy reduction that reaches 73.35% for MRAM type I and 65.15% for MRAM type II. Moreover MRAM type I increases the throughput by 21.05% and MRAM type II by 43.75% for the NB-LDPC Decoder. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Yao X.-W., Ma D.-B., Zhang M., Zhu L.-N., Han C.
Title: ECP: Error control with probing for EM-based nanonetworks powered by energy harvesting
Source title: Proceedings of the 5th ACM International Conference on Nanoscale Computing and Communication, NANOCOM 2018
Affiliations: College of Computer Science and Technology, Zhejiang University of Technology, Hangzhou, China; UM-SJTU Joint Institute, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Yao, X.-W., College of Computer Science and Technology, Zhejiang University of Technology, Hangzhou, China; Ma, D.-B., College of Computer Science and Technology, Zhejiang University of Technology, Hangzhou, China; Zhang, M., College of Computer Science and Technology, Zhejiang University of Technology, Hangzhou, China; Zhu, L.-N., College of Computer Science and Technology, Zhejiang University of Technology, Hangzhou, China; Han, C., UM-SJTU Joint Institute, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Shanghai, China
Abstract: Nanonetworks are comprised of nano-sized communication devices which can perform simple tasks such as computation, data storage and actuation at the nanoscale. However, due to the error-prone wireless links in the Terahertz band (0.1-10.0 THz) and very limited energy storage capacity in nanodevices, the efficient and effective error control protocols are necessary for nanonetworks. In this paper, firstly, a novel error control strategy with probing (ECP) mechanism for nanonetworks powered by energy harvesting is proposed. In particular, each data packet is transmitted only after the communication of one probing packet is successful. Secondly, the energy state model as well as state transition rate matrix by considering the energy harvesting-consumption process is presented based on the extended Markov chain approach. Thirdly, the impact of different packets energy consumption on state transition and the state probability distribution based on the above matrix are comprehensively investigated. Finally, analytical and numerical results are provided to evaluate the performance of the proposed ECP mechanism in terms of end-to-end successful packet delivery probability, end-to-end packet delay, achievable throughput and energy consumption. The results show that ECP mechanism improves the energy utilization and successful data packet delivery probability compared to ARQ schemes. © 2018 Association for Computing Machinery.
Author Keywords: Energy Harvesting; Error Control; Markov Chain; Nanonetworks; Probing Mechanism
Index Keywords: Chains; Digital storage; Energy utilization; Errors; Markov processes; Matrix algebra; Nanotechnology; Probability distributions; Achievable throughputs; Communication device; Data packet delivery; Error control; Error control protocols; Markov chain approaches; Nano-networks; State transition rate matrix; Energy harvesting

Authors: Lu M., Fan A., Xu J., Shan W.
Title: A Compact, Lightweight and Low-Cost 8-Bit Datapath AES Circuit for IoT Applications in 28nm CMOS
Source title: Proceedings - 17th IEEE International Conference on Trust, Security and Privacy in Computing and Communications and 12th IEEE International Conference on Big Data Science and Engineering, Trustcom/BigDataSE 2018
Affiliations: National ASIC System Engineering Research Center, Southeast University, Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Lu, M., National ASIC System Engineering Research Center, Southeast University, Nanjing, China; Fan, A., National ASIC System Engineering Research Center, Southeast University, Nanjing, China; Xu, J., National ASIC System Engineering Research Center, Southeast University, Nanjing, China; Shan, W., National ASIC System Engineering Research Center, Southeast University, Nanjing, China
Abstract: Lightweight AES encryption circuits are significant to IoT applications to protect data, where very strict area and power constraints are required. In this paper, we propose a novel 8-bit datapath AES architecture aiming for a small area and a high energy efficiency. Firstly, our proposed design reduces the number of temporary data storage (IntermediateReg) to 40-bit from the originally 128-bit, which saves 68.75% intermediate registers. Secondly, only one S-Box is implemented in the design that is reused throughout the whole AES operations to achieve a low area. Thirdly, the architecture is further optimized to reduce the number of clock cycles by reusing S-Box in the key expansion and the data encryption module, leading to only 213 total cycles of latency in a complete encryption process. Simulation results under TSMC 28nm technology show that our proposed AES circuit consumes an area of 0.0028mm2, with an energy efficiency of 667Gbps/W (equivalent to 1.50 pJ/bit) and throughput rate of 30.05Mbps at 0.5V. This design achieves a high energy efficiency per unit area of 0.278 Gbps/(W•um2). This small area, high energy efficiency and relatively high throughput AES circuit is suitable for IoT applications. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: 8-bit; AES circuit; energy efficient; IoT; lightweight; low area; low power
Index Keywords: Big data; CMOS integrated circuits; Costs; Data privacy; Digital storage; Energy efficiency; Integrated circuit design; Internet of things; Low power electronics; Timing circuits; 8-bit; Energy efficient; lightweight; Low area; Low Power; Cryptography

Authors: Korchynskii V., Kildishev V., Golev D.
Title: Increase of transmission security based on timer signal construction
Source title: 2018 International Conference on Information and Telecommunication Technologies and Radio Electronics, UkrMiCo 2018 - Proceeding
Affiliations: Odessa National Academy of Telecommunications Named after O.S Popov, Odessa, Ukraine
Authors with affiliations: Korchynskii, V., Odessa National Academy of Telecommunications Named after O.S Popov, Odessa, Ukraine; Kildishev, V., Odessa National Academy of Telecommunications Named after O.S Popov, Odessa, Ukraine; Golev, D., Odessa National Academy of Telecommunications Named after O.S Popov, Odessa, Ukraine
Abstract: Protecting information from unauthorized access is an important task that is entrusted to modern confidential communication systems. The risk analysis breaches of confidential information justifies the necessity of its protection practically on any part track of the communication system: storage, transformation, transmission, etc.The perspective direction in the development of information security is an integrated approach, which provides data protection at various levels of the OSI model. In this paper, it is proposed for this task to use signals with a complex structure, for example timed signal structures. Feature of the timer signals is the ability to integrate both the noise-immune coding and the secrecy of signal structures. Structural secrecy of signal structures is aimed at a significant complication in the recognition of their structure, provided the means of electronic reconnaissance solve the problem of energy secrecy, i.e. The signal is detected and recorded on data carrier.The estimation of the timer coding for the synthesis of different sets allowed signal structures with given value of the minimum code distance was given. This information will allow to create algorithms for increasing structural secrecy, taking into account the corrective ability of the timer signals. Parametric properties of timer coding for the synthesis of various sets signal structures differing in the structure of their construction are investigated. The comparative analysis of methods for constructing time-domain signals using the quality equation and a complete search was carried out.The relationship of structural secrecy and corrective ability of timed signal structures is analyzed with account the parameters of their construction. The quantitative and qualitative analysis of the synthesized sets of timer signals for estimation potential possibilities of structural secrecy with control over the accuracy of the transmitted data is provided. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Information protection; Noise-immune coding; Secrecy; Threat; Timer signal construction; Unauthorized access
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Metadata; Quality control; Risk analysis; Risk assessment; Security of data; Structural analysis; Time domain analysis; Timing circuits; Comparative analysis; Confidential communications; Confidential information; Electronic reconnaissance; Integrated approach; Quantitative and qualitative analysis; Transmission security; Unauthorized access; Data communication systems

Authors: Jinghua Z., Shijie W., Zheng Y., Haidong Z.
Title: Energy Storage Converter Control Strategy Based on Micro-Grid System Research
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Computers, Signals and Systems Conference, ICOMSSC 2018

Authors with affiliations: Jinghua, Z., North China University of Technology, Beijing, China; Shijie, W., North China University of Technology, Beijing, China; Zheng, Y., North China University of Technology, Beijing, China; Haidong, Z., North China University of Technology, Beijing, China
Abstract: This paper introduces the control strategy of energy storage converter in different operation modes of micro-grid system. Firstly, the energy storage converter is modeled, studied in parallel mode energy storage battery charging and discharging control strategy in dc side and ac PQ control strategy, the V/f control of energy storage converter under off-grid condition is controlled, and the overall control scheme of energy storage converter is given. Secondly, this paper presents a solution to the impact of energy storage converter in switching between different working modes. Finally, based on the Matlab/Simulink simulation model, the semi-physical real-time simulation platform based on APPSIM software has further verified the control strategy proposed in this paper. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Voronova A., Ivanenko I.
Title: Synthesis methods and modern direction in modification of nickel cobaltite and composite nanoparticles with its participation
Source title: Proceedings of the 2018 IEEE 8th International Conference on Nanomaterials: Applications and Properties, NAP 2018
Affiliations: Department of Inorganic Substances Technology, Water Treatment and General Chemical Engineering, National Technical University of Ukraine, Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, 4 Building, 37 Peremohy ave., Kyiv, 03056, Ukraine
Authors with affiliations: Voronova, A., Department of Inorganic Substances Technology, Water Treatment and General Chemical Engineering, National Technical University of Ukraine, Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, 4 Building, 37 Peremohy ave., Kyiv, 03056, Ukraine; Ivanenko, I., Department of Inorganic Substances Technology, Water Treatment and General Chemical Engineering, National Technical University of Ukraine, Igor Sikorsky Kyiv Polytechnic Institute, 4 Building, 37 Peremohy ave., Kyiv, 03056, Ukraine
Abstract: This paper presents an exhaustive review on the methods of synthesis, properties and modification of Ni, Co-spinels. Among many kinds of catalytic materials and composites with its participation, Ni, Co-spinel attracted great interest, especially as electrode material for electrochemical energy storage/conversion systems, due to its higher theoretical specific capacity than conventional graphite. The main advantages of nickel cobalt spinel and composite materials with its participation are high electrical resistivity and electron conductivity, high rate capability, thermodynamic stability and durability. Peculiarities of the crystal structure of spinels cause such properties. Ni, Co-spinels refer to single-phase triple oxides of the inverse spinel type with two different metal cations. Inverse spinels have considerable electrical conductivity due to the possibility of electron exchange between divalent and trivalent ions in the octahedral position. Due to the presence of such structural features, inverse spinels can be successfully used as electrocatalysts in energy storage/conversion systems. Synthesis approaches of Ni, Co-spinel and composites with its participation include hydrothermal method, microwave synthesis, coprecipitation method, dry synthesis technique and sol-gel method. Establishing a connection between methods and conditions of synthesis, as well as a comprehensive understanding of the methods used to modification the obtained samples, is an important scientific and practical task and an urgent topic for further research in this field. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Co-spinels; Composites; Energy storage/conversion system; Modification; Ni; Synthesis
