Authors: Shuo Y., Hongkun B., Jiangbo W., Meng Y., Renyuan M., Jing Y.
Title: Accommodated capacity for wind and solar power under the background of supply side reform: Model and empirical study
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: Planning Comprehensive Department, State Grid Henan Economic Research Institute, Henan, China; State Grid Sanmenxia Power Supply Company, Henan, China
Authors with affiliations: Shuo, Y., Planning Comprehensive Department, State Grid Henan Economic Research Institute, Henan, China; Hongkun, B., Planning Comprehensive Department, State Grid Henan Economic Research Institute, Henan, China; Jiangbo, W., Planning Comprehensive Department, State Grid Henan Economic Research Institute, Henan, China; Meng, Y., Planning Comprehensive Department, State Grid Henan Economic Research Institute, Henan, China; Renyuan, M., Planning Comprehensive Department, State Grid Henan Economic Research Institute, Henan, China; Jing, Y., State Grid Sanmenxia Power Supply Company, Henan, China
Abstract: In order to adapt and lead the new norm of economic development, the structural reform of the supply side is a major strategic step in the face of the new situation of economic development both at home and abroad. The development of wind power, solar energy and other clean energy is the right direction of the energy supply side reform, and the characteristics of electricity production and consumption determine the central position of clean energy in the structural reform of the energy supply side. On the basis of summarizing the existing methods of evaluating the capacity of wind power (photovoltaic power station) consumption, this paper calculates the number of wind power (photovoltaic power station)consumption in the whole year by means of the balance of the whole cycle and the hourly power balance and the rational operation mode of pumped storage. The method calculates the change of the quantity of wind power (photovoltaic power station) consumption in the whole year in the case of different wind power(photovoltaic power station) installed capacity and determines the reasonable scale of wind power (photovoltaic power station) installed capacity, which can greatly improve the accuracy of wind power (photovoltaic power station) acceptance. Through the empirical test, it proves that this method has strong guiding significance for power grid planning and improves the consumption capacity of wind power (photovoltaic power station). © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: accommodated capacity; photovoltaic plant; supply side reform; wind power
Index Keywords: Economic and social effects; Photovoltaic cells; Solar energy; Wind power; accommodated capacity; Economic development; Electricity production; Guiding significances; PhotoVoltaic plant; Photovoltaic power stations; Supply sides; Wind and solar power; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Daopin C., Bangfa C., Jing H., Anqi S.
Title: Microgrid operation control technology based on lithium-ion capacitor
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: Guangdong Grid Coroporation Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, China
Authors with affiliations: Daopin, C., Guangdong Grid Coroporation Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, China; Bangfa, C., Guangdong Grid Coroporation Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, China; Jing, H., Guangdong Grid Coroporation Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, China; Anqi, S., Guangdong Grid Coroporation Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, China
Abstract: For microgrid with photovoltaic generation and hybrid energy storage system, if the impact load appears, the voltage and frequency fluctuation of the system will become greater due to the absence of large grid support, affecting the reliability and stability of power supply. To solve this problem, Lithium-ion capacitor with high power density characteristic is used to track and compensate the active and reactive currents of impact loads. In addition, model current predictive control method is applied to the control of Lithium Ion capacitor inverter. Through the simulation analysis, the voltage and frequency of system can fluctuate within permitted range after the hybrid energy storage tracked and compensated impact loads, which greatly ensures the system's transient stable operation. The experimental platform of distributed hybrid energy storage is constructed to verify the effectiveness of the model current predictive control method. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: impact load; lithium-Ion capacitor; microgrid; model current predictive control
Index Keywords: Energy storage; Ions; Lithium; Model predictive control; Predictive control systems; Hybrid energy storage systems; Impact loads; Lithium-ion capacitors; Micro grid; Photovoltaic generation; Predictive control; Predictive control methods; Reliability and stability; Supercapacitor

Authors: Yuan B., Wu S., Zong J.
Title: Multi-area generation expansion planning model of high variable generation penetration
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; State Grid Jibei Electric Power Company Limited, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Yuan, B., State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wu, S., State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Zong, J., State Grid Jibei Electric Power Company Limited, Beijing, China
Abstract: Generation expansion planning is the essential premise for the safe and sustainable development of power system, especially at a high variable generation (VG) penetration scenario. An accurate and efficient generation expansion planning model can be of great help to policy decision. In most existing generation expansion model, the capacity of VG such as wind power and solar power are treated as preset boundaries instead of decision variables, which may lead to over construction of flexible resources and energy storage, or even excessive VG curtailment. Moreover, the transmission among areas should be properly modelled to better accommodate VG in multiple areas. This paper presented a multi-area co-optimize generation expansion planning model of variable generation and conventional generation. In the proposed model, VG is considered as decision variable and their uncertain nature is reflected in capacity value (CV). Transmissions among areas and its impact on VG accommodation are also taken into account and analyzed. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: capacity value; co-optimization; component; generation expansion planning; transmission; variable generation
Index Keywords: Decision making; Solar energy; Transmissions; Wind power; Capacity value; Co-optimization; component; Generation expansion planning; Variable generations; Expansion

Authors: [No author name available]
Title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Abstract: The proceedings contain 181 papers. The topics discussed include: research on the strategy of voltage sag comprehensive management based on supply and demand coordination; design and analysis of magnetic coupling resonant wireless power transfer system with class-e inverter; internal model startup control for VSC-LCC based hybrid pseudo bipolar HVDC system; equivalent three-phase short circuit calculation method based on static equivalence considering grounding branches; optimal operation of energy hub with different structures for minimal energy usage cost; electric insulator detection of UAV images based on depth learning; propagation feature of partial discharge uhf signal diffusing from GIS pouring aperture; harmonic assessments with multi-values considering the regulation effect; the rapid development of a three-phase grid-forming micro-source inverter; capacity optimization of hybrid energy storage for smoothing power fluctuations based on spectrum analysis; comparison of response surface method and Kriging method for approximation modeling; dynamic performance research on bi-stable permanent magnetic actuator applied in 40.5kV vacuum circuit breaker; impact of strong dynamic couplings between VSC-based generation units and power systems on power system electro-mechanical oscillation modes; and degradation state recognition of ultrasonic motor based upon locality preserving projection and support vector machine optimized by fruit fly optimization algorithm.

Authors: Li S., Zhang Z., Chen L., Zhang D., Huang Q.
Title: A compound control method for optimal configuration of wind/PV/storage system
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: Energy Science and Engineering School, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China
Authors with affiliations: Li, S., Energy Science and Engineering School, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; Zhang, Z., Energy Science and Engineering School, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; Chen, L., Energy Science and Engineering School, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; Zhang, D., Energy Science and Engineering School, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; Huang, Q., Energy Science and Engineering School, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China
Abstract: In the renewable energy system, aiming at the instability and strong randomness of wind and solar energy output power, a compound control method based on the energy storage ratio and the power smoothing parameters is proposed. The method can control the fluctuation amplitude within the set value by charging, discharging or running off the system. By simulating the two configurations of single and double energy storage, the compound control algorithm is used to carry out the simulation experiment, and the power smoothing effect, economic benefit and other comprehensive indexes are compared. The simulation results show that the system has better running effect under single energy storage. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Zhang Y., Dai X., Han X., Wang W., Jiang N., Zhao G.
Title: Study on renewable energy integration with electric thermal storage in demand-side - Part II: Sequential production simulation based sensitivity analysis
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; State Grid Shaanxi Electric Power Company Economic Research Institute, Xi'an, Shaanxi Province, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, Y., State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Dai, X., State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Han, X., State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wang, W., State Grid Shaanxi Electric Power Company Economic Research Institute, Xi'an, Shaanxi Province, China; Jiang, N., State Grid Shaanxi Electric Power Company Economic Research Institute, Xi'an, Shaanxi Province, China; Zhao, G., State Grid Shaanxi Electric Power Company Economic Research Institute, Xi'an, Shaanxi Province, China
Abstract: Aiming to evaluate the effect of electric thermal storage (ETS) in large-scale renewable power integration, a new method is proposed based on enhanced sequential production simulation (ESPS). In the new method, wind and photovoltaic (PV) power integration capacities are simultaneously optimized in consideration of several boundary conditions of Shaanxi power system such as power supply, network constrains and future load. Electric thermal storage is utilized as demand response resource to absorb the curtailed renewable power and improve its integration capacity. The sensitivity analysis is undertaken to demonstrate whether electric thermal storage is suitable for the chosen regional power system. Through such analysis, a reasonable renewable energy development scale and mode could be given for decision support of power system planning. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: electric thermal storage; renewable energy integration; sensitivity analysis; sequential production simulation

Authors: Ye L.-H., Peng B., Hao J.-B., Zhang Y.-J.
Title: The coordinated operation scheduling of distributed generation, demand response and storage based on the optimization energy hub for minimal energy usage costs
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: Development and Planning Department, China Southern Power Grid Company Limited, Guangzhou, China; School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Ye, L.-H., Development and Planning Department, China Southern Power Grid Company Limited, Guangzhou, China; Peng, B., Development and Planning Department, China Southern Power Grid Company Limited, Guangzhou, China; Hao, J.-B., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Zhang, Y.-J., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China
Abstract: Energy hub (EH) can optimize the input power and gas for some goals such as minimal energy usage costs without alerting the demand of users. Demand response (DR) and storage can adjust the energy from the grid during a time period to cut the expense of energy too. Nowadays, with the shortage of resources and the degradation of environment, more and more scholars all over the world began to concentrate on the research of distributed generation (DG), which can not only increase the utilization rate of renewable energy but also decrease the costs of traditional energy. This paper sets up an EH model which comprises the DG, DR and storage, in which the objective function is to minimize the costs of the input energy including electricity and gas. Six different cases are simulated in this paper to compare the importance of elements mentioned before, and the results show that the proposed model has the highest revenue. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: demand response; distributed generation; energy hub; storage
Index Keywords: Costs; Energy storage; Coordinated operation; Demand response; Electricity and gas; Energy hubs; Minimal energy usages; Objective functions; Renewable energies; Utilization rates; Distributed power generation

Authors: Fan O., Hengzhen L., Yunfei W., Sixiang C., Di D.
Title: The hybrid energy storage microgrid optimization operation considering the battery health state
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: Guangdong Grid Coroporation Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, China
Authors with affiliations: Fan, O., Guangdong Grid Coroporation Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, China; Hengzhen, L., Guangdong Grid Coroporation Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, China; Yunfei, W., Guangdong Grid Coroporation Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, China; Sixiang, C., Guangdong Grid Coroporation Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, China; Di, D., Guangdong Grid Coroporation Foshan Power Supply Bureau, Foshan, China
Abstract: To maximize the utilization of renewable energy and the battery lifetime for grid-connected hybrid energy microgrid containing photovoltaic, sodium-sulfur battery and lithium battery, a multi-objective optimization control strategy has been proposed in this paper. Considering the state of charge and lifetime of the energy storage system, the minimization of the power purchase cost of microgrid and the operation cost of energy storage devices has been chosen as the optimization target. Based on the fuzzy decision algorithm, the coordination and tradeoffs have been made between the two optimization targets. Finally, an example based on a real microgrid system validates that this method can efficiently improve the economy of microgrid and the lifetime of energy systems. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Lin L., Zhu L., Yang R., Gao Y., Wu Q.
Title: Capacity optimization of hybrid energy storage for smoothing power fluctuations based on spectrum analysis
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: State Key Laboratory of Power Transmission Equipment and System Security and New Technology, Chongqing University, Chongqing, China; Luohuang Power Plant, Huaneng Group, Chongqing, China; Huairou Power Supply Company, State Grid Corporation, Beijing, China

Abstract: Reasonable configuration of hybrid energy storage system helps to reduce the influence of power fluctuations of wind output power effectively as well as the system cost. Not only considering the charge-discharge loss of energy storage, converter loss, the limit of State of Charge(SOC), but also practical parameters of energy storage device on the market, this paper proposes the method of optimal capacity configuration of hybrid energy storage system(HESS), which is composed of sodium-sulfur battery and super-capacitor based on discrete Fourier transform(DFT). Furthermore, in order to verify the validity of capacity optimization of HESS using proposed method, the model of a wind farm with HESS is established to simulate. The results show that HESS using the proposed method for optimal capacity allocation can level the fluctuations of wind out power effectively without the phenomenon of over-charging or over-discharging in energy storage devices. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Jin X., Zhang Y., Dai X., Wang W., Jiang N., Zhao G.
Title: Study on renewable energy integration with electric thermal storage in demand-side - Part I: Analysis for output characteristics of wind farms and photovoltaic plants
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; State Grid Shaanxi Electric Power Company, Economic Research Institute, Xi'an, Shaanxi Province, China
Authors with affiliations: Jin, X., State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Zhang, Y., State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Dai, X., State Grid Energy Research Institute, Beijing, China; Wang, W., State Grid Shaanxi Electric Power Company, Economic Research Institute, Xi'an, Shaanxi Province, China; Jiang, N., State Grid Shaanxi Electric Power Company, Economic Research Institute, Xi'an, Shaanxi Province, China; Zhao, G., State Grid Shaanxi Electric Power Company, Economic Research Institute, Xi'an, Shaanxi Province, China
Abstract: High penetration of renewable energy such as wind and photovoltaic (PV) power have brought huge challenge to the safe and stable operation for regional power system. An analytical framework for output characteristics of renewable energy is proposed in this article. Based on historically measured output data, the output characteristics of the wind farms and PV plants in Shaanxi Province is comprehensively analyzed and summarized, including the yearly characteristics, daily characteristics, fluctuation characteristics, geographical dispersion and complementarity of wind and PV power. By analyzing collected output data of several wind farms and PV plants, this paper aims to deduce the whole output characteristics of renewable energy in Shaanxi. By doing this, this paper could provide certain references for further research of wind and PV power in Shaanxi, such as offering theoretical direction on operation optimization and long-term power system planning. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: Study on distributed generators optimization system in island microgrid
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: Department of IOT Engineering, Hohai University, Changzhou, China; Department of New Energy Research, NARI Group Corporation (State Grid Electric Power Research Institute), Nanjing, China
Authors with affiliations: Wu, Z., Department of IOT Engineering, Hohai University, Changzhou, China; Hu, G., Department of IOT Engineering, Hohai University, Changzhou, China; Cai, C., Department of IOT Engineering, Hohai University, Changzhou, China; Deng, H., Department of IOT Engineering, Hohai University, Changzhou, China; He, W., Department of New Energy Research, NARI Group Corporation (State Grid Electric Power Research Institute), Nanjing, China; Hua, G., Department of New Energy Research, NARI Group Corporation (State Grid Electric Power Research Institute), Nanjing, China
Abstract: The operation mode of island microgrid is a best way to solve the problem of remote island power supply. Aiming at the coordinated optimization problem of island microgrid, taking the economic and environmental cost of the island microgrid as the object functions and considering a variety of constraints, we build a multi-sources coordinated operation optimization model which contains PV, diesel, energy storage batteries and ocean energy. A software named island microgrid DG (Distributed Generators) optimization system is designed to provide important support for the economic and environmental operation of island microgrid. The system make prediction and analysis with multi-time scale based on the data of microgrid and can solve the multi-sources coordination optimization model by IPSO (improved particle swarm optimization). The results show that the optimal scheduling scheme is reasonable and feasible. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: He-Feng L., Jun L., Zhihao Y., Feng Z.
Title: Optimized operation mode of coordination between the flywheel energy storage and generators for pulsed loads in micro-grid
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jiana, 250100, China
Authors with affiliations: He-Feng, L., School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jiana, 250100, China; Jun, L., School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jiana, 250100, China; Zhihao, Y., School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jiana, 250100, China; Feng, Z., School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jiana, 250100, China
Abstract: In the application of microgrid, the pulsed load as a special load with characteristics of short time and high amplitude has many hazards to the grid but also an important part of some micro-grid. For dealing with the pulsed load, the traditional mode of operation is the indirect power supply through the flywheel energy storage as an energy medium. The pulsed load is completely isolated from the grid without electrical connection in this operation mode. So that the grid generator can not assist in energy supply. Frequent switching caused by the traditional mode can also cause the impact to the power grid stability. Correspondingly, this paper presents a new power supply operation mode, the cooperation between the flywheel energy storage and the power grid's generators, which can reduce the demand for the flywheel energy storage capacity and avoid frequent switching of grid generators. Simulation results showed that the optimized operation can run successfully. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: cooperation; microgrid; the flywheel energy storage; the pulsed load

Authors: Tianzhu C., Linong W., Bin S., Enwen L., Siliang J.
Title: A design of rural intelligent household micro-grid
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China
Authors with affiliations: Tianzhu, C., School of Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Linong, W., School of Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Bin, S., School of Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Enwen, L., School of Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China; Siliang, J., School of Electrical Engineering, Wuhan University, Wuhan, China
Abstract: Aiming at the reliability of power supply in China's rural areas and the poor quality of power, this paper designs a new household micro-id power supply system, which can widely absorb distributed energy, based on the characteristics of local distributed energy structure. Firstly, the distribution characteristics of the local renewable energy sources and load demand are accurately analyzed to determine the system structure and the capacity configuration of distributed generation. Then, analyze the spectrum of the output power of renewable energy. Based on the analysis, characteristics of energy storage unit and system constraints, determine the optimal capacity of energy storage unit. This system adopts hierarchical control mode, uses the upper scheduling control unit and a remote terminal to manage the whole system, and uses bi-directional inverter to made the micro-grid parallel in and cut smoothly. The design of the new rural household micro grid system is of great significance to the further development of micro-grid. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Fan Y., Zi X., Jun L., Bingbing L.
Title: Research on optimal load shedding for active distribution network based on genetic algorithm
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: Electric Power Research Institute, Shanghai Municipal Electrical Power Company, Shanghai, China
Authors with affiliations: Fan, Y., Electric Power Research Institute, Shanghai Municipal Electrical Power Company, Shanghai, China; Zi, X., Electric Power Research Institute, Shanghai Municipal Electrical Power Company, Shanghai, China; Jun, L., Electric Power Research Institute, Shanghai Municipal Electrical Power Company, Shanghai, China; Bingbing, L., Electric Power Research Institute, Shanghai Municipal Electrical Power Company, Shanghai, China
Abstract: This paper presents a mathematical model for active distribution network load shedding considering the number of blackouts and power shortage based on detailed classification of load after power failure. By establishing the output model of fan energy storage and adopting gray model to forecast wind speed and load, the genetic algorithm is used to solve optimal load shedding scheme considering the influence of distributed energy. The simulation results show that the gray model has better accuracy and the load calculation algorithm is more efficient, which satisfies real-time engineering requirements. Load shedding scheme become more reasonable by taking indicators like load priority, power shortage and outage frequency into account, and the weight coefficient in load shedding objective function can be adjusted to satisfy actual needs. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: active distribution network; distributed energy; genetic algorithm; gray model; load shedding
Index Keywords: Electric power plant loads; Genetic algorithms; Outages; Wind; Active distribution networks; Detailed classification; Distributed energies; Gray Model; Load shedding scheme; Load-shedding; Objective functions; Optimal load shedding; Electric load shedding

Authors: Chang X., Lei D., Zhang S., Li S., Yang Y.
Title: Novel supercapacitor model parameter identification methods
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Company, Taiyuan, Shanxi Province, 030001, China
Authors with affiliations: Chang, X., Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Company, Taiyuan, Shanxi Province, 030001, China; Lei, D., Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Company, Taiyuan, Shanxi Province, 030001, China; Zhang, S., Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Company, Taiyuan, Shanxi Province, 030001, China; Li, S., Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Company, Taiyuan, Shanxi Province, 030001, China; Yang, Y., Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Shanxi Electric Power Company, Taiyuan, Shanxi Province, 030001, China
Abstract: Supercapacitor based energy storage system has been applied in different power level applications for years. Due to its ultra-high capacitance and capacitor characteristics, it is ideal for high power short duration circumstances, such as regenerative braking in electric vehicle, transient frequency control in power grid. For all such supercapacitor applications, an accurate model of supercapacitor is essential for analysing its behaviour under various operating conditions. Many different electrical models have been proposed to improve accuracy under different conditions, such as the three branch model, ladder model, and transmission line model. The associated parameter identification methods are also important in improving model accuracy. Different models are reviewed in this paper, and its applicable conditions for each model are discussed. Two novel parameter identification methods are proposed, which provides better accuracy in describing supercapacitor discharge behaviour with a simplified experimental test. The mathematical model and experimental comparison are provided to verify the new parameter identification method. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: energy storage; parameter identification method; supercapacitor model
Index Keywords: Electric power system control; Electric power transmission networks; Energy storage; Regenerative braking; Supercapacitor; Vehicle-to-grid; Applicable conditions; Energy storage systems; Experimental comparison; Operating condition; Parameter identification methods; Super-capacitor modeling; Supercapacitor application; Transmission line modeling; Parameter estimation

Authors: Zhang Y., Yang P., Xu Z., Chen J.
Title: Smooth mode transition strategies of PV-BESS microgrids
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Guangdong Key Laboratory of Clean Energy Technology, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, Y., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Yang, P., Guangdong Key Laboratory of Clean Energy Technology, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Xu, Z., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Chen, J., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China
Abstract: The microgrid is emerging to be an approach to solve the problem of the reliable supply of electricity and the diverse demand for users. Safe and efficient strategies are required to maintain the microgrid stable when the operating mode changes. The transfer strategies consist of the transition from grid-connected mode to islanded mode and from the islanded mode to grid-connected mode. To begin with, the paper introduces the photovoltaic (PV) - battery energy storage system (BESS) microgrid system and the corresponding control methods of the microsources. Then the smooth mode transfer strategies are presented, which include transfer between islanded mode and grid-connected mode. Finally, the proposed transfer strategies are validated by the experimental results in the China Merchants Group PV-BESS microgrid in Shenzhen. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: battery energy storage system; microgrid; mode transfer strategies; photovoltaic system

Authors: Jin L., Zhang X., Cheng L., Zhong M., Li G., Kong L.
Title: Novel control strategy and modeling of air source heat pump for consuming PV power
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; College of Information Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China
Authors with affiliations: Jin, L., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Zhang, X., College of Information Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; Cheng, L., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Zhong, M., China Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China; Li, G., College of Information Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China; Kong, L., College of Information Science and Engineering, Northeastern University, Shenyang, China
Abstract: The rapid development of PV power generation has led to numerous problems of system operation and PV power consumption. As a new type of heat pump, the air source heat pump has advantages of energy saving, environment protection and good flexibility. In this paper, PV generation power during generation peak time is consumed by air source heat pumps to produce and storage heat. First, this paper establishes a basic thermophysical model of air source heat pump and analyzes the method of using air source heat pumps to consume PV generation power. Second, a control strategy for consuming PV generation power by clustering air source heat pumps with different parameters is proposed. Then, a multi-objective scheduling model of air source heat pumps is presented. Finally, NSGA-II is used to solve the multi-objective model, and the corresponding Pareto optimal solutions are obtained. The simulation results show that the model proposed in this paper can well follow the PV generation output, reduce the PV power curtailment and heating cost of users. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: air source heat pump; clustering algorithm; Multi-objective model; NSGA-II; power consumption; PV power generation

Authors: Salimath G., Singh N.K., Badge S.S.
Title: Coordination and performance analysis of pumped hydro storage system integrated with solar, wind hybrid system
Source title: 2017 International Conference on Energy, Communication, Data Analytics and Soft Computing, ICECDS 2017
Authors with affiliations: Salimath, G.; Singh, N.K.; Badge, S.S.
Abstract: Power generation and energy needs of consumers will always be uneven; there exists a mismatch between two terms. Renewable energy sources are widely and increasingly applied in the electrical power generation. Connecting these sources to the power network improves flexibility, reliability, security, efficiency and it releases substations from some constraints. With the increasing penetration of solar and wind power into electric power grid, to match the demand requirement a dynamically stable energy storage system is required which can response to the system with in less time as well as can make the overall system more stable. Energy storage can be used to mitigate the problems associated with the fluctuating output power of the Wind turbines and Solar PV arrays due to changing wind speed and solar irradiation intensity. Using renewable generation in combination with storage systems is one way to tackle voltage and frequency regulation issues. Pumped Hydro Storage Systems are more stable, help in making Grid more stable and safe from different types of disturbances. This paper deals with coordination and performance analysis of Hybrid system consists of solar, wind and Pumped Hydro Storage Systems (PHSS). © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Asynchronous Machines; Energy storage devices (ESD); Pumped Hydro Storage Systems (PHSS); Solar PV System; Wind Turbine
Index Keywords: Digital storage; Electric energy storage; Hybrid systems; Photovoltaic cells; Soft computing; Wind effects; Wind power; Wind turbines; Asynchronous machine; Electrical power generation; Energy storage devices (ESD); Energy storage systems; Frequency regulations; Hydro storage systems; Renewable energy source; Solar PV systems; Electric power transmission networks

Authors: Cordóva F., Cifuentes F., Atero R.
Title: Hilbert Huang Transform (HHT) applied to memorization of objects using the tactile sense
Source title: 2018 7th International Conference on Computers Communications and Control, ICCCC 2018 - Proceedings
Affiliations: School of Engineering, Universidad Finis Terrae, Santiago, Chile; Department of Industrial Engineering, University of Santiago de Chile, Chile
Authors with affiliations: Cordóva, F., School of Engineering, Universidad Finis Terrae, Santiago, Chile; Cifuentes, F., Department of Industrial Engineering, University of Santiago de Chile, Chile; Atero, R., School of Engineering, Universidad Finis Terrae, Santiago, Chile
Abstract: The information given by the evolution of a natural system is generally a non-linear, non-recurrent and non-stationary temporal series. Therefore, when analyzing these data with linear and stationary formalism (such as FFT) or a normative base (FFT, Wavelet), signals is introduced that are not part of the original set, and their interpretation is inadequate. So, it is necessary to introduce an adaptive and empirical formalism, which allows analyzing an non stationary and non-linear signal, breaking in sub signals of intrinsic mode (IMF) characterized by its frequency and instantaneous amplitude. The temporal analysis of the frequency is useful because in certain phenomena, the evolution of it gives valuable information on the analyzed system. In the process, the tactile perception associated with the capture of information excites the sensory synapse, activating for approx. 1-2 seconds the sensory memory (SeM) and if a level of 'sufficient attention' is exceeded, the sensory information is encoded and controlled by the working memory (WoM), activating actions of knowledge registration in the synaptic mental form, enabling the process storage of this information, in the long-term memory. In this context, this paper presents the analysis of an EEG signal through the Hilbert Huang Transform (HHT), applied to memorization of objects using the tactile sense that is, depriving the individual of vision and hearing. An empirical mode decomposition (EMD) is developed and the Hilbert spectral analysis is obtained revealing the temporal-frequency energy distribution of phenomena. As a result of this process an activity marker appears that can be associated to the wait (timeout) between the memorization of two objects corresponding to 0.2 sec. The activity marker is located in the second component of signal intrinsic mode (IMF2). When observing the instantaneous frequency, after the subject in study leaves a first object and prepares to receive the second, it is perceived that this frequency varies between 3 and 7 Hz for the channels AF3, F7, F3, FC5 of the left frontal lobe. This pattern is repeated in the right frontal lobe, but disappears more quickly. Finally, it can be concluded that Hilbert Huang Transform allows discriminating instantaneous frequencies and locating patterns not detectable by traditional systems of signal analysis. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Hilbert Huang Transform; Memorization; Tactile sense; Temporal-frequency analysis
Index Keywords: Audition; Brain; Chemical activation; Digital storage; Fast Fourier transforms; Spectrum analysis; Empirical Mode Decomposition; Hilbert Huang transforms; Hilbert spectral analysis; Instantaneous amplitude; Instantaneous frequency; Memorization; Tactile sense; Temporal frequency; Signal processing

Authors: Chai H., Leng S., Hu J., Yang K.
Title: Resources allocation in SWIPT aided fog computing networks
Source title: 2017 9th International Conference on Advanced Infocomm Technology, ICAIT 2017
Affiliations: School of Communication and Information Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China
Authors with affiliations: Chai, H., School of Communication and Information Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; Leng, S., School of Communication and Information Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; Hu, J., School of Communication and Information Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China; Yang, K., School of Communication and Information Engineering, University of Electronic Science and Technology of China, Chengdu, China
Abstract: Fog computing has emerging as a promising technique to meet the ultra-low latency services in wireless network such as Augmented Reality (AR). The fog paradigm tends to distribute computing, storage, control, network resources and services closer to terminal devices as much as possible while most of User Equipments (UEs) do not have constant power supply thus the power supplement has developed as a nontrivial challenge to realize the paradigm. In this paper, simultaneous wireless information and power transfer (SWIPT) is introduced as a power resource to guarantee the UEs complete their computing tasks. We proposed a power, time and data allocation scheme to minimize the total consumption of energy at source node while maintaining the latency requirement. A Quantum particle swarm optimization (QPSO) algorithm in introduced to solve the non-convex problem, numerical results reveal that our proposed allocation scheme consumes less energy than the conventional particle swarm optimization approach. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: augmented reality; fog computing; resource allocation; SWIPT
Index Keywords: Augmented reality; Digital storage; Energy transfer; Fog; Particle swarm optimization (PSO); Resource allocation; Consumption of energy; Distribute computing; Numerical results; Particle swarm optimization approaches; Quantum particle swarm optimization; Resources allocation; Simultaneous wireless information and power transfer (SWIPT); SWIPT; Fog computing

Authors: Ha T.-T., Zhang Y.-J., Hao J.-B., Pham T.H.A.
Title: Optimal operation of energy hub with different structures for minimal energy usage cost
Source title: 2017 2nd International Conference on Power and Renewable Energy, ICPRE 2017
Affiliations: School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Thai Nguyen University of Information and Communication Technology, Thai Nguyen, Viet Nam
Authors with affiliations: Ha, T.-T., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Zhang, Y.-J., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Hao, J.-B., School of Electric Power, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Pham, T.H.A., Thai Nguyen University of Information and Communication Technology, Thai Nguyen, Viet Nam
Abstract: Energy Hub (EH) is the transceiver of various forms of energy through a system of energy conversion, distribution and storage devices. The structure and components of the model are selected mainly based on the characteristics and needs of the load. The elements selection within the EH model has a great influence on the reliability and performance of the model. This paper performs optimization calculations for the EH model with different structures (12 operating scenarios). In particular, the operating scenarios correspond to the combination of devices in the model ranging from simple structure to complexity (taking into account the involvement of solar energy, the wind, and energy storage). The objective function for the total energy cost of the EH model within 24 hours is minimized with constraints: Energy balance, capacity limits of the system and energy storage system loading capacity, power tariffs and natural gas. The calculation program is performed by General Algebraic Modeling System (GAMS) software. The calculation results allow the user to evaluate the role and efficiency of the devices in the EH model with different structures while selecting the appropriate EH model to maximize energy saving cost. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: electricity price; energy hub; GAMS; natural price; optimal operation
Index Keywords: Electric energy storage; Energy conservation; Energy conversion; Solar energy; Virtual storage; Electricity prices; Energy hubs; GAMS; natural price; Optimal operation; Costs

Title: 2018 International Interdisciplinary PhD Workshop, IIPhDW 2018

Abstract: The proceedings contain 91 papers. The topics discussed include: introduction to car failure detection system based on diagnostic interface; a model of water thermal-hydraulics during sudden depressurization of a vessel filled with water under saturation conditions; application of visual speech synthesis in therapy of auditory verbal hallucinations; energy efficiency analysis of railway turnout heating with a simplified snow model using classical and contactless heating method; speech processing algorithm for isolated words recognition; new proposed radio system of object location; evaluation methods of frequency response analysis; convergence error exploration for electrical impedance tomography problems with open and closed domains; comparison of algorithms for hybrid nonlinear optimization problem in biological wastewater treatment plant; universal windows application for the parameters calculation of shields against ionizing radiation; high voltage line distance measurement and position detection based on stereoscopic image; frequency response modeling of power transformer windings considering the attributes of ferromagnetic core; comparison of inverse problem solutions for 2D damp wall multilayer and nonhomogenous models; analysis of the impact of temperature load on the state of stress in a bolted flange connection; improving the efficiency of liquid air energy storage by organic Rankine cycle module application; data augmentation for improving deep learning in image classification problem; combined analysis of GSR and EEG signals for emotion recognition; and localization and navigation based on radio tomographic imaging in beacon technology.

Authors: Chen M., Liu H., Qi Q., Xue J., Ye J.
Title: Comprehensive economy and technology evaluation of photovoltaic energy storage system
Source title: CIEEC 2017 - Proceedings of 2017 China International Electrical and Energy Conference
Affiliations: College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, 211100, China; China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, 210003, China
Authors with affiliations: Chen, M., College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, 211100, China; Liu, H., College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, 211100, China; Qi, Q., College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, 211100, China; Xue, J., China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, 210003, China; Ye, J., China Electric Power Research Institute, Nanjing, 210003, China
Abstract: As energy shortages and pollution problems become more severe, as well as the increasing demand from users, conventional energy has shown a lot of shortcomings. The introduction of photovoltaic-energy storage system (PESS) can effectively take advantage of renewable photovoltaic power system, guarantee power quality and reduce environmental pollution. In this paper, the comprehensive economy and technology evaluation index system and evaluation method of PESS are studied. Firstly, the comprehensive evaluation index system of PESS was constructed from the aspects of economy, the reliability of power supply, the friendliness of the source and network, and the environmental benefits. Secondly, based on DEMATEL-ANP-Anti-Entropy and the improved grey correlation method, the weight of each assessment factor is determined; then the evaluation function of the index system of PESS can be formulated based on polynomial interpolation method; finally, the PESS which actually operates in a commercial park is comprehensively evaluated, the results of the study verify the feasibility and validity of the proposed index system and evaluation methods. © 2017 IEEE.
Index Keywords: Electric power systems; Photovoltaic cells; Pollution; Comprehensive evaluation index system; Environmental benefits; Environmental pollutions; Grey correlation methods; Photovoltaic power systems; Polynomial interpolation; Reliability of power supply; Technology evaluation; Energy storage

Authors: Feng W., Han Z.
Title: Optimal configuration of energy storage for distributed photovoltaic generation
Source title: CIEEC 2017 - Proceedings of 2017 China International Electrical and Energy Conference
Affiliations: College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, 210098, China
Authors with affiliations: Feng, W., College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, 210098, China; Han, Z., College of Energy and Electrical Engineering, Hohai University, Nanjing, 210098, China
Abstract: The photovoltaic (PV) power generation grows very rapidly in China. In order to ensure the reliability of PV generation and to maximize the usage of PV resources, it is usually necessary to configure the appropriate energy storage for the distributed PV generation. Based on the load characteristics of different electricity users, the energy storage capacity configuration is established from the interests of power users. The Generic Algorithm (GA) is introduced as the optimization methodology to find the target value to maximize the net present value. The results propose a reasonable energy storage configuration and the charging/discharging strategy. Finally, the effectiveness and feasibility of the proposed method are verified with an example of a regional distribution network in Jiangsu province. By taking the voltage fluctuation value as an index, the power flow calculation of the IEEE bus-33 system is carried out. The results show that the storage energy can improve the economic benefit of the planning scheme. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Energy storage; Genetic algorithm; Load characteristics; Optimal configuration; Photovoltaic generation

Authors: Liu Z., Wang Z., Ji N., Wang Y.
Title: Load shifting optimization strategy considering base station energy storage
Source title: CIEEC 2017 - Proceedings of 2017 China International Electrical and Energy Conference
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China
Authors with affiliations: Liu, Z., School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China; Wang, Z., School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China; Ji, N., School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China; Wang, Y., School of Electrical Engineering, Shandong University, Jinan, China
Abstract: The scale of existing communication base stations is large and each base station is equipped with standby energy storage. It is more effective for improving power system operation efficiency to make full use of base station energy storage (BSES). In this paper, a method using BSES to involve in power dispatching is proposed. Firstly, the operation mode of the base station power is introduced and the control strategy of BSES is proposed. Then, the BSES is utilized to participate in load shifting to prove the participation feasibility of large scale BSES in power scheduling. Finally, typical daily load curve of a region is taken as an example and genetic algorithm (GA) toolbox in MATLAB is employed to optimize the model. The results show that the participation of BSES can effectively shift peak load and bring great benefits to the grid. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Base station; Energy storage; Peak load shifting; Power dispatch; Standby power

Authors: Hongwei M., Meng Z., Xu F., Xia W.
Title: Study on coordinated charging control algorithm for plug-in electric vehicle based on energy internet
Source title: CIEEC 2017 - Proceedings of 2017 China International Electrical and Energy Conference
Affiliations: IEEE Conference Publishing, RandD Center, XJ Group Co. Ltd, Xu Chang, 461000, China
Authors with affiliations: Hongwei, M., IEEE Conference Publishing, RandD Center, XJ Group Co. Ltd, Xu Chang, 461000, China; Meng, Z., IEEE Conference Publishing, RandD Center, XJ Group Co. Ltd, Xu Chang, 461000, China; Xu, F., IEEE Conference Publishing, RandD Center, XJ Group Co. Ltd, Xu Chang, 461000, China; Xia, W., IEEE Conference Publishing, RandD Center, XJ Group Co. Ltd, Xu Chang, 461000, China
Abstract: At present, as an important part of the energy internet, plug-in electric vehicle has got more and more attention around the world. Although the plug-in electric vehicle has short mileage, charging inconvenience and other problems, it has real-time visible running state, convenient communication control, two-way control and other advantages to its great potential for development. And the energy internet is the important foundation to solve the future large-scale electric vehicles scattered and incoordination access to the distribution network and resource sharing. Therefore, how to use the energy internet control platform to response the guide of the peak-valley time-of-use (TOU) power price, and then optimizing the electric vehicle access to the grid charging and discharging, and to maximize the potential of electric vehicles energy storage, has important research significance. Based on the analysis of the present situation of the application of electric vehicles in the energy Internet, this paper proposes a cooperative charging algorithm combining the charging current and giving the preferential or compensated price. The objective function and the optimization model of the coordinated charging control algorithm are defined. Taking the electric vehicle charging station in a typical energy internet as an example, this paper combines the electric vehicle load forecasting curve and the time-of-use price curve to simulate the coordinated charge control algorithm proposed in this paper. The simulation results show that the algorithm can effectively stimulate the interaction between electric vehicle users and power grid and realize the functions of power system peak load filling and emergency power supply; so that electric vehicles become the service terminal in the energy internet, which improve the interactivity, friendliness, and economy of the energy internet. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Coordinated charging; Economic optimization control; Electric vehicle (EV); The energy internet

Authors: Xie B., Ji Y., Wang J., Wang H., Ma C.
Title: Modeling and control for a three-phase interleaved bidirectional DC-DC energy storage converter
Source title: CIEEC 2017 - Proceedings of 2017 China International Electrical and Energy Conference
Affiliations: School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; State Grid Fushun Electric Power Supply Company, Fushun, China
Authors with affiliations: Xie, B., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Ji, Y., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Wang, J., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Wang, H., School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Harbin Institute of Technology, Harbin, China; Ma, C., State Grid Fushun Electric Power Supply Company, Fushun, China
Abstract: In this paper, a bidirectional DC-DC energy storage converter based on interleaved technique is proposed, which can work on continuous charge/discharge mode having greatly enhanced reliability and accuracy for battery energy management. The small signal model of a three-phase interleaved bidirectional DC/DC converter in boost mode is built and analyzed. In order to get a more realistic model, this paper proposed a modeling method that takes the interaction of three-phase current into account. In boost mode, DC/DC converter is controlled to discharge the battery while maintaining the DC bus voltage. In order to reduce the ripple of discharge current, the control strategy consists of phase shift segment. Therefore, the discharge current fluctuation is thereby effectively reduced, which prolongs battery life. Finally, the simulation results demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed control strategy. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Battery energy storage system; Charge/discharge control; Interleaving bidirectional converter; Small signal model

Title: Big data and cloud computing platform for energy Internet

Abstract: Energy Internet is a developing trend of electrical power energy industry. The core message is to implement the next-generation of cyber-physical systems shaping future energy industry that is based on a deep merge of operational technology and internet information technology. The growth of energy internet is dependent on the availability of high performance computing and analytics technology to process a massive amount of data set. The paper discusses two core techniques that would support the growth of energy internet, big data and clouding computing, with a focus on the platform architecture that is particularly adaptive to handle a variety of characteristics of energy industry data. Finally, the paper summarizes and proposes a comprehensive, technical solution for energy big data and IoT cloud computing platform with applications focusing on energy consumption monitoring and complementary operation of multi-form energy system that support all aspects within a data lifetime cycle, e.g., acquisition, storage, analytics, and visualization. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Zheng H., Ma H., Ma K., Bo Z.
Title: Modeling and analysis of the AC/DC hybrid micro-grid with bidirectional power flow controller
Source title: CIEEC 2017 - Proceedings of 2017 China International Electrical and Energy Conference
Affiliations: Corporate R and D Center, XUJI Group, State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zheng, H., Corporate R and D Center, XUJI Group, State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, China; Ma, H., Corporate R and D Center, XUJI Group, State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, China; Ma, K., Corporate R and D Center, XUJI Group, State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, China; Bo, Z., Corporate R and D Center, XUJI Group, State Grid Corporation of China, Beijing, China
Abstract: With the increase of DC loads, the traditional AC micro-grids can not meet the demand of system load diversity and economy. In addition, the random, time-varying and nonlinear characteristics of the distributed generation (DG) make the DG modeling and algorithm realization relatively difficult, and the coordination and cooperation between DG and energy storage(ES) complex. This paper built a hybrid AC/DC micro-grid contains the DC distribution grid. The corresponding components of the physical model and control strategy were proposed. In the experiment, this paper focuses on the research of micro components under different working conditions. The results show that the proposed hybrid AC/DC micro-grid structure is reasonable, and the control strategy and performance of the components is good. The whole system has fast response speed, and can well satisfy the requirement of system security and stability. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Tseng S., Li J., Lee M., Wang B., Ji F., Bai B.
Title: A software defined energy storage: Architecture, topology, and reliability
Source title: CIEEC 2017 - Proceedings of 2017 China International Electrical and Energy Conference
Affiliations: Research and Development Dept., GCCAlliance Inc., Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Tseng, S., Research and Development Dept., GCCAlliance Inc., Beijing, China; Li, J., Research and Development Dept., GCCAlliance Inc., Beijing, China; Lee, M., Research and Development Dept., GCCAlliance Inc., Beijing, China; Wang, B., Research and Development Dept., GCCAlliance Inc., Beijing, China; Ji, F., Research and Development Dept., GCCAlliance Inc., Beijing, China; Bai, B., Research and Development Dept., GCCAlliance Inc., Beijing, China
Abstract: With the growth of renewable energy connecting to the grid, there is a demand for distributed and emerging energy storage technologies to be developed. Moreover, the fast demand of Cloud, Big Data, and Intelligent City industries demand that highly energy efficient Internet Data Center (IDC) to be flexible and have on-demand deployment for a sustainable profit business case. In the effort to make the energy storage management system independent of multiple battery technologies adopted, a new Software Defined Energy (SDE) storage technology is developed and applies the IDC operation. The SDE coupled with the IT equipment not only enables a new generation of highly reliable power system in IDC, but also provides the highly efficient IT power consumption solution. In this paper, a 3-layer topology architecture of the SDE solution is proposed, which consists of Energy Router, Micro dc-grid, and Energy Management Policy Server in the cloud based environment. The analytic reliability model of SDE is conducted and presented. The innovative approach is also applicable in the behind the meter, distributed energy storage and management systems for Industry and Community. © 2017 IEEE.

Title: A systemic scheme for improving microgrids' reliability under distribution network fault condition by adopting microgrids-interconnection
Source title: CIEEC 2017 - Proceedings of 2017 China International Electrical and Energy Conference
Affiliations: Power Grid Technology Center, Beijing Electric Power Research Institute, Beijing, China

Abstract: A systemic scheme of electric distribution network restoration using microgrids' interconnection is put forward in this paper. The quantitative feasibility analysis of the proposed scheme mainly contains the judgment based on the risk of low frequency and the discharging time limit of battery energy storage system (BESS). The automatic generation control (AGC) is also applied in the control of interconnection and two control modes, which are FFC-TBC (flat frequency control-tie-line bias frequency control) and TBC-TBC (tie-line bias frequency control-tie-line bias frequency control), based on different operation conditions are put forward. Finally, a simulation example developed in PSCAD/EMTDC proved the correctness and efficiency of the detailed restoration process and control strategy. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Zhang Y., Xia T., Guo Q., Xiong H., Zhao W., Sun R.
Title: Realization and application of PSASP-MATLAB associated mixed step simulation based on engine calling mode
Source title: CIEEC 2017 - Proceedings of 2017 China International Electrical and Energy Conference
Affiliations: Henan Electric Power Dispatching and Control Center, State Grid Corporation of China, Henan, China; Energy Internet Research Institute, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; State Key Lab of Control and Simulation of Power Systems and Generation Equipment, Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China
Authors with affiliations: Zhang, Y., Henan Electric Power Dispatching and Control Center, State Grid Corporation of China, Henan, China; Xia, T., Energy Internet Research Institute, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Guo, Q., State Key Lab of Control and Simulation of Power Systems and Generation Equipment, Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Xiong, H., Henan Electric Power Dispatching and Control Center, State Grid Corporation of China, Henan, China; Zhao, W., State Key Lab of Control and Simulation of Power Systems and Generation Equipment, Department of Electrical Engineering, Tsinghua University, Beijing, China; Sun, R., Henan Electric Power Dispatching and Control Center, State Grid Corporation of China, Henan, China
Abstract: By calling MATLAB calculation engine function library, associated simulation between Power System Analysis Software Package (PSASP) and MATLAB can be realized in parallel and serial ways. MATLAB could use different timing sequence from PSASP, and mixed step simulation can be realized. This calculation method was used in a 10-nodes power system case for the modeling and simulation of Automatic Voltage Regulator (AVR), and the correctness of the proposed approach is verified. On this foundation, the electromechanical transient model of Static Var Generator (SVG) was founded with MATLAB/Simulink, and it is of universal applicability and transplantability. The inner inverter model can also be used in general grid-connection simulating models of wind power generator, photovoltaic generation, energy storage, etc. Furthermore, simulation and analysis for grid-connected wind farm by introducing the SVG model into PSASP were carried out via the proposed associated simulation method above, and the correctness of the model is verified via the calculation results. The research results can be used to do assistant analysis for reactive voltage of grid-connected new energy power generation. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Kusmantoro A., Priyadi A., Purnomo M.H.
Title: Voltage stability in DC micro grid by controlling two battery units with hybrid network systems
Source title: 2018 5th International Conference on Industrial Engineering and Applications, ICIEA 2018
Affiliations: Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Institut Teknologi Sepuluh Nopember, Surabaya, Indonesia; Dept.of Electrical Engineering, Universitas PGRI Semarang, Semarang, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kusmantoro, A., Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Institut Teknologi Sepuluh Nopember, Surabaya, Indonesia, Dept.of Electrical Engineering, Universitas PGRI Semarang, Semarang, Indonesia; Priyadi, A., Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Institut Teknologi Sepuluh Nopember, Surabaya, Indonesia; Purnomo, M.H., Dept. of Electrical Engineering, Institut Teknologi Sepuluh Nopember, Surabaya, Indonesia
Abstract: In DC network systems micro grid battery storage units are used to assist the main source of renewable energy (PV array) in providing stable voltage on the DC bus. Micro grid storage systems play an important role in providing services on demand. The lithium-ion batteries are used in this design, because these batteries have high energy density. In the micro-grid design is used three units of PV arrays and each unit consists of two PV arrays and two batteries. Battery units are used for storage of PV array sources and single phase gird AC. The PV array unit provides 22.8 V output voltage and the battery unit provides 22.78 V output voltage. Boost converter increases the voltage of the PV array and battery unit to a DC bus of 48 V. The PID controller is effectively used boost converter in raising or lowering the voltage. The advantage of using two battery storage systems is that if one unit is not sufficient to provide a voltage to the DC bus, then the battery unit on the AC grid side will also rapidly provide a voltage to the DC bus. © 2018 IEEE.

Abstract: Solar Photovoltaic (PV) Technology is widely adopted electricity generation alternative due to its huge potential in harnessing solar energy as a renewable, reliable and sustainable source of electricity. Nepal receives around 300 days of sunshine in a year and possesses huge potential of hosting Grid Connected PV plants in Nepal's national grid which is primarily dominated by hydropower. This paper presents the technical details of proposed GCPV Project, based in Upper Mustang Region of Nepal, and discusses the challenges and their possible mitigating measures for such system in Nepalese Context. Further, buffer storage type GCPV is also analyzed to address the problem of power and frequency fluctuation caused by grid-integration of such system. © 2017 IEEE.

Authors: Liang R., Zhong Y., Xia Q.
Title: Energy-saved data transfer model for mobile devices in cloudlet computing environment
Source title: 2018 3rd IEEE International Conference on Cloud Computing and Big Data Analysis, ICCCBDA 2018
Affiliations: College of Mathmatics and Informatics, South China Agricultural University, Guangzhou, China; Department of Computer, Guangdong AIB Polytechnic College, Guangzhou, China

Abstract: Mobile Cloud Computing (MCC) integrates the smart phones with the cloud computing technologies, which has resolved the problems of limited storage capacity, battery lifetime and processing capability of the mobile phones. In current mobile applications, mobile devices often require data uploading and downloading tasks with the cloud server. However, connecting mobile devices with the remote cloud servers, suffers from the huge transmission energy consumption especially when using 3G/4G/LTE connections. In this paper, we present a cloudlet based energy-saved data transfer model (EDTM), which focuses on reducing the power consumption of mobile devices while using MCC. And the data upload and download operation process which support users mobility scenarios are given. We hope the proposed data transfer model provides future mobile cloudlet computing research with a guideline and theoretical supports. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Waseem M., Saeed L., Khan M.Y.A., Saleem J., Majid A.
Title: A multi input multi output bidirectional DC-DC boost converter with backup battery port
Source title: Proceedings - 2018, IEEE 1st International Conference on Power, Energy and Smart Grid, ICPESG 2018
Affiliations: Department of Electrical Engineering, Comsats Institute of Information Technology, Abbottabad, Pakistan
Authors with affiliations: Waseem, M., Department of Electrical Engineering, Comsats Institute of Information Technology, Abbottabad, Pakistan; Saeed, L., Department of Electrical Engineering, Comsats Institute of Information Technology, Abbottabad, Pakistan; Khan, M.Y.A., Department of Electrical Engineering, Comsats Institute of Information Technology, Abbottabad, Pakistan; Saleem, J., Department of Electrical Engineering, Comsats Institute of Information Technology, Abbottabad, Pakistan; Majid, A., Department of Electrical Engineering, Comsats Institute of Information Technology, Abbottabad, Pakistan
Abstract: Renewable energy resources and storage devices pave way for the future. Most renewable sources (photovoltaic panels) generate low level voltage while the load demands high voltage levels. The use of converters become essential for voltage gain. Multiple-input multiple-output (MIMO) converters are obtaining tremendous acclaim worldwide due to their compact size, higher efficiencies and convenience. This paper proposes a novel MIMO DC-DC converter with bidirectional port for battery charging application. Converter supports six ports: three-inputs and three-outputs. Proposed topology is simulated using Matlab Simulink and the output results are plotted in this paper. Hardware prototype of the simulation is also designed and output oscilloscope results are also shown in this paper. The drawn conclusions for the simulation and hardwre results are discussed in detail. © 2018 IEEE.

Authors: Hohne P.A., Kusakana K., Numbi B.P.
Title: Operation cost and energy usage minimization of a hybrid solar/electrical water heating system
Source title: 2018 International Conference on the Domestic Use of Energy, DUE 2018
Affiliations: Central University of Technology, Private Bag X20539, Bloemfontein, 9300, South Africa; Centre for the Development of Green Technologies, Department of Electrical Engineering, Mangosuthu University of Technology, 511 Mangosuthu Highway, Umlazi, 4031, Jacobs, Durban, 4026, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Hohne, P.A., Central University of Technology, Private Bag X20539, Bloemfontein, 9300, South Africa; Kusakana, K., Central University of Technology, Private Bag X20539, Bloemfontein, 9300, South Africa; Numbi, B.P., Centre for the Development of Green Technologies, Department of Electrical Engineering, Mangosuthu University of Technology, 511 Mangosuthu Highway, Umlazi, 4031, Jacobs, Durban, 4026, South Africa
Abstract: Approximately 40% to 60 % of the total energy consumed by a traditional household in South Africa can be allocated to the heating of water. Furthermore, most of water heating takes place during peak electricity consumption periods, where electricity costs are highest. In this paper, the optimal energy management of a hybrid solar electric water heater (HSWH) is presented. The hybrid system consists of an indirect flat plate collector coupled to an electric storage tank water heater (ESTWH). The electric resistive element inside the storage tank water heater serves only as an auxiliary heater when solar irradiance is insufficient. A typical medium density household within the Mangaung municipality area in the city of Bloemfontein, South Africa is considered. The aim is to evaluate if an optimal control approach can be used to effectively shift the energy usage profile of the system under the residential Time-of-Use (TOU) tariff enforced by the electricity supplier, while maintaining a comfortable thermal level of the hot water user. The secondary aim is to reduce the energy required to increase the thermal level of the water compared to a baseline water heater. The proposed water heating system with optimal control is modelled and simulated using Matlab OPTI-Toolbox. The control variable was successfully solved with switching taking place during off-peak periods while maintaining the desired temperature of the hot water consumer. © 2018 Cape Peninsula University of technology.

Authors: Mawire A.
Title: Radial discharging thermal characteristics of a small domestic oil storage tank
Source title: 2018 International Conference on the Domestic Use of Energy, DUE 2018
Affiliations: North West University, Department of Physics and Electronics, Private Bag X2046, Mmabatho, 2745, South Africa
Authors with affiliations: Mawire, A., North West University, Department of Physics and Electronics, Private Bag X2046, Mmabatho, 2745, South Africa
Abstract: Discharging radial thermal profiles of a 40 litre domestic oil storage tank are presented. Low (0.6 L/min) and high (1.7 L/min) flow-rates are used to discharge the oil storage tank. Radial temperature distribution results for both flow-rates show that the temperature slightly increases radially from the tank inner wall to a maximum value which occurs at around 80 mm from the tank inner wall. After this increment, the temperature decreases as the radial distance increases. The higher flow-rate eliminates the initial radial temperature rise at the bottom of the storage tank seen with the low flow-rate due an increase in the axial heat transfer rate. Radial stratification number profiles show that radial thermal energy flow increases as the fluid flows down axially from the top to the bottom of the storage tank. The higher flow-rate results in more axial thermal heat transfer at the expense of increasing radial thermal energy dispersion in the middle and bottom sections of the storage tank. © 2018 Cape Peninsula University of technology.
Author Keywords: discharging; domestic; oil storage tank; radial; thermal stratification
Index Keywords: Flow rate; Heat transfer; Thermal energy; Thermal stratification; discharging; domestic; Oil storage tank; radial; Radial temperature distribution; Temperature decrease; Thermal characteristics; Thermal energy flow; Tanks (containers)

Title: Using PCMs to store solar energy (April 2018)
Source title: 2018 International Conference on the Domestic Use of Energy, DUE 2018

Abstract: This paper focuses on results of an experimental investigation to study the melting and solidification processes of paraffin wax, a phase change material (PCM), used to store heat energy in a shell-helical coiled tube heat exchanger system. The PCM is stored in a cylindrical space which also contains a coiled tube through which the heat transfer fluid HTF (water) flows. Different paraffin waxes (Ributherm RT25, RT 28, and RT35) have been used as PCMs because of their high energy storage density, availability and relatively low cost. A series of experiments were conducted to test the rate of heat absorption and release of the paraffin waxes. Results indicate that the heat transfer stored using PCMs is dependent on the circulation flow rate of the water in the helical coiled tube. The performance of the system when using a shell-single concentric helical coil heat exchanger is found more effective when compared to the one using a shell-single straight pipe heat exchanger. © 2018 Cape Peninsula University of technology.

Title: Study on synergetic control for ultracapacitor/battery hybrid energy storage of wind/solar power system

Authors: Schulte R., Schaefer E., Van Leeuwen R.
Title: Smart control of a future micro-grid in olst
Source title: e-Energy 2018 - Proceedings of the 9th ACM International Conference on Future Energy Systems
Affiliations: Saxion University of Applied Sciences, Enschede, Overijssel, Netherlands
Authors with affiliations: Schulte, R., Saxion University of Applied Sciences, Enschede, Overijssel, Netherlands; Schaefer, E., Saxion University of Applied Sciences, Enschede, Overijssel, Netherlands; Van Leeuwen, R., Saxion University of Applied Sciences, Enschede, Overijssel, Netherlands
Abstract: Due to the growing influence of sustainable energy sources, fluctuations in supply peaks are increasing, and thus, an imbalance in the grid may occur. This paper uses a basic smart control and battery algorithm to deal with these energy flow issues on a micro-grid level. Furthermore, a realistic model of a neighborhood located in Olst, the Netherlands is created in order to demonstrate the impact of smart control and battery storage in a practical setting. This model consists of PV generation, a washing machine, dishwasher together with various other devices which are assumed uncontrollable, as well as a grid connection. Three different scenarios were investigated to determine the effectiveness of the smart control algorithm and battery storage in terms of self-consumption, self-sufficiency and peak reduction. The results are shown by means of simulation and indicate a significant increase in self-consumption, self-sufficiency and peak reduction. © 2018 Association for Computing Machinery.

Title: PSO based economic dispatch of a hybrid microgrid system
Source title: EPSCICON 2018 - 4th International Conference on Power, Signals, Control and Computation
Affiliations: Department of Energy, Environment and Climate Change, Asian Institute of Technology, Pathumthani, Thailand
Authors with affiliations: Nivedha, R.R., Department of Energy, Environment and Climate Change, Asian Institute of Technology, Pathumthani, Thailand; Singh, J.G., Department of Energy, Environment and Climate Change, Asian Institute of Technology, Pathumthani, Thailand; Ongsakul, W., Department of Energy, Environment and Climate Change, Asian Institute of Technology, Pathumthani, Thailand
Abstract: Microgrid is becoming very popular by addition of renewable generation for producing and supplying adequate power in remote areas. The focus is to design cost-effective hybrid microgrid system with renewable source such as wind combined hydrogen based storage system. The proposed system uses wind turbine for producing power which will meet out the demand. An electrolyser absorbs the excess power from the wind turbine. If there is excess hydrogen from electrolyser, the hydrogen tank stores the excess hydrogen. When power demand is not met by wind, power to the grid is supplied by fuel cell. Diesel generators(DG) are used to support the system when the demand is not met by fuel cell. Assumed that, wind turbine power is free of cost. When rated power is below the actual power, the DG picks up to provide power support to the system. © 2018 IEEE.
